built with pdoc

fermatrica.optim.pygad

Genetic Algorithm to optimise outer layer of the model.

Derived from https://github.com/ahmedfgad/GeneticAlgorithmPython with some changes.

The main goal of this "fork" is to adapt algo for multiprocessing and arguments for objective function. As the original library is under development the issues mentioned could some time go away, and then we are hope to switch back to the original library. Maybe.

This file has the specific license, different form the license of the other source code of the whole project and is redistributed under BSD-3-Clause License:

" Copyright GeneticAlgorithmPython Contributors

Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

  1. Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

  2. Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.

  3. Neither the name of the copyright holder nor the names of its contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from this software without specific prior written permission.

THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. "

   1"""
   2Genetic Algorithm to optimise outer layer of the model.
   3
   4Derived from https://github.com/ahmedfgad/GeneticAlgorithmPython with some changes.
   5
   6The main goal of this "fork" is to adapt algo for multiprocessing and arguments for objective function.
   7As the original library is under development the issues mentioned could some time go away,
   8and then we are hope to switch back to the original library. Maybe.
   9
  10-----------------------------------------------
  11
  12This file has the specific license, different form the license of the other source code of the whole project
  13and is redistributed under BSD-3-Clause License:
  14
  15"
  16Copyright GeneticAlgorithmPython Contributors
  17
  18Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
  19modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are
  20met:
  21
  221. Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright
  23   notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.
  24
  252. Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright
  26   notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the
  27   documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.
  28
  293. Neither the name of the copyright holder nor the names of its
  30   contributors may be used to endorse or promote products derived from
  31   this software without specific prior written permission.
  32
  33THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDERS AND CONTRIBUTORS
  34"AS IS" AND ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
  35LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A
  36PARTICULAR PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT
  37HOLDER OR CONTRIBUTORS BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL,
  38SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
  39PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
  40PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY THEORY OF
  41LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR TORT (INCLUDING
  42NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF THE USE OF THIS
  43SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
  44"
  45"""
  46
  47
  48from functools import partial
  49import ipyparallel.serialize.codeutil
  50import numpy
  51import random
  52import matplotlib.pyplot
  53import multiprocessing
  54import pickle
  55import time
  56import warnings
  57import concurrent.futures
  58
  59
  60class GA:
  61    supported_int_types = [int, numpy.int8, numpy.int16, numpy.int32, numpy.int64, numpy.uint, numpy.uint8,
  62                           numpy.uint16, numpy.uint32, numpy.uint64]
  63    supported_float_types = [float, numpy.float16, numpy.float32, numpy.float64]
  64    supported_int_float_types = supported_int_types + supported_float_types
  65
  66    def __init__(self,
  67                 num_generations,
  68                 num_parents_mating,
  69                 fitness_func,
  70                 args=None,
  71                 initial_population=None,
  72                 sol_per_pop=None,
  73                 num_genes=None,
  74                 init_range_low=-4,
  75                 init_range_high=4,
  76                 gene_type=float,
  77                 parent_selection_type="sss",
  78                 keep_parents=-1,
  79                 keep_elitism=1,
  80                 K_tournament=3,
  81                 crossover_type="single_point",
  82                 crossover_probability=None,
  83                 mutation_type="random",
  84                 mutation_probability=None,
  85                 mutation_by_replacement=False,
  86                 mutation_percent_genes='default',
  87                 mutation_num_genes=None,
  88                 random_mutation_min_val=-1.0,
  89                 random_mutation_max_val=1.0,
  90                 gene_space=None,
  91                 allow_duplicate_genes=True,
  92                 on_start=None,
  93                 on_fitness=None,
  94                 on_parents=None,
  95                 on_crossover=None,
  96                 on_mutation=None,
  97                 callback_generation=None,
  98                 on_generation=None,
  99                 on_stop=None,
 100                 delay_after_gen=0.0,
 101                 save_best_solutions=False,
 102                 save_solutions=False,
 103                 suppress_warnings=False,
 104                 stop_criteria=None,
 105                 ftol_abs=0.0,
 106                 parallel_processing=None,
 107                 random_seed=None):
 108
 109        """
 110        The constructor of the GA class accepts all parameters required to create an instance of the GA class. It validates such parameters.
 111
 112        num_generations: Number of generations.
 113        num_parents_mating: Number of solutions to be selected as parents in the mating pool.
 114
 115        fitness_func: Accepts a function that must accept 2 parameters (a single solution and its index in the population) and return the fitness value of the solution. Available starting from PyGAD 1.0.17 until 1.0.20 with a single parameter representing the solution. Changed in PyGAD 2.0.0 and higher to include the second parameter representing the solution index.
 116
 117        initial_population: A user-defined initial population. It is useful when the user wants to start the generations with a custom initial population. It defaults to None which means no initial population is specified by the user. In this case, PyGAD creates an initial population using the 'sol_per_pop' and 'num_genes' parameters. An exception is raised if the 'initial_population' is None while any of the 2 parameters ('sol_per_pop' or 'num_genes') is also None.
 118        sol_per_pop: Number of solutions in the population.
 119        num_genes: Number of parameters in the function.
 120
 121        init_range_low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher.
 122        init_range_high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.
 123        # It is OK to set the value of any of the 2 parameters ('init_range_low' and 'init_range_high') to be equal, higher or lower than the other parameter (i.e. init_range_low is not needed to be lower than init_range_high).
 124
 125        gene_type: The type of the gene. It is assigned to any of these types (int, float, numpy.int, numpy.int8, numpy.int16, numpy.int32, numpy.int64, numpy.uint, numpy.uint8, numpy.uint16, numpy.uint32, numpy.uint64, numpy.float, numpy.float16, numpy.float32, numpy.float64) and forces all the genes to be of that type.
 126
 127        parent_selection_type: Type of parent selection.
 128        keep_parents: If 0, this means no parent in the current population will be used in the next population. If -1, this means all parents in the current population will be used in the next population. If set to a value > 0, then the specified value refers to the number of parents in the current population to be used in the next population. Some parent selection operators such as rank selection, favor population diversity and therefore keeping the parents in the next generation can be beneficial. However, some other parent selection operators, such as roulette wheel selection (RWS), have higher selection pressure and keeping more than one parent in the next generation can seriously harm population diversity. This parameter have an effect only when the keep_elitism parameter is 0. Thanks to Prof. Fernando Jimnez Barrionuevo (http://webs.um.es/fernan) for editing this sentence.
 129        K_tournament: When the value of 'parent_selection_type' is 'tournament', the 'K_tournament' parameter specifies the number of solutions from which a parent is selected randomly.
 130
 131        keep_elitism: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It can take the value 0 or a positive integer that satisfies (0 <= keep_elitism <= sol_per_pop). It defaults to 1 which means only the best solution in the current generation is kept in the next generation. If assigned 0, this means it has no effect. If assigned a positive integer K, then the best K solutions are kept in the next generation. It cannot be assigned a value greater than the value assigned to the sol_per_pop parameter. If this parameter has a value different than 0, then the keep_parents parameter will have no effect.
 132
 133        crossover_type: Type of the crossover opreator. If  crossover_type=None, then the crossover step is bypassed which means no crossover is applied and thus no offspring will be created in the next generations. The next generation will use the solutions in the current population.
 134        crossover_probability: The probability of selecting a solution for the crossover operation. If the solution probability is <= crossover_probability, the solution is selected. The value must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
 135
 136        mutation_type: Type of the mutation opreator. If mutation_type=None, then the mutation step is bypassed which means no mutation is applied and thus no changes are applied to the offspring created using the crossover operation. The offspring will be used unchanged in the next generation.
 137        mutation_probability: The probability of selecting a gene for the mutation operation. If the gene probability is <= mutation_probability, the gene is selected. It accepts either a single value for fixed mutation or a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of 2 values for adaptive mutation. The values must be between 0 and 1 inclusive. If specified, then no need for the 2 parameters mutation_percent_genes and mutation_num_genes.
 138
 139        mutation_by_replacement: An optional bool parameter. It works only when the selected type of mutation is random (mutation_type="random"). In this case, setting mutation_by_replacement=True means replace the gene by the randomly generated value. If False, then it has no effect and random mutation works by adding the random value to the gene.
 140
 141        mutation_percent_genes: Percentage of genes to mutate which defaults to the string 'default' which means 10%. This parameter has no action if any of the 2 parameters mutation_probability or mutation_num_genes exist.
 142        mutation_num_genes: Number of genes to mutate which defaults to None. If the parameter mutation_num_genes exists, then no need for the parameter mutation_percent_genes. This parameter has no action if the mutation_probability parameter exists.
 143        random_mutation_min_val: The minimum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to -1.0.
 144        random_mutation_max_val: The maximum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to 1.0.
 145
 146        gene_space: It accepts a list of all possible values of the gene. This list is used in the mutation step. Should be used only if the gene space is a set of discrete values. No need for the 2 parameters (random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val) if the parameter gene_space exists. Added in PyGAD 2.5.0. In PyGAD 2.11.0, the gene_space can be assigned a dict.
 147
 148        on_start: Accepts a function to be called only once before the genetic algorithm starts its evolution. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 149        on_fitness: Accepts a function to be called after calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the population. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of all solutions' fitness values. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 150        on_parents: Accepts a function to be called after selecting the parents that mates. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the selected parents. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 151        on_crossover: Accepts a function to be called each time the crossover operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring generated using crossover. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 152        on_mutation: Accepts a function to be called each time the mutation operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring after applying the mutation. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 153        callback_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Starting from PyGAD 2.6.0, the callback_generation parameter is deprecated and should be replaced by the on_generation parameter.
 154        on_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 155        on_stop: Accepts a function to be called only once exactly before the genetic algorithm stops or when it completes all the generations. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of fitness values of the last population's solutions. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 156
 157        delay_after_gen: Added in PyGAD 2.4.0. It accepts a non-negative number specifying the number of seconds to wait after a generation completes and before going to the next generation. It defaults to 0.0 which means no delay after the generation.
 158
 159        save_best_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.9.0 and its type is bool. If True, then the best solution in each generation is saved into the 'best_solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations or the number of genes is large.
 160        save_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0 and its type is bool. If True, then all solutions in each generation are saved into the 'solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations, number of genes, or number of solutions in population is large.
 161
 162        suppress_warnings: Added in PyGAD 2.10.0 and its type is bool. If True, then no warning messages will be displayed. It defaults to False.
 163
 164        allow_duplicate_genes: Added in PyGAD 2.13.0. If True, then a solution/chromosome may have duplicate gene values. If False, then each gene will have a unique value in its solution.
 165
 166        stop_criteria: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0. It is assigned to some criteria to stop the evolution if at least one criterion holds.
 167
 168        parallel_processing: Added in PyGAD 2.17.0. Defaults to `None` which means no parallel processing is used. If a positive integer is assigned, it specifies the number of threads to be used. If a list or a tuple of exactly 2 elements is assigned, then: 1) The first element can be either "process" or "thread" to specify whether processes or threads are used, respectively. 2) The second element can be: 1) A positive integer to select the maximum number of processes or threads to be used. 2) 0 to indicate that parallel processing is not used. This is identical to setting 'parallel_processing=None'. 3) None to use the default value as calculated by the concurrent.futures module.
 169
 170        random_seed: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It defines the random seed to be used by the random function generators (we use random functions in the NumPy and random modules). This helps to reproduce the same results by setting the same random seed.
 171        """
 172
 173        self.random_seed = random_seed
 174        if random_seed is None:
 175            pass
 176        else:
 177            numpy.random.seed(self.random_seed)
 178            random.seed(self.random_seed)
 179
 180        # If suppress_warnings is bool and its valud is False, then print warning messages.
 181        if type(suppress_warnings) is bool:
 182            self.suppress_warnings = suppress_warnings
 183        else:
 184            self.valid_parameters = False
 185            raise TypeError(
 186                "The expected type of the 'suppress_warnings' parameter is bool but {suppress_warnings_type} found.".format(
 187                    suppress_warnings_type=type(suppress_warnings)))
 188
 189        # Validating mutation_by_replacement
 190        if not (type(mutation_by_replacement) is bool):
 191            self.valid_parameters = False
 192            raise TypeError(
 193                "The expected type of the 'mutation_by_replacement' parameter is bool but ({mutation_by_replacement_type}) found.".format(
 194                    mutation_by_replacement_type=type(mutation_by_replacement)))
 195
 196        self.mutation_by_replacement = mutation_by_replacement
 197
 198        # Validate gene_space
 199        self.gene_space_nested = False
 200        if type(gene_space) is type(None):
 201            pass
 202        elif type(gene_space) in [list, tuple, range, numpy.ndarray]:
 203            if len(gene_space) == 0:
 204                self.valid_parameters = False
 205                raise ValueError("'gene_space' cannot be empty (i.e. its length must be >= 0).")
 206            else:
 207                for index, el in enumerate(gene_space):
 208                    if type(el) in [list, tuple, range, numpy.ndarray]:
 209                        if len(el) == 0:
 210                            self.valid_parameters = False
 211                            raise ValueError(
 212                                "The element indexed {index} of 'gene_space' with type {el_type} cannot be empty (i.e. its length must be >= 0).".format(
 213                                    index=index, el_type=type(el)))
 214                        else:
 215                            for val in el:
 216                                if not (type(val) in [type(None)] + GA.supported_int_float_types):
 217                                    raise TypeError(
 218                                        "All values in the sublists inside the 'gene_space' attribute must be numeric of type int/float/None but ({val}) of type {typ} found.".format(
 219                                            val=val, typ=type(val)))
 220                        self.gene_space_nested = True
 221                    elif type(el) == type(None):
 222                        pass
 223                        # self.gene_space_nested = True
 224                    elif type(el) is dict:
 225                        if len(el.items()) == 2:
 226                            if ('low' in el.keys()) and ('high' in el.keys()):
 227                                pass
 228                            else:
 229                                self.valid_parameters = False
 230                                raise ValueError(
 231                                    "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 232                                        gene_space_dict_keys=el.keys()))
 233                        elif len(el.items()) == 3:
 234                            if ('low' in el.keys()) and ('high' in el.keys()) and ('step' in el.keys()):
 235                                pass
 236                            else:
 237                                self.valid_parameters = False
 238                                raise ValueError(
 239                                    "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 240                                        gene_space_dict_keys=el.keys()))
 241                        else:
 242                            self.valid_parameters = False
 243                            raise ValueError(
 244                                "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it must have only 2 items but ({num_items}) items found.".format(
 245                                    num_items=len(el.items())))
 246                        self.gene_space_nested = True
 247                    elif not (type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types):
 248                        self.valid_parameters = False
 249                        raise TypeError(
 250                            "Unexpected type {el_type} for the element indexed {index} of 'gene_space'. The accepted types are list/tuple/range/numpy.ndarray of numbers, a single number (int/float), or None.".format(
 251                                index=index, el_type=type(el)))
 252
 253        elif type(gene_space) is dict:
 254            if len(gene_space.items()) == 2:
 255                if ('low' in gene_space.keys()) and ('high' in gene_space.keys()):
 256                    pass
 257                else:
 258                    self.valid_parameters = False
 259                    raise ValueError(
 260                        "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have only the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 261                            gene_space_dict_keys=gene_space.keys()))
 262            elif len(gene_space.items()) == 3:
 263                if ('low' in gene_space.keys()) and ('high' in gene_space.keys()) and ('step' in gene_space.keys()):
 264                    pass
 265                else:
 266                    self.valid_parameters = False
 267                    raise ValueError(
 268                        "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have only the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 269                            gene_space_dict_keys=gene_space.keys()))
 270            else:
 271                self.valid_parameters = False
 272                raise ValueError(
 273                    "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it must have only 2 items but ({num_items}) items found.".format(
 274                        num_items=len(gene_space.items())))
 275
 276        else:
 277            self.valid_parameters = False
 278            raise TypeError(
 279                "The expected type of 'gene_space' is list, tuple, range, or numpy.ndarray but ({gene_space_type}) found.".format(
 280                    gene_space_type=type(gene_space)))
 281
 282        self.gene_space = gene_space
 283
 284        # Validate init_range_low and init_range_high
 285        if type(init_range_low) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 286            if type(init_range_high) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 287                self.init_range_low = init_range_low
 288                self.init_range_high = init_range_high
 289            else:
 290                self.valid_parameters = False
 291                raise ValueError(
 292                    "The value passed to the 'init_range_high' parameter must be either integer or floating-point number but the value ({init_range_high_value}) of type {init_range_high_type} found.".format(
 293                        init_range_high_value=init_range_high, init_range_high_type=type(init_range_high)))
 294        else:
 295            self.valid_parameters = False
 296            raise ValueError(
 297                "The value passed to the 'init_range_low' parameter must be either integer or floating-point number but the value ({init_range_low_value}) of type {init_range_low_type} found.".format(
 298                    init_range_low_value=init_range_low, init_range_low_type=type(init_range_low)))
 299
 300        # Validate random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val
 301        if type(random_mutation_min_val) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 302            if type(random_mutation_max_val) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 303                if random_mutation_min_val == random_mutation_max_val:
 304                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 305                        "The values of the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val' are equal and this causes a fixed change to all genes.")
 306            else:
 307                self.valid_parameters = False
 308                raise TypeError(
 309                    "The expected type of the 'random_mutation_max_val' parameter is numeric but ({random_mutation_max_val_type}) found.".format(
 310                        random_mutation_max_val_type=type(random_mutation_max_val)))
 311        else:
 312            self.valid_parameters = False
 313            raise TypeError(
 314                "The expected type of the 'random_mutation_min_val' parameter is numeric but ({random_mutation_min_val_type}) found.".format(
 315                    random_mutation_min_val_type=type(random_mutation_min_val)))
 316        self.random_mutation_min_val = random_mutation_min_val
 317        self.random_mutation_max_val = random_mutation_max_val
 318
 319        # Validate gene_type
 320        if gene_type in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 321            self.gene_type = [gene_type, None]
 322            self.gene_type_single = True
 323        # A single data type of float with precision.
 324        elif len(gene_type) == 2 and gene_type[0] in GA.supported_float_types and (
 325                type(gene_type[1]) in GA.supported_int_types or gene_type[1] is None):
 326            self.gene_type = gene_type
 327            self.gene_type_single = True
 328        elif type(gene_type) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 329            if not len(gene_type) == num_genes:
 330                self.valid_parameters = False
 331                raise ValueError(
 332                    "When the parameter 'gene_type' is nested, then it can be either [float, int<precision>] or with length equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, value {gene_type_val} with len(gene_type) ({len_gene_type}) != len(num_genes) ({num_genes}) found.".format(
 333                        gene_type_val=gene_type, len_gene_type=len(gene_type), num_genes=num_genes))
 334            for gene_type_idx, gene_type_val in enumerate(gene_type):
 335                if gene_type_val in GA.supported_float_types:
 336                    # If the gene type is float and no precision is passed, set it to None.
 337                    gene_type[gene_type_idx] = [gene_type_val, None]
 338                elif gene_type_val in GA.supported_int_types:
 339                    gene_type[gene_type_idx] = [gene_type_val, None]
 340                elif type(gene_type_val) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 341                    # A float type is expected in a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of length 2.
 342                    if len(gene_type_val) == 2:
 343                        if gene_type_val[0] in GA.supported_float_types:
 344                            if type(gene_type_val[1]) in GA.supported_int_types:
 345                                pass
 346                            else:
 347                                self.valid_parameters = False
 348                                raise TypeError(
 349                                    "In the 'gene_type' parameter, the precision for float gene data types must be an integer but the element {gene_type_val} at index {gene_type_idx} has a precision of {gene_type_precision_val} with type {gene_type_type} .".format(
 350                                        gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_precision_val=gene_type_val[1],
 351                                        gene_type_type=gene_type_val[0], gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 352                        else:
 353                            self.valid_parameters = False
 354                            raise TypeError(
 355                                "In the 'gene_type' parameter, a precision is expected only for float gene data types but the element {gene_type} found at index {gene_type_idx}. Note that the data type must be at index 0 followed by precision at index 1.".format(
 356                                    gene_type=gene_type_val, gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 357                    else:
 358                        self.valid_parameters = False
 359                        raise ValueError(
 360                            "In the 'gene_type' parameter, a precision is specified in a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of length 2 but value ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} with length {gene_type_length} found at index {gene_type_idx}.".format(
 361                                gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_type=type(gene_type_val),
 362                                gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx, gene_type_length=len(gene_type_val)))
 363                else:
 364                    self.valid_parameters = False
 365                    raise ValueError(
 366                        "When a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is assigned to the 'gene_type' parameter, then its elements must be of integer, floating-point, list, tuple, or numpy.ndarray data types but the value ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} found at index {gene_type_idx}.".format(
 367                            gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_type=type(gene_type_val),
 368                            gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 369            self.gene_type = gene_type
 370            self.gene_type_single = False
 371        else:
 372            self.valid_parameters = False
 373            raise ValueError(
 374                "The value passed to the 'gene_type' parameter must be either a single integer, floating-point, list, tuple, or numpy.ndarray but ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} found.".format(
 375                    gene_type_val=gene_type, gene_type_type=type(gene_type)))
 376
 377        # Build the initial population
 378        if initial_population is None:
 379            if (sol_per_pop is None) or (num_genes is None):
 380                self.valid_parameters = False
 381                raise TypeError(
 382                    "Error creating the initial population\n\nWhen the parameter initial_population is None, then neither of the 2 parameters sol_per_pop and num_genes can be None at the same time.\nThere are 2 options to prepare the initial population:\n1) Create an initial population and assign it to the initial_population parameter. In this case, the values of the 2 parameters sol_per_pop and num_genes will be deduced.\n2) Allow the genetic algorithm to create the initial population automatically by passing valid integer values to the sol_per_pop and num_genes parameters.")
 383            elif (type(sol_per_pop) is int) and (type(num_genes) is int):
 384                # Validating the number of solutions in the population (sol_per_pop)
 385                if sol_per_pop <= 0:
 386                    self.valid_parameters = False
 387                    raise ValueError(
 388                        "The number of solutions in the population (sol_per_pop) must be > 0 but ({sol_per_pop}) found. \nThe following parameters must be > 0: \n1) Population size (i.e. number of solutions per population) (sol_per_pop).\n2) Number of selected parents in the mating pool (num_parents_mating).\n".format(
 389                            sol_per_pop=sol_per_pop))
 390                # Validating the number of gene.
 391                if (num_genes <= 0):
 392                    self.valid_parameters = False
 393                    raise ValueError(
 394                        "The number of genes cannot be <= 0 but ({num_genes}) found.\n".format(num_genes=num_genes))
 395                # When initial_population=None and the 2 parameters sol_per_pop and num_genes have valid integer values, then the initial population is created.
 396                # Inside the initialize_population() method, the initial_population attribute is assigned to keep the initial population accessible.
 397                self.num_genes = num_genes  # Number of genes in the solution.
 398
 399                # In case the 'gene_space' parameter is nested, then make sure the number of its elements equals to the number of genes.
 400                if self.gene_space_nested:
 401                    if len(gene_space) != self.num_genes:
 402                        self.valid_parameters = False
 403                        raise ValueError(
 404                            "When the parameter 'gene_space' is nested, then its length must be equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, length of gene_space ({len_gene_space}) != num_genes ({num_genes})".format(
 405                                len_gene_space=len(gene_space), num_genes=self.num_genes))
 406
 407                self.sol_per_pop = sol_per_pop  # Number of solutions in the population.
 408                self.initialize_population(self.init_range_low, self.init_range_high, allow_duplicate_genes, True,
 409                                           self.gene_type)
 410            else:
 411                self.valid_parameters = False
 412                raise TypeError(
 413                    "The expected type of both the sol_per_pop and num_genes parameters is int but ({sol_per_pop_type}) and {num_genes_type} found.".format(
 414                        sol_per_pop_type=type(sol_per_pop), num_genes_type=type(num_genes)))
 415        elif numpy.array(initial_population).ndim != 2:
 416            self.valid_parameters = False
 417            raise ValueError(
 418                "A 2D list is expected to the initail_population parameter but a ({initial_population_ndim}-D) list found.".format(
 419                    initial_population_ndim=numpy.array(initial_population).ndim))
 420        else:
 421            # Forcing the initial_population array to have the data type assigned to the gene_type parameter.
 422            if self.gene_type_single == True:
 423                if self.gene_type[1] == None:
 424                    self.initial_population = numpy.array(initial_population, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
 425                else:
 426                    self.initial_population = numpy.round(numpy.array(initial_population, dtype=self.gene_type[0]),
 427                                                          self.gene_type[1])
 428            else:
 429                initial_population = numpy.array(initial_population)
 430                self.initial_population = numpy.zeros(shape=(initial_population.shape[0], initial_population.shape[1]),
 431                                                      dtype=object)
 432                for gene_idx in range(initial_population.shape[1]):
 433                    if self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
 434                        self.initial_population[:, gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(initial_population[:, gene_idx],
 435                                                                             dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
 436                    else:
 437                        self.initial_population[:, gene_idx] = numpy.round(
 438                            numpy.asarray(initial_population[:, gene_idx],
 439                                          dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0]),
 440                            self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
 441
 442            self.population = self.initial_population.copy()  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
 443            self.num_genes = self.initial_population.shape[1]  # Number of genes in the solution.
 444            self.sol_per_pop = self.initial_population.shape[0]  # Number of solutions in the population.
 445            self.pop_size = (self.sol_per_pop, self.num_genes)  # The population size.
 446
 447        # Round initial_population and population
 448        self.initial_population = self.round_genes(self.initial_population)
 449        self.population = self.round_genes(self.population)
 450
 451        # In case the 'gene_space' parameter is nested, then make sure the number of its elements equals to the number of genes.
 452        if self.gene_space_nested:
 453            if len(gene_space) != self.num_genes:
 454                self.valid_parameters = False
 455                raise ValueError(
 456                    "When the parameter 'gene_space' is nested, then its length must be equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, length of gene_space ({len_gene_space}) != num_genes ({len_num_genes})".format(
 457                        len_gene_space=len(gene_space), len_num_genes=self.num_genes))
 458
 459        # Validating the number of parents to be selected for mating (num_parents_mating)
 460        if num_parents_mating <= 0:
 461            self.valid_parameters = False
 462            raise ValueError(
 463                "The number of parents mating (num_parents_mating) parameter must be > 0 but ({num_parents_mating}) found. \nThe following parameters must be > 0: \n1) Population size (i.e. number of solutions per population) (sol_per_pop).\n2) Number of selected parents in the mating pool (num_parents_mating).\n".format(
 464                    num_parents_mating=num_parents_mating))
 465
 466        # Validating the number of parents to be selected for mating: num_parents_mating
 467        if (num_parents_mating > self.sol_per_pop):
 468            self.valid_parameters = False
 469            raise ValueError(
 470                "The number of parents to select for mating ({num_parents_mating}) cannot be greater than the number of solutions in the population ({sol_per_pop}) (i.e., num_parents_mating must always be <= sol_per_pop).\n".format(
 471                    num_parents_mating=num_parents_mating, sol_per_pop=self.sol_per_pop))
 472
 473        self.num_parents_mating = num_parents_mating
 474
 475        # crossover: Refers to the method that applies the crossover operator based on the selected type of crossover in the crossover_type property.
 476        # Validating the crossover type: crossover_type
 477        if (crossover_type is None):
 478            self.crossover = None
 479        elif callable(crossover_type):
 480            # Check if the crossover_type is a function that accepts 2 paramaters.
 481            if (crossover_type.__code__.co_argcount == 3):
 482                # The crossover function assigned to the crossover_type parameter is validated.
 483                self.crossover = crossover_type
 484            else:
 485                self.valid_parameters = False
 486                raise ValueError(
 487                    "When 'crossover_type' is assigned to a function, then this crossover function must accept 2 parameters:\n1) The selected parents.\n2) The size of the offspring to be produced.3) The instance from the pygad.GA class to retrieve any property like population, gene data type, gene space, etc.\n\nThe passed crossover function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 488                        funcname=crossover_type.__code__.co_name, argcount=crossover_type.__code__.co_argcount))
 489        elif not (type(crossover_type) is str):
 490            self.valid_parameters = False
 491            raise TypeError(
 492                "The expected type of the 'crossover_type' parameter is either callable or str but ({crossover_type}) found.".format(
 493                    crossover_type=type(crossover_type)))
 494        else:  # type crossover_type is str
 495            crossover_type = crossover_type.lower()
 496            if (crossover_type == "single_point"):
 497                self.crossover = self.single_point_crossover
 498            elif (crossover_type == "two_points"):
 499                self.crossover = self.two_points_crossover
 500            elif (crossover_type == "uniform"):
 501                self.crossover = self.uniform_crossover
 502            elif (crossover_type == "scattered"):
 503                self.crossover = self.scattered_crossover
 504            else:
 505                self.valid_parameters = False
 506                raise TypeError(
 507                    "Undefined crossover type. \nThe assigned value to the crossover_type ({crossover_type}) parameter does not refer to one of the supported crossover types which are: \n-single_point (for single point crossover)\n-two_points (for two points crossover)\n-uniform (for uniform crossover)\n-scattered (for scattered crossover).\n".format(
 508                        crossover_type=crossover_type))
 509
 510        self.crossover_type = crossover_type
 511
 512        # Calculate the value of crossover_probability
 513        if crossover_probability is None:
 514            self.crossover_probability = None
 515        elif type(crossover_probability) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 516            if crossover_probability >= 0 and crossover_probability <= 1:
 517                self.crossover_probability = crossover_probability
 518            else:
 519                self.valid_parameters = False
 520                raise ValueError(
 521                    "The value assigned to the 'crossover_probability' parameter must be between 0 and 1 inclusive but ({crossover_probability_value}) found.".format(
 522                        crossover_probability_value=crossover_probability))
 523        else:
 524            self.valid_parameters = False
 525            raise TypeError(
 526                "Unexpected type for the 'crossover_probability' parameter. Float is expected but ({crossover_probability_value}) of type {crossover_probability_type} found.".format(
 527                    crossover_probability_value=crossover_probability,
 528                    crossover_probability_type=type(crossover_probability)))
 529
 530        # mutation: Refers to the method that applies the mutation operator based on the selected type of mutation in the mutation_type property.
 531        # Validating the mutation type: mutation_type
 532        # "adaptive" mutation is supported starting from PyGAD 2.10.0
 533        if mutation_type is None:
 534            self.mutation = None
 535        elif callable(mutation_type):
 536            # Check if the mutation_type is a function that accepts 1 paramater.
 537            if (mutation_type.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 538                # The mutation function assigned to the mutation_type parameter is validated.
 539                self.mutation = mutation_type
 540            else:
 541                self.valid_parameters = False
 542                raise ValueError(
 543                    "When 'mutation_type' is assigned to a function, then this mutation function must accept 2 parameters:\n1) The offspring to be mutated.\n2) The instance from the pygad.GA class to retrieve any property like population, gene data type, gene space, etc.\n\nThe passed mutation function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 544                        funcname=mutation_type.__code__.co_name, argcount=mutation_type.__code__.co_argcount))
 545        elif not (type(mutation_type) is str):
 546            self.valid_parameters = False
 547            raise TypeError(
 548                "The expected type of the 'mutation_type' parameter is either callable or str but ({mutation_type}) found.".format(
 549                    mutation_type=type(mutation_type)))
 550        else:  # type mutation_type is str
 551            mutation_type = mutation_type.lower()
 552            if (mutation_type == "random"):
 553                self.mutation = self.random_mutation
 554            elif (mutation_type == "swap"):
 555                self.mutation = self.swap_mutation
 556            elif (mutation_type == "scramble"):
 557                self.mutation = self.scramble_mutation
 558            elif (mutation_type == "inversion"):
 559                self.mutation = self.inversion_mutation
 560            elif (mutation_type == "adaptive"):
 561                self.mutation = self.adaptive_mutation
 562            else:
 563                self.valid_parameters = False
 564                raise TypeError(
 565                    "Undefined mutation type. \nThe assigned string value to the 'mutation_type' parameter ({mutation_type}) does not refer to one of the supported mutation types which are: \n-random (for random mutation)\n-swap (for swap mutation)\n-inversion (for inversion mutation)\n-scramble (for scramble mutation)\n-adaptive (for adaptive mutation).\n".format(
 566                        mutation_type=mutation_type))
 567
 568        self.mutation_type = mutation_type
 569
 570        # Calculate the value of mutation_probability
 571        if not (self.mutation_type is None):
 572            if mutation_probability is None:
 573                self.mutation_probability = None
 574            elif (mutation_type != "adaptive"):
 575                # Mutation probability is fixed not adaptive.
 576                if type(mutation_probability) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 577                    if mutation_probability >= 0 and mutation_probability <= 1:
 578                        self.mutation_probability = mutation_probability
 579                    else:
 580                        self.valid_parameters = False
 581                        raise ValueError(
 582                            "The value assigned to the 'mutation_probability' parameter must be between 0 and 1 inclusive but ({mutation_probability_value}) found.".format(
 583                                mutation_probability_value=mutation_probability))
 584                else:
 585                    self.valid_parameters = False
 586                    raise TypeError(
 587                        "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_probability' parameter. A numeric value is expected but ({mutation_probability_value}) of type {mutation_probability_type} found.".format(
 588                            mutation_probability_value=mutation_probability,
 589                            mutation_probability_type=type(mutation_probability)))
 590            else:
 591                # Mutation probability is adaptive not fixed.
 592                if type(mutation_probability) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 593                    if len(mutation_probability) == 2:
 594                        for el in mutation_probability:
 595                            if type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 596                                if el >= 0 and el <= 1:
 597                                    pass
 598                                else:
 599                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 600                                    raise ValueError(
 601                                        "The values assigned to the 'mutation_probability' parameter must be between 0 and 1 inclusive but ({mutation_probability_value}) found.".format(
 602                                            mutation_probability_value=el))
 603                            else:
 604                                self.valid_parameters = False
 605                                raise TypeError(
 606                                    "Unexpected type for a value assigned to the 'mutation_probability' parameter. A numeric value is expected but ({mutation_probability_value}) of type {mutation_probability_type} found.".format(
 607                                        mutation_probability_value=el, mutation_probability_type=type(el)))
 608                        if mutation_probability[0] < mutation_probability[1]:
 609                            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 610                                "The first element in the 'mutation_probability' parameter is {first_el} which is smaller than the second element {second_el}. This means the mutation rate for the high-quality solutions is higher than the mutation rate of the low-quality ones. This causes high disruption in the high qualitiy solutions while making little changes in the low quality solutions. Please make the first element higher than the second element.".format(
 611                                    first_el=mutation_probability[0], second_el=mutation_probability[1]))
 612                        self.mutation_probability = mutation_probability
 613                    else:
 614                        self.valid_parameters = False
 615                        raise ValueError(
 616                            "When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_probability' parameter must have only 2 elements but ({mutation_probability_length}) element(s) found.".format(
 617                                mutation_probability_length=len(mutation_probability)))
 618                else:
 619                    self.valid_parameters = False
 620                    raise TypeError(
 621                        "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_probability' parameter. When mutation_type='adaptive', then list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is expected but ({mutation_probability_value}) of type {mutation_probability_type} found.".format(
 622                            mutation_probability_value=mutation_probability,
 623                            mutation_probability_type=type(mutation_probability)))
 624        else:
 625            pass
 626
 627        # Calculate the value of mutation_num_genes
 628        if not (self.mutation_type is None):
 629            if mutation_num_genes is None:
 630                # The mutation_num_genes parameter does not exist. Checking whether adaptive mutation is used.
 631                if (mutation_type != "adaptive"):
 632                    # The percent of genes to mutate is fixed not adaptive.
 633                    if mutation_percent_genes == 'default'.lower():
 634                        mutation_percent_genes = 10
 635                        # Based on the mutation percentage in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter, the number of genes to mutate is calculated.
 636                        mutation_num_genes = numpy.uint32((mutation_percent_genes * self.num_genes) / 100)
 637                        # Based on the mutation percentage of genes, if the number of selected genes for mutation is less than the least possible value which is 1, then the number will be set to 1.
 638                        if mutation_num_genes == 0:
 639                            if self.mutation_probability is None:
 640                                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 641                                    "The percentage of genes to mutate (mutation_percent_genes={mutation_percent}) resutled in selecting ({mutation_num}) genes. The number of genes to mutate is set to 1 (mutation_num_genes=1).\nIf you do not want to mutate any gene, please set mutation_type=None.".format(
 642                                        mutation_percent=mutation_percent_genes, mutation_num=mutation_num_genes))
 643                            mutation_num_genes = 1
 644
 645                    elif type(mutation_percent_genes) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 646                        if (mutation_percent_genes <= 0 or mutation_percent_genes > 100):
 647                            self.valid_parameters = False
 648                            raise ValueError(
 649                                "The percentage of selected genes for mutation (mutation_percent_genes) must be > 0 and <= 100 but ({mutation_percent_genes}) found.\n".format(
 650                                    mutation_percent_genes=mutation_percent_genes))
 651                        else:
 652                            # If mutation_percent_genes equals the string "default", then it is replaced by the numeric value 10.
 653                            if mutation_percent_genes == 'default'.lower():
 654                                mutation_percent_genes = 10
 655
 656                            # Based on the mutation percentage in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter, the number of genes to mutate is calculated.
 657                            mutation_num_genes = numpy.uint32((mutation_percent_genes * self.num_genes) / 100)
 658                            # Based on the mutation percentage of genes, if the number of selected genes for mutation is less than the least possible value which is 1, then the number will be set to 1.
 659                            if mutation_num_genes == 0:
 660                                if self.mutation_probability is None:
 661                                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 662                                        "The percentage of genes to mutate (mutation_percent_genes={mutation_percent}) resutled in selecting ({mutation_num}) genes. The number of genes to mutate is set to 1 (mutation_num_genes=1).\nIf you do not want to mutate any gene, please set mutation_type=None.".format(
 663                                            mutation_percent=mutation_percent_genes, mutation_num=mutation_num_genes))
 664                                mutation_num_genes = 1
 665                    else:
 666                        self.valid_parameters = False
 667                        raise TypeError(
 668                            "Unexpected value or type of the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter. It only accepts the string 'default' or a numeric value but ({mutation_percent_genes_value}) of type {mutation_percent_genes_type} found.".format(
 669                                mutation_percent_genes_value=mutation_percent_genes,
 670                                mutation_percent_genes_type=type(mutation_percent_genes)))
 671                else:
 672                    # The percent of genes to mutate is adaptive not fixed.
 673                    if type(mutation_percent_genes) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 674                        if len(mutation_percent_genes) == 2:
 675                            mutation_num_genes = numpy.zeros_like(mutation_percent_genes, dtype=numpy.uint32)
 676                            for idx, el in enumerate(mutation_percent_genes):
 677                                if type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 678                                    if (el <= 0 or el > 100):
 679                                        self.valid_parameters = False
 680                                        raise ValueError(
 681                                            "The values assigned to the 'mutation_percent_genes' must be > 0 and <= 100 but ({mutation_percent_genes}) found.\n".format(
 682                                                mutation_percent_genes=mutation_percent_genes))
 683                                else:
 684                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 685                                    raise TypeError(
 686                                        "Unexpected type for a value assigned to the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter. An integer value is expected but ({mutation_percent_genes_value}) of type {mutation_percent_genes_type} found.".format(
 687                                            mutation_percent_genes_value=el, mutation_percent_genes_type=type(el)))
 688                                # At this point of the loop, the current value assigned to the parameter 'mutation_percent_genes' is validated.
 689                                # Based on the mutation percentage in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter, the number of genes to mutate is calculated.
 690                                mutation_num_genes[idx] = numpy.uint32(
 691                                    (mutation_percent_genes[idx] * self.num_genes) / 100)
 692                                # Based on the mutation percentage of genes, if the number of selected genes for mutation is less than the least possible value which is 1, then the number will be set to 1.
 693                                if mutation_num_genes[idx] == 0:
 694                                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 695                                        "The percentage of genes to mutate ({mutation_percent}) resutled in selecting ({mutation_num}) genes. The number of genes to mutate is set to 1 (mutation_num_genes=1).\nIf you do not want to mutate any gene, please set mutation_type=None.".format(
 696                                            mutation_percent=mutation_percent_genes[idx],
 697                                            mutation_num=mutation_num_genes[idx]))
 698                                    mutation_num_genes[idx] = 1
 699                            if mutation_percent_genes[0] < mutation_percent_genes[1]:
 700                                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 701                                    "The first element in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter is ({first_el}) which is smaller than the second element ({second_el}).\nThis means the mutation rate for the high-quality solutions is higher than the mutation rate of the low-quality ones. This causes high disruption in the high qualitiy solutions while making little changes in the low quality solutions.\nPlease make the first element higher than the second element.".format(
 702                                        first_el=mutation_percent_genes[0], second_el=mutation_percent_genes[1]))
 703                            # At this point outside the loop, all values of the parameter 'mutation_percent_genes' are validated. Eveyrthing is OK.
 704                        else:
 705                            self.valid_parameters = False
 706                            raise ValueError(
 707                                "When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter must have only 2 elements but ({mutation_percent_genes_length}) element(s) found.".format(
 708                                    mutation_percent_genes_length=len(mutation_percent_genes)))
 709                    else:
 710                        if self.mutation_probability is None:
 711                            self.valid_parameters = False
 712                            raise TypeError(
 713                                "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter. When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter should exist and assigned a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray with 2 values but ({mutation_percent_genes_value}) found.".format(
 714                                    mutation_percent_genes_value=mutation_percent_genes))
 715            # The mutation_num_genes parameter exists. Checking whether adaptive mutation is used.
 716            elif (mutation_type != "adaptive"):
 717                # Number of genes to mutate is fixed not adaptive.
 718                if type(mutation_num_genes) in GA.supported_int_types:
 719                    if (mutation_num_genes <= 0):
 720                        self.valid_parameters = False
 721                        raise ValueError(
 722                            "The number of selected genes for mutation (mutation_num_genes) cannot be <= 0 but ({mutation_num_genes}) found. If you do not want to use mutation, please set mutation_type=None\n".format(
 723                                mutation_num_genes=mutation_num_genes))
 724                    elif (mutation_num_genes > self.num_genes):
 725                        self.valid_parameters = False
 726                        raise ValueError(
 727                            "The number of selected genes for mutation (mutation_num_genes), which is ({mutation_num_genes}), cannot be greater than the number of genes ({num_genes}).\n".format(
 728                                mutation_num_genes=mutation_num_genes, num_genes=self.num_genes))
 729                else:
 730                    self.valid_parameters = False
 731                    raise TypeError(
 732                        "The 'mutation_num_genes' parameter is expected to be a positive integer but the value ({mutation_num_genes_value}) of type {mutation_num_genes_type} found.\n".format(
 733                            mutation_num_genes_value=mutation_num_genes,
 734                            mutation_num_genes_type=type(mutation_num_genes)))
 735            else:
 736                # Number of genes to mutate is adaptive not fixed.
 737                if type(mutation_num_genes) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 738                    if len(mutation_num_genes) == 2:
 739                        for el in mutation_num_genes:
 740                            if type(el) in GA.supported_int_types:
 741                                if (el <= 0):
 742                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 743                                    raise ValueError(
 744                                        "The values assigned to the 'mutation_num_genes' cannot be <= 0 but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) found. If you do not want to use mutation, please set mutation_type=None\n".format(
 745                                            mutation_num_genes_value=el))
 746                                elif (el > self.num_genes):
 747                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 748                                    raise ValueError(
 749                                        "The values assigned to the 'mutation_num_genes' cannot be greater than the number of genes ({num_genes}) but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) found.\n".format(
 750                                            mutation_num_genes_value=el, num_genes=self.num_genes))
 751                            else:
 752                                self.valid_parameters = False
 753                                raise TypeError(
 754                                    "Unexpected type for a value assigned to the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter. An integer value is expected but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) of type {mutation_num_genes_type} found.".format(
 755                                        mutation_num_genes_value=el, mutation_num_genes_type=type(el)))
 756                            # At this point of the loop, the current value assigned to the parameter 'mutation_num_genes' is validated.
 757                        if mutation_num_genes[0] < mutation_num_genes[1]:
 758                            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 759                                "The first element in the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter is {first_el} which is smaller than the second element {second_el}. This means the mutation rate for the high-quality solutions is higher than the mutation rate of the low-quality ones. This causes high disruption in the high qualitiy solutions while making little changes in the low quality solutions. Please make the first element higher than the second element.".format(
 760                                    first_el=mutation_num_genes[0], second_el=mutation_num_genes[1]))
 761                        # At this point outside the loop, all values of the parameter 'mutation_num_genes' are validated. Eveyrthing is OK.
 762                    else:
 763                        self.valid_parameters = False
 764                        raise ValueError(
 765                            "When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter must have only 2 elements but ({mutation_num_genes_length}) element(s) found.".format(
 766                                mutation_num_genes_length=len(mutation_num_genes)))
 767                else:
 768                    self.valid_parameters = False
 769                    raise TypeError(
 770                        "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter. When mutation_type='adaptive', then list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is expected but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) of type {mutation_num_genes_type} found.".format(
 771                            mutation_num_genes_value=mutation_num_genes,
 772                            mutation_num_genes_type=type(mutation_num_genes)))
 773        else:
 774            pass
 775
 776        # Validating mutation_by_replacement and mutation_type
 777        if self.mutation_type != "random" and self.mutation_by_replacement:
 778            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 779                "The mutation_by_replacement parameter is set to True while the mutation_type parameter is not set to random but ({mut_type}). Note that the mutation_by_replacement parameter has an effect only when mutation_type='random'.".format(
 780                    mut_type=mutation_type))
 781
 782        # Check if crossover and mutation are both disabled.
 783        if (self.mutation_type is None) and (self.crossover_type is None):
 784            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 785                "The 2 parameters mutation_type and crossover_type are None. This disables any type of evolution the genetic algorithm can make. As a result, the genetic algorithm cannot find a better solution that the best solution in the initial population.")
 786
 787        # select_parents: Refers to a method that selects the parents based on the parent selection type specified in the parent_selection_type attribute.
 788        # Validating the selected type of parent selection: parent_selection_type
 789        if callable(parent_selection_type):
 790            # Check if the parent_selection_type is a function that accepts 3 paramaters.
 791            if (parent_selection_type.__code__.co_argcount == 3):
 792                # population: Added in PyGAD 2.16.0. It should used only to support custom parent selection functions. Otherwise, it should be left to None to retirve the population by self.population.
 793                # The parent selection function assigned to the parent_selection_type parameter is validated.
 794                self.select_parents = parent_selection_type
 795            else:
 796                self.valid_parameters = False
 797                raise ValueError(
 798                    "When 'parent_selection_type' is assigned to a user-defined function, then this parent selection function must accept 3 parameters:\n1) The fitness values of the current population.\n2) The number of parents needed.\n3) The instance from the pygad.GA class to retrieve any property like population, gene data type, gene space, etc.\n\nThe passed parent selection function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 799                        funcname=parent_selection_type.__code__.co_name,
 800                        argcount=parent_selection_type.__code__.co_argcount))
 801        elif not (type(parent_selection_type) is str):
 802            self.valid_parameters = False
 803            raise TypeError(
 804                "The expected type of the 'parent_selection_type' parameter is either callable or str but ({parent_selection_type}) found.".format(
 805                    parent_selection_type=type(parent_selection_type)))
 806        else:
 807            parent_selection_type = parent_selection_type.lower()
 808            if (parent_selection_type == "sss"):
 809                self.select_parents = self.steady_state_selection
 810            elif (parent_selection_type == "rws"):
 811                self.select_parents = self.roulette_wheel_selection
 812            elif (parent_selection_type == "sus"):
 813                self.select_parents = self.stochastic_universal_selection
 814            elif (parent_selection_type == "random"):
 815                self.select_parents = self.random_selection
 816            elif (parent_selection_type == "tournament"):
 817                self.select_parents = self.tournament_selection
 818            elif (parent_selection_type == "rank"):
 819                self.select_parents = self.rank_selection
 820            else:
 821                self.valid_parameters = False
 822                raise TypeError(
 823                    "Undefined parent selection type: {parent_selection_type}. \nThe assigned value to the 'parent_selection_type' parameter does not refer to one of the supported parent selection techniques which are: \n-sss (for steady state selection)\n-rws (for roulette wheel selection)\n-sus (for stochastic universal selection)\n-rank (for rank selection)\n-random (for random selection)\n-tournament (for tournament selection).\n".format(
 824                        parent_selection_type=parent_selection_type))
 825
 826        # For tournament selection, validate the K value.
 827        if (parent_selection_type == "tournament"):
 828            if (K_tournament > self.sol_per_pop):
 829                K_tournament = self.sol_per_pop
 830                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 831                    "K of the tournament selection ({K_tournament}) should not be greater than the number of solutions within the population ({sol_per_pop}).\nK will be clipped to be equal to the number of solutions in the population (sol_per_pop).\n".format(
 832                        K_tournament=K_tournament, sol_per_pop=self.sol_per_pop))
 833            elif (K_tournament <= 0):
 834                self.valid_parameters = False
 835                raise ValueError("K of the tournament selection cannot be <=0 but ({K_tournament}) found.\n".format(
 836                    K_tournament=K_tournament))
 837
 838        self.K_tournament = K_tournament
 839
 840        # Validating the number of parents to keep in the next population: keep_parents
 841        if not (type(keep_parents) in GA.supported_int_types):
 842            self.valid_parameters = False
 843            raise TypeError(
 844                "Incorrect type of the value assigned to the keep_parents parameter. The value {keep_parents} of type {keep_parents_type} found but an integer is expected.".format(
 845                    keep_parents=keep_parents, keep_parents_type=type(keep_parents)))
 846        elif (keep_parents > self.sol_per_pop or keep_parents > self.num_parents_mating or keep_parents < -1):
 847            self.valid_parameters = False
 848            raise ValueError(
 849                "Incorrect value to the keep_parents parameter: {keep_parents}. \nThe assigned value to the keep_parent parameter must satisfy the following conditions: \n1) Less than or equal to sol_per_pop\n2) Less than or equal to num_parents_mating\n3) Greater than or equal to -1.".format(
 850                    keep_parents=keep_parents))
 851
 852        self.keep_parents = keep_parents
 853
 854        if parent_selection_type == "sss" and self.keep_parents == 0:
 855            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 856                "The steady-state parent (sss) selection operator is used despite that no parents are kept in the next generation.")
 857
 858        # Validating the number of elitism to keep in the next population: keep_elitism
 859        if not (type(keep_elitism) in GA.supported_int_types):
 860            self.valid_parameters = False
 861            raise TypeError(
 862                "Incorrect type of the value assigned to the keep_elitism parameter. The value {keep_elitism} of type {keep_elitism_type} found but an integer is expected.".format(
 863                    keep_elitism=keep_elitism, keep_elitism_type=type(keep_elitism)))
 864        elif (keep_elitism > self.sol_per_pop or keep_elitism < 0):
 865            self.valid_parameters = False
 866            raise ValueError(
 867                "Incorrect value to the keep_elitism parameter: {keep_elitism}. \nThe assigned value to the keep_elitism parameter must satisfy the following conditions: \n1) Less than or equal to sol_per_pop\n2) Greater than or equal to 0.".format(
 868                    keep_elitism=keep_elitism))
 869
 870        self.keep_elitism = keep_elitism
 871
 872        # Validate keep_parents.
 873        if self.keep_elitism == 0:
 874            if (self.keep_parents == -1):  # Keep all parents in the next population.
 875                self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop - self.num_parents_mating
 876            elif (self.keep_parents == 0):  # Keep no parents in the next population.
 877                self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop
 878            elif (self.keep_parents > 0):  # Keep the specified number of parents in the next population.
 879                self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop - self.keep_parents
 880        else:
 881            self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop - self.keep_elitism
 882
 883        # Check if the fitness_func is a function.
 884        if callable(fitness_func):
 885            # Check if the fitness function accepts 2 paramaters.
 886            if (fitness_func.__code__.co_argcount >= 2):
 887                self.fitness_func = fitness_func
 888            else:
 889                self.valid_parameters = False
 890                raise ValueError(
 891                    "The fitness function must accept 2 parameters:\n1) A solution to calculate its fitness value.\n2) The solution's index within the population.\n\nThe passed fitness function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 892                        funcname=fitness_func.__code__.co_name, argcount=fitness_func.__code__.co_argcount))
 893        else:
 894            self.valid_parameters = False
 895            raise TypeError(
 896                "The value assigned to the fitness_func parameter is expected to be of type function but ({fitness_func_type}) found.".format(
 897                    fitness_func_type=type(fitness_func)))
 898
 899        self.args = args
 900
 901        # Check if the on_start exists.
 902        if not (on_start is None):
 903            # Check if the on_start is a function.
 904            if callable(on_start):
 905                # Check if the on_start function accepts only a single paramater.
 906                if (on_start.__code__.co_argcount == 1):
 907                    self.on_start = on_start
 908                else:
 909                    self.valid_parameters = False
 910                    raise ValueError(
 911                        "The function assigned to the on_start parameter must accept only 1 parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 912                            funcname=on_start.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_start.__code__.co_argcount))
 913            else:
 914                self.valid_parameters = False
 915                raise TypeError(
 916                    "The value assigned to the on_start parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_start_type}) found.".format(
 917                        on_start_type=type(on_start)))
 918        else:
 919            self.on_start = None
 920
 921        # Check if the on_fitness exists.
 922        if not (on_fitness is None):
 923            # Check if the on_fitness is a function.
 924            if callable(on_fitness):
 925                # Check if the on_fitness function accepts 2 paramaters.
 926                if (on_fitness.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 927                    self.on_fitness = on_fitness
 928                else:
 929                    self.valid_parameters = False
 930                    raise ValueError(
 931                        "The function assigned to the on_fitness parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the fitness values of all solutions.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 932                            funcname=on_fitness.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_fitness.__code__.co_argcount))
 933            else:
 934                self.valid_parameters = False
 935                raise TypeError(
 936                    "The value assigned to the on_fitness parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_fitness_type}) found.".format(
 937                        on_fitness_type=type(on_fitness)))
 938        else:
 939            self.on_fitness = None
 940
 941        # Check if the on_parents exists.
 942        if not (on_parents is None):
 943            # Check if the on_parents is a function.
 944            if callable(on_parents):
 945                # Check if the on_parents function accepts 2 paramaters.
 946                if (on_parents.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 947                    self.on_parents = on_parents
 948                else:
 949                    self.valid_parameters = False
 950                    raise ValueError(
 951                        "The function assigned to the on_parents parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the fitness values of all solutions.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
