 952                            funcname=on_parents.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_parents.__code__.co_argcount))
 953            else:
 954                self.valid_parameters = False
 955                raise TypeError(
 956                    "The value assigned to the on_parents parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_parents_type}) found.".format(
 957                        on_parents_type=type(on_parents)))
 958        else:
 959            self.on_parents = None
 960
 961        # Check if the on_crossover exists.
 962        if not (on_crossover is None):
 963            # Check if the on_crossover is a function.
 964            if callable(on_crossover):
 965                # Check if the on_crossover function accepts 2 paramaters.
 966                if (on_crossover.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 967                    self.on_crossover = on_crossover
 968                else:
 969                    self.valid_parameters = False
 970                    raise ValueError(
 971                        "The function assigned to the on_crossover parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the offspring generated using crossover.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 972                            funcname=on_crossover.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_crossover.__code__.co_argcount))
 973            else:
 974                self.valid_parameters = False
 975                raise TypeError(
 976                    "The value assigned to the on_crossover parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_crossover_type}) found.".format(
 977                        on_crossover_type=type(on_crossover)))
 978        else:
 979            self.on_crossover = None
 980
 981        # Check if the on_mutation exists.
 982        if not (on_mutation is None):
 983            # Check if the on_mutation is a function.
 984            if callable(on_mutation):
 985                # Check if the on_mutation function accepts 2 paramaters.
 986                if (on_mutation.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 987                    self.on_mutation = on_mutation
 988                else:
 989                    self.valid_parameters = False
 990                    raise ValueError(
 991                        "The function assigned to the on_mutation parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the offspring after applying the mutation operation.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 992                            funcname=on_mutation.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_mutation.__code__.co_argcount))
 993            else:
 994                self.valid_parameters = False
 995                raise TypeError(
 996                    "The value assigned to the on_mutation parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_mutation_type}) found.".format(
 997                        on_mutation_type=type(on_mutation)))
 998        else:
 999            self.on_mutation = None
1000
1001        # Check if the callback_generation exists.
1002        if not (callback_generation is None):
1003            # Check if the callback_generation is a function.
1004            if callable(callback_generation):
1005                # Check if the callback_generation function accepts only a single paramater.
1006                if (callback_generation.__code__.co_argcount == 1):
1007                    self.callback_generation = callback_generation
1008                    on_generation = callback_generation
1009                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
1010                        "Starting from PyGAD 2.6.0, the callback_generation parameter is deprecated and will be removed in a later release of PyGAD. Please use the on_generation parameter instead.")
1011                else:
1012                    self.valid_parameters = False
1013                    raise ValueError(
1014                        "The function assigned to the callback_generation parameter must accept only 1 parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
1015                            funcname=callback_generation.__code__.co_name,
1016                            argcount=callback_generation.__code__.co_argcount))
1017            else:
1018                self.valid_parameters = False
1019                raise TypeError(
1020                    "The value assigned to the callback_generation parameter is expected to be of type function but ({callback_generation_type}) found.".format(
1021                        callback_generation_type=type(callback_generation)))
1022        else:
1023            self.callback_generation = None
1024
1025        # Check if the on_generation exists.
1026        if not (on_generation is None):
1027            # Check if the on_generation is a function.
1028            if callable(on_generation):
1029                # Check if the on_generation function accepts only a single paramater.
1030                if (on_generation.__code__.co_argcount == 1):
1031                    self.on_generation = on_generation
1032                else:
1033                    self.valid_parameters = False
1034                    raise ValueError(
1035                        "The function assigned to the on_generation parameter must accept only 1 parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
1036                            funcname=on_generation.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_generation.__code__.co_argcount))
1037            else:
1038                self.valid_parameters = False
1039                raise TypeError(
1040                    "The value assigned to the on_generation parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_generation_type}) found.".format(
1041                        on_generation_type=type(on_generation)))
1042        else:
1043            self.on_generation = None
1044
1045        # Check if the on_stop exists.
1046        if not (on_stop is None):
1047            # Check if the on_stop is a function.
1048            if callable(on_stop):
1049                # Check if the on_stop function accepts 2 paramaters.
1050                if (on_stop.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
1051                    self.on_stop = on_stop
1052                else:
1053                    self.valid_parameters = False
1054                    raise ValueError(
1055                        "The function assigned to the on_stop parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and a list of the fitness values of the solutions in the last population.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
1056                            funcname=on_stop.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_stop.__code__.co_argcount))
1057            else:
1058                self.valid_parameters = False
1059                raise TypeError(
1060                    "The value assigned to the 'on_stop' parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_stop_type}) found.".format(
1061                        on_stop_type=type(on_stop)))
1062        else:
1063            self.on_stop = None
1064
1065        # Validate delay_after_gen
1066        if type(delay_after_gen) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1067            if delay_after_gen >= 0.0:
1068                self.delay_after_gen = delay_after_gen
1069            else:
1070                self.valid_parameters = False
1071                raise ValueError(
1072                    "The value passed to the 'delay_after_gen' parameter must be a non-negative number. The value passed is {delay_after_gen} of type {delay_after_gen_type}.".format(
1073                        delay_after_gen=delay_after_gen, delay_after_gen_type=type(delay_after_gen)))
1074        else:
1075            self.valid_parameters = False
1076            raise TypeError(
1077                "The value passed to the 'delay_after_gen' parameter must be of type int or float but ({delay_after_gen_type}) found.".format(
1078                    delay_after_gen_type=type(delay_after_gen)))
1079
1080        # Validate save_best_solutions
1081        if type(save_best_solutions) is bool:
1082            if save_best_solutions == True:
1083                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
1084                    "Use the 'save_best_solutions' parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations or number of genes is large.")
1085        else:
1086            self.valid_parameters = False
1087            raise TypeError(
1088                "The value passed to the 'save_best_solutions' parameter must be of type bool but ({save_best_solutions_type}) found.".format(
1089                    save_best_solutions_type=type(save_best_solutions)))
1090
1091        # Validate save_solutions
1092        if type(save_solutions) is bool:
1093            if save_solutions == True:
1094                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
1095                    "Use the 'save_solutions' parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations, number of genes, or number of solutions in population is large.")
1096        else:
1097            self.valid_parameters = False
1098            raise TypeError(
1099                "The value passed to the 'save_solutions' parameter must be of type bool but ({save_solutions_type}) found.".format(
1100                    save_solutions_type=type(save_solutions)))
1101
1102        # Validate allow_duplicate_genes
1103        if not (type(allow_duplicate_genes) is bool):
1104            self.valid_parameters = False
1105            raise TypeError(
1106                "The expected type of the 'allow_duplicate_genes' parameter is bool but ({allow_duplicate_genes_type}) found.".format(
1107                    allow_duplicate_genes_type=type(allow_duplicate_genes)))
1108
1109        self.allow_duplicate_genes = allow_duplicate_genes
1110
1111        self.stop_criteria = []
1112        self.supported_stop_words = ["reach", "saturate"]
1113        if stop_criteria is None:
1114            # None: Stop after passing through all generations.
1115            self.stop_criteria = None
1116        elif type(stop_criteria) is str:
1117            # reach_{target_fitness}: Stop if the target fitness value is reached.
1118            # saturate_{num_generations}: Stop if the fitness value does not change (saturates) for the given number of generations.
1119            criterion = stop_criteria.split("_")
1120            if len(criterion) == 2:
1121                stop_word = criterion[0]
1122                number = criterion[1]
1123
1124                if stop_word in self.supported_stop_words:
1125                    pass
1126                else:
1127                    self.valid_parameters = False
1128                    raise ValueError(
1129                        "In the 'stop_criteria' parameter, the supported stop words are '{supported_stop_words}' but '{stop_word}' found.".format(
1130                            supported_stop_words=self.supported_stop_words, stop_word=stop_word))
1131
1132                if number.replace(".", "").isnumeric():
1133                    number = float(number)
1134                else:
1135                    self.valid_parameters = False
1136                    raise ValueError(
1137                        "The value following the stop word in the 'stop_criteria' parameter must be a number but the value '{stop_val}' of type {stop_val_type} found.".format(
1138                            stop_val=number, stop_val_type=type(number)))
1139
1140                self.stop_criteria.append([stop_word, number, ftol_abs])
1141
1142            else:
1143                self.valid_parameters = False
1144                raise ValueError(
1145                    "For format of a single criterion in the 'stop_criteria' parameter is 'word_number' but '{stop_criteria}' found.".format(
1146                        stop_criteria=stop_criteria))
1147
1148        elif type(stop_criteria) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
1149            # Remove duplicate criterira by converting the list to a set then back to a list.
1150            stop_criteria = list(set(stop_criteria))
1151            for idx, val in enumerate(stop_criteria):
1152                if type(val) is str:
1153                    criterion = val.split("_")
1154                    if len(criterion) == 2:
1155                        stop_word = criterion[0]
1156                        number = criterion[1]
1157
1158                        if stop_word in self.supported_stop_words:
1159                            pass
1160                        else:
1161                            self.valid_parameters = False
1162                            raise ValueError(
1163                                "In the 'stop_criteria' parameter, the supported stop words are {supported_stop_words} but '{stop_word}' found.".format(
1164                                    supported_stop_words=self.supported_stop_words, stop_word=stop_word))
1165
1166                        if number.replace(".", "").isnumeric():
1167                            number = float(number)
1168                        else:
1169                            self.valid_parameters = False
1170                            raise ValueError(
1171                                "The value following the stop word in the 'stop_criteria' parameter must be a number but the value '{stop_val}' of type {stop_val_type} found.".format(
1172                                    stop_val=number, stop_val_type=type(number)))
1173
1174                        self.stop_criteria.append([stop_word, number, ftol_abs])
1175
1176                    else:
1177                        self.valid_parameters = False
1178                        raise ValueError(
1179                            "The format of a single criterion in the 'stop_criteria' parameter is 'word_number' but {stop_criteria} found.".format(
1180                                stop_criteria=criterion))
1181                else:
1182                    self.valid_parameters = False
1183                    raise TypeError(
1184                        "When the 'stop_criteria' parameter is assigned a tuple/list/numpy.ndarray, then its elements must be strings but the value '{stop_criteria_val}' of type {stop_criteria_val_type} found at index {stop_criteria_val_idx}.".format(
1185                            stop_criteria_val=val, stop_criteria_val_type=type(val), stop_criteria_val_idx=idx))
1186        else:
1187            self.valid_parameters = False
1188            raise TypeError(
1189                "The expected value of the 'stop_criteria' is a single string or a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of strings but the value {stop_criteria_val} of type {stop_criteria_type} found.".format(
1190                    stop_criteria_val=stop_criteria, stop_criteria_type=type(stop_criteria)))
1191
1192        if parallel_processing is None:
1193            self.parallel_processing = None
1194        elif type(parallel_processing) in GA.supported_int_types:
1195            if parallel_processing > 0:
1196                self.parallel_processing = ["thread", parallel_processing]
1197            else:
1198                self.valid_parameters = False
1199                raise ValueError(
1200                    "When the 'parallel_processing' parameter is assigned an integer, then the integer must be positive but the value ({parallel_processing_value}) found.".format(
1201                        parallel_processing_value=parallel_processing))
1202        elif type(parallel_processing) in [list, tuple]:
1203            if len(parallel_processing) == 2:
1204                if type(parallel_processing[0]) is str:
1205                    if parallel_processing[0] in ["process", "thread"]:
1206                        if (type(parallel_processing[1]) in GA.supported_int_types and parallel_processing[1] > 0) or (
1207                                parallel_processing[1] == 0) or (parallel_processing[1] is None):
1208                            if parallel_processing[1] == 0:
1209                                # If the number of processes/threads is 0, this means no parallel processing is used. It is equivelant to setting parallel_processing=None.
1210                                self.parallel_processing = None
1211                            else:
1212                                # Whether the second value is None or a positive integer.
1213                                self.parallel_processing = parallel_processing
1214                        else:
1215                            self.valid_parameters = False
1216                            raise TypeError(
1217                                "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then the second element must be an integer but the value ({second_value}) of type ({second_value_type}) found.".format(
1218                                    second_value=parallel_processing[1],
1219                                    second_value_type=type(parallel_processing[1])))
1220                    else:
1221                        self.valid_parameters = False
1222                        raise ValueError(
1223                            "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then the value of the first element must be either 'process' or 'thread' but the value ({first_value}) found.".format(
1224                                first_value=parallel_processing[0]))
1225                else:
1226                    self.valid_parameters = False
1227                    raise TypeError(
1228                        "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then the first element must be of type 'str' but the value ({first_value}) of type ({first_value_type}) found.".format(
1229                            first_value=parallel_processing[0], first_value_type=type(parallel_processing[0])))
1230            else:
1231                self.valid_parameters = False
1232                raise ValueError(
1233                    "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then it must have 2 elements but ({num_elements}) found.".format(
1234                        num_elements=len(parallel_processing)))
1235        else:
1236            self.valid_parameters = False
1237            raise ValueError(
1238                "Unexpected value ({parallel_processing_value}) of type ({parallel_processing_type}) assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter. The accepted values for this parameter are:\n1) None: (Default) It means no parallel processing is used.\n2) A positive integer referring to the number of threads to be used (i.e. threads, not processes, are used.\n3) list/tuple: If a list or a tuple of exactly 2 elements is assigned, then:\n\t*1) The first element can be either 'process' or 'thread' to specify whether processes or threads are used, respectively.\n\t*2) The second element can be:\n\t\t**1) A positive integer to select the maximum number of processes or threads to be used.\n\t\t**2) 0 to indicate that parallel processing is not used. This is identical to setting 'parallel_processing=None'.\n\t\t**3) None to use the default value as calculated by the concurrent.futures module.".format(
1239                    parallel_processing_value=parallel_processing, parallel_processing_type=type(parallel_processing)))
1240
1241        self._pool = None
1242
1243        # Set the `run_completed` property to False. It is set to `True` only after the `run()` method is complete.
1244        self.run_completed = False
1245
1246        # The number of completed generations.
1247        self.generations_completed = 0
1248
1249        # At this point, all necessary parameters validation is done successfully and we are sure that the parameters are valid.
1250        self.valid_parameters = True  # Set to True when all the parameters passed in the GA class constructor are valid.
1251
1252        # Parameters of the genetic algorithm.
1253        self.num_generations = abs(num_generations)
1254        self.parent_selection_type = parent_selection_type
1255
1256        # Parameters of the mutation operation.
1257        self.mutation_percent_genes = mutation_percent_genes
1258        self.mutation_num_genes = mutation_num_genes
1259
1260        # Even such this parameter is declared in the class header, it is assigned to the object here to access it after saving the object.
1261        self.best_solutions_fitness = []  # A list holding the fitness value of the best solution for each generation.
1262
1263        self.best_solution_generation = -1  # The generation number at which the best fitness value is reached. It is only assigned the generation number after the `run()` method completes. Otherwise, its value is -1.
1264
1265        self.save_best_solutions = save_best_solutions
1266        self.best_solutions = []  # Holds the best solution in each generation.
1267
1268        self.save_solutions = save_solutions
1269        self.solutions = []  # Holds the solutions in each generation.
1270        self.solutions_fitness = []  # Holds the fitness of the solutions in each generation.
1271
1272        self.last_generation_fitness = None  # A list holding the fitness values of all solutions in the last generation.
1273        self.last_generation_parents = None  # A list holding the parents of the last generation.
1274        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = None  # A list holding the offspring after applying crossover in the last generation.
1275        self.last_generation_offspring_mutation = None  # A list holding the offspring after applying mutation in the last generation.
1276        self.previous_generation_fitness = None  # Holds the fitness values of one generation before the fitness values saved in the last_generation_fitness attribute. Added in PyGAD 2.26.2
1277        self.last_generation_elitism = None  # Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. A NumPy array holding the elitism in the current generation according to the value passed in the keep_elitism parameter.
1278
1279    def round_genes(self, solutions):
1280        for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1281            if self.gene_type_single:
1282                if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
1283                    solutions[:, gene_idx] = numpy.round(solutions[:, gene_idx], self.gene_type[1])
1284            else:
1285                if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
1286                    solutions[:, gene_idx] = numpy.round(numpy.asarray(solutions[:, gene_idx],
1287                                                                       dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0]),
1288                                                         self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
1289        return solutions
1290
1291    def initialize_population(self, low, high, allow_duplicate_genes, mutation_by_replacement, gene_type):
1292
1293        """
1294        Creates an initial population randomly as a NumPy array. The array is saved in the instance attribute named 'population'.
1295
1296        low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher.
1297        high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.
1298
1299        This method assigns the values of the following 3 instance attributes:
1300            1. pop_size: Size of the population.
1301            2. population: Initially, holds the initial population and later updated after each generation.
1302            3. init_population: Keeping the initial population.
1303        """
1304
1305        # Population size = (number of chromosomes, number of genes per chromosome)
1306        self.pop_size = (self.sol_per_pop,
1307                         self.num_genes)  # The population will have sol_per_pop chromosome where each chromosome has num_genes genes.
1308
1309        if self.gene_space is None:
1310            # Creating the initial population randomly.
1311            if self.gene_type_single == True:
1312                self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1313                                                                     high=high,
1314                                                                     size=self.pop_size),
1315                                                dtype=self.gene_type[
1316                                                    0])  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
1317            else:
1318                # Create an empty population of dtype=object to support storing mixed data types within the same array.
1319                self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1320                # Loop through the genes, randomly generate the values of a single gene across the entire population, and add the values of each gene to the population.
1321                for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1322                    # A vector of all values of this single gene across all solutions in the population.
1323                    gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1324                                                                     high=high,
1325                                                                     size=self.pop_size[0]),
1326                                                dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1327                    # Adding the current gene values to the population.
1328                    self.population[:, gene_idx] = gene_values
1329
1330            if allow_duplicate_genes == False:
1331                for solution_idx in range(self.population.shape[0]):
1332                    # print("Before", self.population[solution_idx])
1333                    self.population[solution_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(
1334                        solution=self.population[solution_idx],
1335                        min_val=low,
1336                        max_val=high,
1337                        mutation_by_replacement=True,
1338                        gene_type=gene_type,
1339                        num_trials=10)
1340                    # print("After", self.population[solution_idx])
1341
1342        elif self.gene_space_nested:
1343            if self.gene_type_single == True:
1344                self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1345                for sol_idx in range(self.sol_per_pop):
1346                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1347                        if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [list, tuple, range]:
1348                            # Check if the gene space has None values. If any, then replace it with randomly generated values according to the 3 attributes init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type.
1349                            if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) is range:
1350                                temp = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
1351                            else:
1352                                temp = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1353                            for idx, val in enumerate(self.gene_space[gene_idx]):
1354                                if val is None:
1355                                    self.gene_space[gene_idx][idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1356                                                                                                        high=high,
1357                                                                                                        size=1),
1358                                                                                   dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1359                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = random.choice(self.gene_space[gene_idx])
1360                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[0](self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx])
1361                            self.gene_space[gene_idx] = temp
1362                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) is dict:
1363                            if 'step' in self.gene_space[gene_idx].keys():
1364                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1365                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1366                                                                               stop=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1367                                                                               step=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['step']),
1368                                                                  size=1),
1369                                              dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1370                            else:
1371                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1372                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1373                                                                   high=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1374                                                                   size=1),
1375                                              dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1376                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) == type(None):
1377
1378                            # The following commented code replace the None value with a single number that will not change again.
1379                            # This means the gene value will be the same across all solutions.
1380                            # self.gene_space[gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1381                            #                high=high,
1382                            #                size=1), dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1383                            # self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1384
1385                            # The above problem is solved by keeping the None value in the gene_space parameter. This forces PyGAD to generate this value for each solution.
1386                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1387                                                                                                    high=high,
1388                                                                                                    size=1),
1389                                                                               dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1390                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1391                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
1392            else:
1393                self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1394                for sol_idx in range(self.sol_per_pop):
1395                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1396                        if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [list, tuple, range]:
1397                            # Check if the gene space has None values. If any, then replace it with randomly generated values according to the 3 attributes init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type.
1398                            temp = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1399                            for idx, val in enumerate(self.gene_space[gene_idx]):
1400                                if val is None:
1401                                    self.gene_space[gene_idx][idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1402                                                                                                        high=high,
1403                                                                                                        size=1),
1404                                                                                   dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1405                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = random.choice(self.gene_space[gene_idx])
1406                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](
1407                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx])
1408                            self.gene_space[gene_idx] = temp.copy()
1409                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) is dict:
1410                            if 'step' in self.gene_space[gene_idx].keys():
1411                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1412                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1413                                                                               stop=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1414                                                                               step=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['step']),
1415                                                                  size=1),
1416                                              dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1417                            else:
1418                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1419                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1420                                                                   high=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1421                                                                   size=1),
1422                                              dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1423                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) == type(None):
1424                            # self.gene_space[gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1425                            #                                                                high=high,
1426                            #                                                                size=1),
1427                            #                                           dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1428
1429                            # self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1430
1431                            temp = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1432                                                                      high=high,
1433                                                                      size=1),
1434                                                 dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1435                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = temp
1436                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1437                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
1438        else:
1439            if self.gene_type_single == True:
1440                # Replace all the None values with random values using the init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type attributes.
1441                for idx, curr_gene_space in enumerate(self.gene_space):
1442                    if curr_gene_space is None:
1443                        self.gene_space[idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1444                                                                                  high=high,
1445                                                                                  size=1),
1446                                                             dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1447
1448                # Creating the initial population by randomly selecting the genes' values from the values inside the 'gene_space' parameter.
1449                if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
1450                    if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
1451                        self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
1452                                                                                         stop=self.gene_space['high'],
1453                                                                                         step=self.gene_space['step']),
1454                                                                            size=self.pop_size),
1455                                                        dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1456                    else:
1457                        self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
1458                                                                             high=self.gene_space['high'],
1459                                                                             size=self.pop_size),
1460                                                        dtype=self.gene_type[
1461                                                            0])  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
1462                else:
1463                    self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(self.gene_space,
1464                                                                        size=self.pop_size),
1465                                                    dtype=self.gene_type[
1466                                                        0])  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
1467            else:
1468                # Replace all the None values with random values using the init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type attributes.
1469                for gene_idx, curr_gene_space in enumerate(self.gene_space):
1470                    if curr_gene_space is None:
1471                        self.gene_space[gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1472                                                                                       high=high,
1473                                                                                       size=1),
1474                                                                  dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1475
1476                # Creating the initial population by randomly selecting the genes' values from the values inside the 'gene_space' parameter.
1477                if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
1478                    # Create an empty population of dtype=object to support storing mixed data types within the same array.
1479                    self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1480                    # Loop through the genes, randomly generate the values of a single gene across the entire population, and add the values of each gene to the population.
1481                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1482                        # A vector of all values of this single gene across all solutions in the population.
1483                        if 'step' in self.gene_space[gene_idx].keys():
1484                            gene_values = numpy.asarray(
1485                                numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1486                                                                 stop=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1487                                                                 step=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['step']),
1488                                                    size=self.pop_size[0]),
1489                                dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1490                        else:
1491                            gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
1492                                                                             high=self.gene_space['high'],
1493                                                                             size=self.pop_size[0]),
1494                                                        dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1495                        # Adding the current gene values to the population.
1496                        self.population[:, gene_idx] = gene_values
1497
1498                else:
1499                    # Create an empty population of dtype=object to support storing mixed data types within the same array.
1500                    self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1501                    # Loop through the genes, randomly generate the values of a single gene across the entire population, and add the values of each gene to the population.
1502                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1503                        # A vector of all values of this single gene across all solutions in the population.
1504                        gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(self.gene_space,
1505                                                                        size=self.pop_size[0]),
1506                                                    dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1507                        # Adding the current gene values to the population.
1508                        self.population[:, gene_idx] = gene_values
1509
1510        if not (self.gene_space is None):
1511            if allow_duplicate_genes == False:
1512                for sol_idx in range(self.population.shape[0]):
1513                    self.population[sol_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(
1514                        solution=self.population[sol_idx],
1515                        gene_type=self.gene_type,
1516                        num_trials=10,
1517                        build_initial_pop=True)
1518
1519        # Keeping the initial population in the initial_population attribute.
1520        self.initial_population = self.population.copy()
1521
1522    def cal_pop_fitness(self):
1523
1524        """
1525        Calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the current population.
1526        It returns:
1527            -fitness: An array of the calculated fitness values.
1528        """
1529
1530        if self.valid_parameters == False:
1531            raise Exception(
1532                "ERROR calling the cal_pop_fitness() method: \nPlease check the parameters passed while creating an instance of the GA class.\n")
1533
1534        pop_fitness = ["undefined"] * len(self.population)
1535
1536        if self.parallel_processing is None:
1537            # Calculating the fitness value of each solution in the current population.
1538            for sol_idx, sol in enumerate(self.population):
1539
1540                # Check if the `save_solutions` parameter is `True` and whether the solution already exists in the `solutions` list. If so, use its fitness rather than calculating it again.
1541                if (self.save_solutions) and (list(sol) in self.solutions):
1542                    fitness = self.solutions_fitness[self.solutions.index(list(sol))]
1543                # If the solutions are not saved (i.e. `save_solutions=False`), check if this solution is a parent from the previous generation and its fitness value is already calculated. If so, use the fitness value instead of calling the fitness function.
1544                elif (self.last_generation_parents is not None) and len(
1545                        numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0] > 0):
1546                    # Index of the parent in the parents array (self.last_generation_parents). This is not its index within the population.
1547                    parent_idx = numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0][0]
1548                    # Index of the parent in the population.
1549                    parent_idx = self.last_generation_parents_indices[parent_idx]
1550                    # Use the parent's index to return its pre-calculated fitness value.
1551                    fitness = self.previous_generation_fitness[parent_idx]
1552                else:
1553                    fitness = self.fitness_func(sol, sol_idx, self.args)
1554                    if type(fitness) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1555                        pass
1556                    else:
1557                        raise ValueError(
1558                            "The fitness function should return a number but the value {fit_val} of type {fit_type} found.".format(
1559                                fit_val=fitness, fit_type=type(fitness)))
1560                pop_fitness[sol_idx] = fitness
1561        else:
1562
1563            # Calculating the fitness value of each solution in the current population.
1564            for sol_idx, sol in enumerate(self.population):
1565                # Check if the `save_solutions` parameter is `True` and whether the solution already exists in the `solutions` list. If so, use its fitness rather than calculating it again.
1566                if (self.save_solutions) and (list(sol) in self.solutions):
1567                    fitness = self.solutions_fitness[self.solutions.index(list(sol))]
1568                # If the solutions are not saved (i.e. `save_solutions=False`), check if this solution is a parent from the previous generation and its fitness value is already calculated. If so, use the fitness value instead of calling the fitness function.
1569                if not (self.last_generation_parents is None) and len(
1570                        numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0] > 0):
1571                    # Index of the parent in the parents array (self.last_generation_parents). This is not its index within the population.
1572                    parent_idx = numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0][0]
1573                    # Index of the parent in the population.
1574                    parent_idx = self.last_generation_parents_indices[parent_idx]
1575                    # Use the parent's index to return its pre-calculated fitness value.
1576                    fitness = self.last_generation_fitness[parent_idx]
1577
1578                    pop_fitness[sol_idx] = fitness
1579
1580            # Decide which class to use based on whether the user selected "process" or "thread"
1581            # if self.parallel_processing[0] == "process":
1582            #     ExecutorClassR = concurrent.futures.ProcessPoolExecutor
1583            # else:
1584            #     ExecutorClassR = concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor
1585
1586            # with multiprocessing.Pool(self.parallel_processing[1]) as pool:
1587
1588            solutions_to_submit_indices = []
1589            solutions_to_submit = []
1590
1591            for sol_idx, sol in enumerate(self.population):
1592                # The "undefined" value means that the fitness of this solution must be calculated.
1593                if pop_fitness[sol_idx] == "undefined":
1594                    solutions_to_submit.append(sol.copy())
1595                    solutions_to_submit_indices.append(sol_idx)
1596
1597            worker = partial(self.fitness_func, args=self.args)
1598
1599            for index, fitness in zip(solutions_to_submit_indices
1600                    , self._pool.starmap(worker
1601                        , zip(solutions_to_submit
1602                            , range(len(solutions_to_submit_indices)))
1603                                   )):
1604                if type(fitness) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1605                    pop_fitness[index] = fitness
1606                else:
1607                    raise ValueError(
1608                        "The fitness function should return a number but the value {fit_val} of type {fit_type} found.".format(
1609                            fit_val=fitness, fit_type=type(fitness)))
1610
1611        pop_fitness = numpy.array(pop_fitness)
1612
1613        return pop_fitness
1614
1615    def run(self):
1616
1617        """
1618        Runs the genetic algorithm. This is the main method in which the genetic algorithm is evolved through a number of generations.
1619        """
1620
1621        if self.valid_parameters == False:
1622            raise Exception(
1623                "Error calling the run() method: \nThe run() method cannot be executed with invalid parameters. Please check the parameters passed while creating an instance of the GA class.\n")
1624
1625        # Starting from PyGAD 2.18.0, the 4 properties (best_solutions, best_solutions_fitness, solutions, and solutions_fitness) are no longer reset with each call to the run() method. Instead, they are extended.
1626        # For example, if there are 50 generations and the user set save_best_solutions=True, then the length of the 2 properties best_solutions and best_solutions_fitness will be 50 after the first call to the run() method, then 100 after the second call, 150 after the third, and so on.
1627
1628        # self.best_solutions: Holds the best solution in each generation.
1629        if type(self.best_solutions) is numpy.ndarray:
1630            self.best_solutions = list(self.best_solutions)
1631        # self.best_solutions_fitness: A list holding the fitness value of the best solution for each generation.
1632        if type(self.best_solutions_fitness) is numpy.ndarray:
1633            self.best_solutions_fitness = list(self.best_solutions_fitness)
1634        # self.solutions: Holds the solutions in each generation.
1635        if type(self.solutions) is numpy.ndarray:
1636            self.solutions = list(self.solutions)
1637        # self.solutions_fitness: Holds the fitness of the solutions in each generation.
1638        if type(self.solutions_fitness) is numpy.ndarray:
1639            self.solutions_fitness = list(self.solutions_fitness)
1640
1641        if not (self.on_start is None):
1642            self.on_start(self)
1643
1644        stop_run = False
1645
1646        # Measuring the fitness of each chromosome in the population. Save the fitness in the last_generation_fitness attribute.
1647
1648        if self.parallel_processing is None:
1649            self._pool = None
1650        else:
1651            self._pool = multiprocessing.Pool(self.parallel_processing[1])
1652
1653        self.last_generation_fitness = self.cal_pop_fitness()
1654
1655        best_solution, best_solution_fitness, best_match_idx = self.best_solution(
1656            pop_fitness=self.last_generation_fitness)
1657
1658        # Appending the best solution in the initial population to the best_solutions list.
1659        if self.save_best_solutions:
1660            self.best_solutions.append(best_solution)
1661
1662        for generation in range(self.num_generations):
1663            if not (self.on_fitness is None):
1664                self.on_fitness(self, self.last_generation_fitness)
1665
1666            # Appending the fitness value of the best solution in the current generation to the best_solutions_fitness attribute.
1667            self.best_solutions_fitness.append(best_solution_fitness)
1668
1669            # Appending the solutions in the current generation to the solutions list.
1670            if self.save_solutions:
1671                # self.solutions.extend(self.population.copy())
1672                population_as_list = self.population.copy()
1673                population_as_list = [list(item) for item in population_as_list]
1674                self.solutions.extend(population_as_list)
1675
1676                self.solutions_fitness.extend(self.last_generation_fitness)
1677
1678            # Selecting the best parents in the population for mating.
1679            if callable(self.parent_selection_type):
1680                self.last_generation_parents, self.last_generation_parents_indices = self.select_parents(
1681                    self.last_generation_fitness, self.num_parents_mating, self)
1682            else:
1683                self.last_generation_parents, self.last_generation_parents_indices = self.select_parents(
1684                    self.last_generation_fitness, num_parents=self.num_parents_mating)
1685            if not (self.on_parents is None):
1686                self.on_parents(self, self.last_generation_parents)
1687
1688            # If self.crossover_type=None, then no crossover is applied and thus no offspring will be created in the next generations. The next generation will use the solutions in the current population.
1689            if self.crossover_type is None:
1690                if self.keep_elitism == 0:
1691                    num_parents_to_keep = self.num_parents_mating if self.keep_parents == -1 else self.keep_parents
1692                    if self.num_offspring <= num_parents_to_keep:
1693                        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = self.last_generation_parents[0:self.num_offspring]
1694                    else:
1695                        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = numpy.concatenate((self.last_generation_parents,
1696                                                                                      self.population[0:(
1697                                                                                                  self.num_offspring -
1698                                                                                                  self.last_generation_parents.shape[
1699                                                                                                      0])]))
1700                else:
1701                    # The steady_state_selection() method is called to select the best solutions (i.e. elitism). The keep_elitism parameter defines the number of these solutions.
1702                    # The steady_state_selection() method is still called here even if its output may not be used given that the condition of the next if statement is True. The reason is that it will be used later.
1703                    self.last_generation_elitism, _ = self.steady_state_selection(self.last_generation_fitness,
1704                                                                                  num_parents=self.keep_elitism)
1705                    if self.num_offspring <= self.keep_elitism:
1706                        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = self.last_generation_parents[0:self.num_offspring]
1707                    else:
1708                        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = numpy.concatenate((self.last_generation_elitism,
1709                                                                                      self.population[0:(
1710                                                                                                  self.num_offspring -
1711                                                                                                  self.last_generation_elitism.shape[
1712                                                                                                      0])]))
1713            else:
1714                # Generating offspring using crossover.
1715                if callable(self.crossover_type):
1716                    self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = self.crossover(self.last_generation_parents,
1717                                                                              (self.num_offspring, self.num_genes),
1718                                                                              self)
1719                else:
1720                    self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = self.crossover(self.last_generation_parents,
1721                                                                              offspring_size=(
1722                                                                              self.num_offspring, self.num_genes))
1723                if not (self.on_crossover is None):
1724                    self.on_crossover(self, self.last_generation_offspring_crossover)
1725
1726            # If self.mutation_type=None, then no mutation is applied and thus no changes are applied to the offspring created using the crossover operation. The offspring will be used unchanged in the next generation.
1727            if self.mutation_type is None:
1728                self.last_generation_offspring_mutation = self.last_generation_offspring_crossover
1729            else:
1730                # Adding some variations to the offspring using mutation.
1731                if callable(self.mutation_type):
1732                    self.last_generation_offspring_mutation = self.mutation(self.last_generation_offspring_crossover,
1733                                                                            self)
1734                else:
1735                    self.last_generation_offspring_mutation = self.mutation(self.last_generation_offspring_crossover)
1736                if not (self.on_mutation is None):
1737                    self.on_mutation(self, self.last_generation_offspring_mutation)
1738
1739            # Update the population attribute according to the offspring generated.
1740            if self.keep_elitism == 0:
1741                # If the keep_elitism parameter is 0, then the keep_parents parameter will be used to decide if the parents are kept in the next generation.
1742                if (self.keep_parents == 0):
1743                    self.population = self.last_generation_offspring_mutation
1744                elif (self.keep_parents == -1):
1745                    # Creating the new population based on the parents and offspring.
1746                    self.population[0:self.last_generation_parents.shape[0], :] = self.last_generation_parents
1747                    self.population[self.last_generation_parents.shape[0]:, :] = self.last_generation_offspring_mutation
1748                elif (self.keep_parents > 0):
1749                    parents_to_keep, _ = self.steady_state_selection(self.last_generation_fitness,
1750                                                                     num_parents=self.keep_parents)
1751                    self.population[0:parents_to_keep.shape[0], :] = parents_to_keep
1752                    self.population[parents_to_keep.shape[0]:, :] = self.last_generation_offspring_mutation
1753            else:
1754                self.last_generation_elitism, _ = self.steady_state_selection(self.last_generation_fitness,
1755                                                                              num_parents=self.keep_elitism)
1756                self.population[0:self.last_generation_elitism.shape[0], :] = self.last_generation_elitism
1757                self.population[self.last_generation_elitism.shape[0]:, :] = self.last_generation_offspring_mutation
1758
1759            self.generations_completed = generation + 1  # The generations_completed attribute holds the number of the last completed generation.
1760
1761            self.previous_generation_fitness = self.last_generation_fitness.copy()
1762
1763            # Measuring the fitness of each chromosome in the population. Save the fitness in the last_generation_fitness attribute.
1764            self.last_generation_fitness = self.cal_pop_fitness()
1765            best_solution, best_solution_fitness, best_match_idx = self.best_solution(
1766                pop_fitness=self.last_generation_fitness)
1767
1768            # Appending the best solution in the current generation to the best_solutions list.
1769            if self.save_best_solutions:
1770                self.best_solutions.append(best_solution)
1771
1772            # If the callback_generation attribute is not None, then cal the callback function after the generation.
1773            if not (self.on_generation is None):
1774                r = self.on_generation(self)
1775                if type(r) is str and r.lower() == "stop":
1776                    # Before aborting the loop, save the fitness value of the best solution.
1777                    _, best_solution_fitness, _ = self.best_solution(pop_fitness=self.last_generation_fitness)
1778                    self.best_solutions_fitness.append(best_solution_fitness)
1779                    break
1780
1781            if not self.stop_criteria is None:
1782                for criterion in self.stop_criteria:
1783                    if criterion[0] == "reach":
1784                        if max(self.last_generation_fitness) >= criterion[1]:
1785                            stop_run = True
1786                            break
1787                    elif criterion[0] == "saturate":
1788                        criterion[1] = int(criterion[1])
1789                        if (self.generations_completed >= criterion[1]):
1790                            if (self.best_solutions_fitness[self.generations_completed - 1] -
1791                                self.best_solutions_fitness[self.generations_completed - criterion[1]]) <= criterion[2]:
1792                                stop_run = True
1793                                break
1794
1795            if stop_run:
1796                break
1797
1798            time.sleep(self.delay_after_gen)
1799
1800        # Save the fitness of the last generation.
1801        if self.save_solutions:
1802            population_as_list = self.population.copy()
1803            population_as_list = [list(item) for item in population_as_list]
1804            self.solutions.extend(population_as_list)
1805
1806            self.solutions_fitness.extend(self.last_generation_fitness)
1807
1808        # Save the fitness value of the best solution.
1809
1810        _, best_solution_fitness, _ = self.best_solution(pop_fitness=self.last_generation_fitness)
1811        self.best_solutions_fitness.append(best_solution_fitness)
1812
1813        self.best_solution_generation = \
1814        numpy.where(numpy.array(self.best_solutions_fitness) == numpy.max(numpy.array(self.best_solutions_fitness)))[0][
1815            0]
1816        # After the run() method completes, the run_completed flag is changed from False to True.
1817        self.run_completed = True  # Set to True only after the run() method completes gracefully.
1818
1819        if not (self.on_stop is None):
1820            self.on_stop(self, self.last_generation_fitness)
1821
1822        # Converting the 'best_solutions' list into a NumPy array.
1823        self.best_solutions = numpy.array(self.best_solutions)
1824
1825        # Converting the 'solutions' list into a NumPy array.
1826        # self.solutions = numpy.array(self.solutions)
1827
1828    def steady_state_selection(self, fitness, num_parents):
1829
1830        """
1831        Selects the parents using the steady-state selection technique. Later, these parents will mate to produce the offspring.
1832        It accepts 2 parameters:
1833            -fitness: The fitness values of the solutions in the current population.
1834            -num_parents: The number of parents to be selected.
1835        It returns an array of the selected parents.
1836        """
1837
1838        fitness_sorted = sorted(range(len(fitness)), key=lambda k: fitness[k])
1839        fitness_sorted.reverse()
1840        # Selecting the best individuals in the current generation as parents for producing the offspring of the next generation.
1841        if self.gene_type_single == True:
1842            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1843        else:
1844            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=object)
1845        for parent_num in range(num_parents):
1846            parents[parent_num, :] = self.population[fitness_sorted[parent_num], :].copy()
1847
1848        return parents, fitness_sorted[:num_parents]
1849
1850    def rank_selection(self, fitness, num_parents):
1851
1852        """
1853        Selects the parents using the rank selection technique. Later, these parents will mate to produce the offspring.
1854        It accepts 2 parameters:
1855            -fitness: The fitness values of the solutions in the current population.
1856            -num_parents: The number of parents to be selected.
1857        It returns an array of the selected parents.
1858        """
1859
1860        fitness_sorted = sorted(range(len(fitness)), key=lambda k: fitness[k])
1861        fitness_sorted.reverse()
1862        # Selecting the best individuals in the current generation as parents for producing the offspring of the next generation.
1863        if self.gene_type_single == True:
1864            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1865        else:
1866            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=object)
1867        for parent_num in range(num_parents):
1868            parents[parent_num, :] = self.population[fitness_sorted[parent_num], :].copy()
1869
1870        return parents, fitness_sorted[:num_parents]
1871
1872    def random_selection(self, fitness, num_parents):
1873
1874        """
1875        Selects the parents randomly. Later, these parents will mate to produce the offspring.
1876        It accepts 2 parameters:
1877            -fitness: The fitness values of the solutions in the current population.
1878            -num_parents: The number of parents to be selected.
1879        It returns an array of the selected parents.
1880        """
1881
1882        if self.gene_type_single == True:
1883            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1884        else:
1885            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=object)
1886
1887        rand_indices = numpy.random.randint(low=0.0, high=fitness.shape[0], size=num_parents)
1888
1889        for parent_num in range(num_parents):
1890            parents[parent_num, :] = self.population[rand_indices[parent_num], :].copy()
1891
1892        return parents, rand_indices
1893
1894    def tournament_selection(self, fitness, num_parents):
1895
1896        """
1897        Selects the parents using the tournament selection technique. Later, these parents will mate to produce the offspring.
1898        It accepts 2 parameters:
1899            -fitness: The fitness values of the solutions in the current population.
1900            -num_parents: The number of parents to be selected.
1901        It returns an array of the selected parents.
1902        """
1903
1904        if self.gene_type_single == True:
1905            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1906        else:
1907            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=object)
1908
1909        parents_indices = []
1910
1911        for parent_num in range(num_parents):
1912            rand_indices = numpy.random.randint(low=0.0, high=len(fitness), size=self.K_tournament)
1913            K_fitnesses = fitness[rand_indices]
1914            selected_parent_idx = numpy.where(K_fitnesses == numpy.max(K_fitnesses))[0][0]
1915            parents_indices.append(rand_indices[selected_parent_idx])
1916            parents[parent_num, :] = self.population[rand_indices[selected_parent_idx], :].copy()
1917
1918        return parents, parents_indices
1919
1920    def roulette_wheel_selection(self, fitness, num_parents):
1921
1922        """
1923        Selects the parents using the roulette wheel selection technique. Later, these parents will mate to produce the offspring.
1924        It accepts 2 parameters:
1925            -fitness: The fitness values of the solutions in the current population.
1926            -num_parents: The number of parents to be selected.
1927        It returns an array of the selected parents.
1928        """
1929
1930        fitness_sum = numpy.sum(fitness)
1931        if fitness_sum == 0:
1932            raise ZeroDivisionError("Cannot proceed because the sum of fitness values is zero. Cannot divide by zero.")
1933        probs = fitness / fitness_sum
1934        probs_start = numpy.zeros(probs.shape,
1935                                  dtype=numpy.float)  # An array holding the start values of the ranges of probabilities.
1936        probs_end = numpy.zeros(probs.shape,
1937                                dtype=numpy.float)  # An array holding the end values of the ranges of probabilities.
1938
1939        curr = 0.0
1940
1941        # Calculating the probabilities of the solutions to form a roulette wheel.
1942        for _ in range(probs.shape[0]):
1943            min_probs_idx = numpy.where(probs == numpy.min(probs))[0][0]
1944            probs_start[min_probs_idx] = curr
1945            curr = curr + probs[min_probs_idx]
1946            probs_end[min_probs_idx] = curr
1947            probs[min_probs_idx] = 99999999999
1948
1949        # Selecting the best individuals in the current generation as parents for producing the offspring of the next generation.
1950        if self.gene_type_single == True:
1951            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1952        else:
1953            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=object)
1954
1955        parents_indices = []
1956
1957        for parent_num in range(num_parents):
1958            rand_prob = numpy.random.rand()
1959            for idx in range(probs.shape[0]):
1960                if (rand_prob >= probs_start[idx] and rand_prob < probs_end[idx]):
1961                    parents[parent_num, :] = self.population[idx, :].copy()
1962                    parents_indices.append(idx)
1963                    break
1964        return parents, parents_indices
1965
1966    def stochastic_universal_selection(self, fitness, num_parents):
1967
1968        """
1969        Selects the parents using the stochastic universal selection technique. Later, these parents will mate to produce the offspring.
1970        It accepts 2 parameters:
1971            -fitness: The fitness values of the solutions in the current population.
1972            -num_parents: The number of parents to be selected.
1973        It returns an array of the selected parents.
1974        """
1975
1976        fitness_sum = numpy.sum(fitness)
1977        if fitness_sum == 0:
1978            raise ZeroDivisionError("Cannot proceed because the sum of fitness values is zero. Cannot divide by zero.")
1979        probs = fitness / fitness_sum
1980        probs_start = numpy.zeros(probs.shape,
1981                                  dtype=numpy.float)  # An array holding the start values of the ranges of probabilities.
1982        probs_end = numpy.zeros(probs.shape,
1983                                dtype=numpy.float)  # An array holding the end values of the ranges of probabilities.
1984
1985        curr = 0.0
1986
1987        # Calculating the probabilities of the solutions to form a roulette wheel.
1988        for _ in range(probs.shape[0]):
1989            min_probs_idx = numpy.where(probs == numpy.min(probs))[0][0]
1990            probs_start[min_probs_idx] = curr
1991            curr = curr + probs[min_probs_idx]
1992            probs_end[min_probs_idx] = curr
1993            probs[min_probs_idx] = 99999999999
1994
1995        pointers_distance = 1.0 / self.num_parents_mating  # Distance between different pointers.
1996        first_pointer = numpy.random.uniform(low=0.0, high=pointers_distance, size=1)  # Location of the first pointer.
1997
1998        # Selecting the best individuals in the current generation as parents for producing the offspring of the next generation.
1999        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2000            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=self.gene_type[0])
2001        else:
2002            parents = numpy.empty((num_parents, self.population.shape[1]), dtype=object)
2003
2004        parents_indices = []
2005
2006        for parent_num in range(num_parents):
2007            rand_pointer = first_pointer + parent_num * pointers_distance
2008            for idx in range(probs.shape[0]):
2009                if (rand_pointer >= probs_start[idx] and rand_pointer < probs_end[idx]):
2010                    parents[parent_num, :] = self.population[idx, :].copy()
2011                    parents_indices.append(idx)
2012                    break
2013        return parents, parents_indices
2014
2015    def single_point_crossover(self, parents, offspring_size):
2016
2017        """
2018        Applies the single-point crossover. It selects a point randomly at which crossover takes place between the pairs of parents.
2019        It accepts 2 parameters:
2020            -parents: The parents to mate for producing the offspring.
2021            -offspring_size: The size of the offspring to produce.
2022        It returns an array the produced offspring.
2023        """
2024
2025        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2026            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
2027        else:
2028            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=object)
2029
2030        for k in range(offspring_size[0]):
2031            # The point at which crossover takes place between two parents. Usually, it is at the center.
2032            crossover_point = numpy.random.randint(low=0, high=parents.shape[1], size=1)[0]
2033
2034            if not (self.crossover_probability is None):
2035                probs = numpy.random.random(size=parents.shape[0])
2036                indices = numpy.where(probs <= self.crossover_probability)[0]
2037
2038                # If no parent satisfied the probability, no crossover is applied and a parent is selected.
2039                if len(indices) == 0:
2040                    offspring[k, :] = parents[k % parents.shape[0], :]
2041                    continue
2042                elif len(indices) == 1:
2043                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2044                    parent2_idx = parent1_idx
2045                else:
2046                    indices = random.sample(set(indices), 2)
2047                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2048                    parent2_idx = indices[1]
2049            else:
2050                # Index of the first parent to mate.
2051                parent1_idx = k % parents.shape[0]
2052                # Index of the second parent to mate.
2053                parent2_idx = (k + 1) % parents.shape[0]
2054
2055            # The new offspring has its first half of its genes from the first parent.
2056            offspring[k, 0:crossover_point] = parents[parent1_idx, 0:crossover_point]
2057            # The new offspring has its second half of its genes from the second parent.
2058            offspring[k, crossover_point:] = parents[parent2_idx, crossover_point:]
2059
2060            if (self.mutation_type is None) and (self.allow_duplicate_genes == False):
2061                if self.gene_space is None:
2062                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(solution=offspring[k],
2063                                                                             min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2064                                                                             max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2065                                                                             mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
2066                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2067                                                                             num_trials=10)
2068                else:
2069                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(solution=offspring[k],
2070                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2071                                                                             num_trials=10)
2072
2073        return offspring
2074
2075    def two_points_crossover(self, parents, offspring_size):
2076
2077        """
2078        Applies the 2 points crossover. It selects the 2 points randomly at which crossover takes place between the pairs of parents.
2079        It accepts 2 parameters:
2080            -parents: The parents to mate for producing the offspring.
2081            -offspring_size: The size of the offspring to produce.
2082        It returns an array the produced offspring.
2083        """
2084
2085        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2086            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
2087        else:
2088            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=object)
2089
2090        for k in range(offspring_size[0]):
2091            if (parents.shape[
2092                1] == 1):  # If the chromosome has only a single gene. In this case, this gene is copied from the second parent.
2093                crossover_point1 = 0
2094            else:
2095                crossover_point1 = numpy.random.randint(low=0, high=numpy.ceil(parents.shape[1] / 2 + 1), size=1)[0]
2096
2097            crossover_point2 = crossover_point1 + int(
2098                parents.shape[1] / 2)  # The second point must always be greater than the first point.
2099
2100            if not (self.crossover_probability is None):
2101                probs = numpy.random.random(size=parents.shape[0])
2102                indices = numpy.where(probs <= self.crossover_probability)[0]
2103
2104                # If no parent satisfied the probability, no crossover is applied and a parent is selected.
2105                if len(indices) == 0:
2106                    offspring[k, :] = parents[k % parents.shape[0], :]
2107                    continue
2108                elif len(indices) == 1:
2109                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2110                    parent2_idx = parent1_idx
2111                else:
2112                    indices = random.sample(set(indices), 2)
2113                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2114                    parent2_idx = indices[1]
2115            else:
2116                # Index of the first parent to mate.
2117                parent1_idx = k % parents.shape[0]
2118                # Index of the second parent to mate.
2119                parent2_idx = (k + 1) % parents.shape[0]
2120
2121            # The genes from the beginning of the chromosome up to the first point are copied from the first parent.
2122            offspring[k, 0:crossover_point1] = parents[parent1_idx, 0:crossover_point1]
2123            # The genes from the second point up to the end of the chromosome are copied from the first parent.
2124            offspring[k, crossover_point2:] = parents[parent1_idx, crossover_point2:]
2125            # The genes between the 2 points are copied from the second parent.
2126            offspring[k, crossover_point1:crossover_point2] = parents[parent2_idx, crossover_point1:crossover_point2]
2127
2128            if (self.mutation_type is None) and (self.allow_duplicate_genes == False):
2129                if self.gene_space is None:
2130                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(solution=offspring[k],
2131                                                                             min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2132                                                                             max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2133                                                                             mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
