2134                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2135                                                                             num_trials=10)
2136                else:
2137                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(solution=offspring[k],
2138                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2139                                                                             num_trials=10)
2140        return offspring
2141
2142    def uniform_crossover(self, parents, offspring_size):
2143
2144        """
2145        Applies the uniform crossover. For each gene, a parent out of the 2 mating parents is selected randomly and the gene is copied from it.
2146        It accepts 2 parameters:
2147            -parents: The parents to mate for producing the offspring.
2148            -offspring_size: The size of the offspring to produce.
2149        It returns an array the produced offspring.
2150        """
2151
2152        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2153            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
2154        else:
2155            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=object)
2156
2157        for k in range(offspring_size[0]):
2158            if not (self.crossover_probability is None):
2159                probs = numpy.random.random(size=parents.shape[0])
2160                indices = numpy.where(probs <= self.crossover_probability)[0]
2161
2162                # If no parent satisfied the probability, no crossover is applied and a parent is selected.
2163                if len(indices) == 0:
2164                    offspring[k, :] = parents[k % parents.shape[0], :]
2165                    continue
2166                elif len(indices) == 1:
2167                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2168                    parent2_idx = parent1_idx
2169                else:
2170                    indices = random.sample(set(indices), 2)
2171                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2172                    parent2_idx = indices[1]
2173            else:
2174                # Index of the first parent to mate.
2175                parent1_idx = k % parents.shape[0]
2176                # Index of the second parent to mate.
2177                parent2_idx = (k + 1) % parents.shape[0]
2178
2179            genes_source = numpy.random.randint(low=0, high=2, size=offspring_size[1])
2180            for gene_idx in range(offspring_size[1]):
2181                if (genes_source[gene_idx] == 0):
2182                    # The gene will be copied from the first parent if the current gene index is 0.
2183                    offspring[k, gene_idx] = parents[parent1_idx, gene_idx]
2184                elif (genes_source[gene_idx] == 1):
2185                    # The gene will be copied from the second parent if the current gene index is 1.
2186                    offspring[k, gene_idx] = parents[parent2_idx, gene_idx]
2187
2188            if (self.mutation_type is None) and (self.allow_duplicate_genes == False):
2189                if self.gene_space is None:
2190                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(solution=offspring[k],
2191                                                                             min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2192                                                                             max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2193                                                                             mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
2194                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2195                                                                             num_trials=10)
2196                else:
2197                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(solution=offspring[k],
2198                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2199                                                                             num_trials=10)
2200
2201        return offspring
2202
2203    def scattered_crossover(self, parents, offspring_size):
2204
2205        """
2206        Applies the scattered crossover. It randomly selects the gene from one of the 2 parents.
2207        It accepts 2 parameters:
2208            -parents: The parents to mate for producing the offspring.
2209            -offspring_size: The size of the offspring to produce.
2210        It returns an array the produced offspring.
2211        """
2212
2213        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2214            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
2215        else:
2216            offspring = numpy.empty(offspring_size, dtype=object)
2217
2218        for k in range(offspring_size[0]):
2219            if not (self.crossover_probability is None):
2220                probs = numpy.random.random(size=parents.shape[0])
2221                indices = numpy.where(probs <= self.crossover_probability)[0]
2222
2223                # If no parent satisfied the probability, no crossover is applied and a parent is selected.
2224                if len(indices) == 0:
2225                    offspring[k, :] = parents[k % parents.shape[0], :]
2226                    continue
2227                elif len(indices) == 1:
2228                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2229                    parent2_idx = parent1_idx
2230                else:
2231                    indices = random.sample(set(indices), 2)
2232                    parent1_idx = indices[0]
2233                    parent2_idx = indices[1]
2234            else:
2235                # Index of the first parent to mate.
2236                parent1_idx = k % parents.shape[0]
2237                # Index of the second parent to mate.
2238                parent2_idx = (k + 1) % parents.shape[0]
2239
2240            # A 0/1 vector where 0 means the gene is taken from the first parent and 1 means the gene is taken from the second parent.
2241            gene_sources = numpy.random.randint(0, 2, size=self.num_genes)
2242            offspring[k, :] = numpy.where(gene_sources == 0, parents[parent1_idx, :], parents[parent2_idx, :])
2243
2244            if (self.mutation_type is None) and (self.allow_duplicate_genes == False):
2245                if self.gene_space is None:
2246                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(solution=offspring[k],
2247                                                                             min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2248                                                                             max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2249                                                                             mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
2250                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2251                                                                             num_trials=10)
2252                else:
2253                    offspring[k], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(solution=offspring[k],
2254                                                                             gene_type=self.gene_type,
2255                                                                             num_trials=10)
2256        return offspring
2257
2258    def random_mutation(self, offspring):
2259
2260        """
2261        Applies the random mutation which changes the values of a number of genes randomly.
2262        The random value is selected either using the 'gene_space' parameter or the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2263        It accepts a single parameter:
2264            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2265        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2266        """
2267
2268        # If the mutation values are selected from the mutation space, the attribute 'gene_space' is not None. Otherwise, it is None.
2269        # When the 'mutation_probability' parameter exists (i.e. not None), then it is used in the mutation. Otherwise, the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter is used.
2270
2271        if self.mutation_probability is None:
2272            # When the 'mutation_probability' parameter does not exist (i.e. None), then the parameter 'mutation_num_genes' is used in the mutation.
2273            if not (self.gene_space is None):
2274                # When the attribute 'gene_space' exists (i.e. not None), the mutation values are selected randomly from the space of values of each gene.
2275                offspring = self.mutation_by_space(offspring)
2276            else:
2277                offspring = self.mutation_randomly(offspring)
2278        else:
2279            # When the 'mutation_probability' parameter exists (i.e. not None), then it is used in the mutation.
2280            if not (self.gene_space is None):
2281                # When the attribute 'gene_space' does not exist (i.e. None), the mutation values are selected randomly based on the continuous range specified by the 2 attributes 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2282                offspring = self.mutation_probs_by_space(offspring)
2283            else:
2284                offspring = self.mutation_probs_randomly(offspring)
2285
2286        return offspring
2287
2288    def mutation_by_space(self, offspring):
2289
2290        """
2291        Applies the random mutation using the mutation values' space.
2292        It accepts a single parameter:
2293            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2294        It returns an array of the mutated offspring using the mutation space.
2295        """
2296
2297        # For each offspring, a value from the gene space is selected randomly and assigned to the selected mutated gene.
2298        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2299            mutation_indices = numpy.array(random.sample(range(0, self.num_genes), self.mutation_num_genes))
2300            for gene_idx in mutation_indices:
2301
2302                if self.gene_space_nested:
2303                    # Returning the current gene space from the 'gene_space' attribute.
2304                    if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [numpy.ndarray, list]:
2305                        curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
2306                    else:
2307                        curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
2308
2309                    # If the gene space has only a single value, use it as the new gene value.
2310                    if type(curr_gene_space) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
2311                        value_from_space = curr_gene_space
2312                    # If the gene space is None, apply mutation by adding a random value between the range defined by the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2313                    elif curr_gene_space is None:
2314                        rand_val = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2315                                                        high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2316                                                        size=1)
2317                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2318                            value_from_space = rand_val
2319                        else:
2320                            value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + rand_val
2321                    elif type(curr_gene_space) is dict:
2322                        # The gene's space of type dict specifies the lower and upper limits of a gene.
2323                        if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
2324                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=curr_gene_space['low'],
2325                                                                                stop=curr_gene_space['high'],
2326                                                                                step=curr_gene_space['step']),
2327                                                                   size=1)
2328                        else:
2329                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=curr_gene_space['low'],
2330                                                                    high=curr_gene_space['high'],
2331                                                                    size=1)
2332                    else:
2333                        # Selecting a value randomly based on the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2334                        # If the gene space has only 1 value, then select it. The old and new values of the gene are identical.
2335                        if len(curr_gene_space) == 1:
2336                            value_from_space = curr_gene_space[0]
2337                        # If the gene space has more than 1 value, then select a new one that is different from the current value.
2338                        else:
2339                            values_to_select_from = list(
2340                                set(curr_gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2341                            if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2342                                value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2343                            else:
2344                                value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2345                else:
2346                    # Selecting a value randomly from the global gene space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2347                    if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
2348                        # When the gene_space is assigned a dict object, then it specifies the lower and upper limits of all genes in the space.
2349                        if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
2350                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
2351                                                                                stop=self.gene_space['high'],
2352                                                                                step=self.gene_space['step']),
2353                                                                   size=1)
2354                        else:
2355                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
2356                                                                    high=self.gene_space['high'],
2357                                                                    size=1)
2358                    else:
2359                        # If the space type is not of type dict, then a value is randomly selected from the gene_space attribute.
2360                        values_to_select_from = list(set(self.gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2361                        if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2362                            value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2363                        else:
2364                            value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2365                    # value_from_space = random.choice(self.gene_space)
2366
2367                if value_from_space is None:
2368                    value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2369                                                            high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2370                                                            size=1)
2371
2372                # Assinging the selected value from the space to the gene.
2373                if self.gene_type_single == True:
2374                    if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
2375                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(self.gene_type[0](value_from_space),
2376                                                                         self.gene_type[1])
2377                    else:
2378                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[0](value_from_space)
2379                else:
2380                    if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
2381                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space),
2382                                                                         self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
2383                    else:
2384                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space)
2385
2386                if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
2387                    offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(
2388                        solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
2389                        gene_type=self.gene_type,
2390                        num_trials=10)
2391        return offspring
2392
2393    def mutation_probs_by_space(self, offspring):
2394
2395        """
2396        Applies the random mutation using the mutation values' space and the mutation probability. For each gene, if its probability is <= that mutation probability, then it will be mutated based on the mutation space.
2397        It accepts a single parameter:
2398            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2399        It returns an array of the mutated offspring using the mutation space.
2400        """
2401
2402        # For each offspring, a value from the gene space is selected randomly and assigned to the selected mutated gene.
2403        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2404            probs = numpy.random.random(size=offspring.shape[1])
2405            for gene_idx in range(offspring.shape[1]):
2406                if probs[gene_idx] <= self.mutation_probability:
2407                    if self.gene_space_nested:
2408                        # Returning the current gene space from the 'gene_space' attribute.
2409                        if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [numpy.ndarray, list]:
2410                            curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
2411                        else:
2412                            curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
2413
2414                        # If the gene space has only a single value, use it as the new gene value.
2415                        if type(curr_gene_space) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
2416                            value_from_space = curr_gene_space
2417                        # If the gene space is None, apply mutation by adding a random value between the range defined by the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2418                        elif curr_gene_space is None:
2419                            rand_val = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2420                                                            high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2421                                                            size=1)
2422                            if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2423                                value_from_space = rand_val
2424                            else:
2425                                value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + rand_val
2426                        elif type(curr_gene_space) is dict:
2427                            # Selecting a value randomly from the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2428                            if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
2429                                value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=curr_gene_space['low'],
2430                                                                                    stop=curr_gene_space['high'],
2431                                                                                    step=curr_gene_space['step']),
2432                                                                       size=1)
2433                            else:
2434                                value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=curr_gene_space['low'],
2435                                                                        high=curr_gene_space['high'],
2436                                                                        size=1)
2437                        else:
2438                            # Selecting a value randomly from the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2439                            # If the gene space has only 1 value, then select it. The old and new values of the gene are identical.
2440                            if len(curr_gene_space) == 1:
2441                                value_from_space = curr_gene_space[0]
2442                            # If the gene space has more than 1 value, then select a new one that is different from the current value.
2443                            else:
2444                                values_to_select_from = list(
2445                                    set(curr_gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2446                                if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2447                                    value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2448                                else:
2449                                    value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2450                    else:
2451                        # Selecting a value randomly from the global gene space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2452                        if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
2453                            if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
2454                                value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
2455                                                                                    stop=self.gene_space['high'],
2456                                                                                    step=self.gene_space['step']),
2457                                                                       size=1)
2458                            else:
2459                                value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
2460                                                                        high=self.gene_space['high'],
2461                                                                        size=1)
2462                        else:
2463                            values_to_select_from = list(
2464                                set(self.gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2465                            if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2466                                value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2467                            else:
2468                                value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2469
2470                    # Assigning the selected value from the space to the gene.
2471                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2472                        if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
2473                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(self.gene_type[0](value_from_space),
2474                                                                             self.gene_type[1])
2475                        else:
2476                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[0](value_from_space)
2477                    else:
2478                        if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
2479                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(
2480                                self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space),
2481                                self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
2482                        else:
2483                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space)
2484
2485                    if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
2486                        offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(
2487                            solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
2488                            gene_type=self.gene_type,
2489                            num_trials=10)
2490        return offspring
2491
2492    def mutation_randomly(self, offspring):
2493
2494        """
2495        Applies the random mutation the mutation probability. For each gene, if its probability is <= that mutation probability, then it will be mutated randomly.
2496        It accepts a single parameter:
2497            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2498        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2499        """
2500
2501        # Random mutation changes one or more genes in each offspring randomly.
2502        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2503            mutation_indices = numpy.array(random.sample(range(0, self.num_genes), self.mutation_num_genes))
2504            for gene_idx in mutation_indices:
2505                # Generating a random value.
2506                random_value = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2507                                                    high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2508                                                    size=1)
2509                # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is True, then the random value replaces the current gene value.
2510                if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2511                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2512                        random_value = self.gene_type[0](random_value)
2513                    else:
2514                        random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](random_value)
2515                        if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
2516                            random_value = random_value[0]
2517                # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is False, then the random value is added to the gene value.
2518                else:
2519                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2520                        random_value = self.gene_type[0](offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
2521                    else:
2522                        random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
2523                        if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
2524                            random_value = random_value[0]
2525
2526                # Round the gene
2527                if self.gene_type_single == True:
2528                    if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
2529                        random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[1])
2530                else:
2531                    if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
2532                        random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
2533
2534                offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = random_value
2535
2536                if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
2537                    offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(
2538                        solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
2539                        min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2540                        max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2541                        mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
2542                        gene_type=self.gene_type,
2543                        num_trials=10)
2544
2545        return offspring
2546
2547    def mutation_probs_randomly(self, offspring):
2548
2549        """
2550        Applies the random mutation using the mutation probability. For each gene, if its probability is <= that mutation probability, then it will be mutated randomly.
2551        It accepts a single parameter:
2552            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2553        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2554        """
2555
2556        # Random mutation changes one or more gene in each offspring randomly.
2557        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2558            probs = numpy.random.random(size=offspring.shape[1])
2559            for gene_idx in range(offspring.shape[1]):
2560                if probs[gene_idx] <= self.mutation_probability:
2561                    # Generating a random value.
2562                    random_value = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2563                                                        high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2564                                                        size=1)
2565                    # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is True, then the random value replaces the current gene value.
2566                    if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2567                        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2568                            random_value = self.gene_type[0](random_value)
2569                        else:
2570                            random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](random_value)
2571                            if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
2572                                random_value = random_value[0]
2573                    # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is False, then the random value is added to the gene value.
2574                    else:
2575                        if self.gene_type_single == True:
2576                            random_value = self.gene_type[0](offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
2577                        else:
2578                            random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](
2579                                offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
2580                            if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
2581                                random_value = random_value[0]
2582
2583                    # Round the gene
2584                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2585                        if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
2586                            random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[1])
2587                    else:
2588                        if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
2589                            random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
2590
2591                    offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = random_value
2592
2593                    if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
2594                        offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(
2595                            solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
2596                            min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2597                            max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2598                            mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
2599                            gene_type=self.gene_type,
2600                            num_trials=10)
2601        return offspring
2602
2603    def swap_mutation(self, offspring):
2604
2605        """
2606        Applies the swap mutation which interchanges the values of 2 randomly selected genes.
2607        It accepts a single parameter:
2608            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2609        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2610        """
2611
2612        for idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2613            mutation_gene1 = numpy.random.randint(low=0, high=offspring.shape[1] / 2, size=1)[0]
2614            mutation_gene2 = mutation_gene1 + int(offspring.shape[1] / 2)
2615
2616            temp = offspring[idx, mutation_gene1]
2617            offspring[idx, mutation_gene1] = offspring[idx, mutation_gene2]
2618            offspring[idx, mutation_gene2] = temp
2619        return offspring
2620
2621    def inversion_mutation(self, offspring):
2622
2623        """
2624        Applies the inversion mutation which selects a subset of genes and inverts them (in order).
2625        It accepts a single parameter:
2626            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2627        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2628        """
2629
2630        for idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2631            mutation_gene1 = numpy.random.randint(low=0, high=numpy.ceil(offspring.shape[1] / 2 + 1), size=1)[0]
2632            mutation_gene2 = mutation_gene1 + int(offspring.shape[1] / 2)
2633
2634            genes_to_scramble = numpy.flip(offspring[idx, mutation_gene1:mutation_gene2])
2635            offspring[idx, mutation_gene1:mutation_gene2] = genes_to_scramble
2636        return offspring
2637
2638    def scramble_mutation(self, offspring):
2639
2640        """
2641        Applies the scramble mutation which selects a subset of genes and shuffles their order randomly.
2642        It accepts a single parameter:
2643            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2644        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2645        """
2646
2647        for idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2648            mutation_gene1 = numpy.random.randint(low=0, high=numpy.ceil(offspring.shape[1] / 2 + 1), size=1)[0]
2649            mutation_gene2 = mutation_gene1 + int(offspring.shape[1] / 2)
2650            genes_range = numpy.arange(start=mutation_gene1, stop=mutation_gene2)
2651            numpy.random.shuffle(genes_range)
2652
2653            genes_to_scramble = numpy.flip(offspring[idx, genes_range])
2654            offspring[idx, genes_range] = genes_to_scramble
2655        return offspring
2656
2657    def adaptive_mutation_population_fitness(self, offspring):
2658
2659        """
2660        A helper method to calculate the average fitness of the solutions before applying the adaptive mutation.
2661        It accepts a single parameter:
2662            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2663        It returns the average fitness to be used in adaptive mutation.
2664        """
2665
2666        fitness = self.last_generation_fitness.copy()
2667        temp_population = numpy.zeros_like(self.population)
2668
2669        if (self.keep_elitism == 0):
2670            if (self.keep_parents == 0):
2671                parents_to_keep = []
2672            elif (self.keep_parents == -1):
2673                parents_to_keep = self.last_generation_parents.copy()
2674                temp_population[0:len(parents_to_keep), :] = parents_to_keep
2675            elif (self.keep_parents > 0):
2676                parents_to_keep, _ = self.steady_state_selection(self.last_generation_fitness,
2677                                                                 num_parents=self.keep_parents)
2678                temp_population[0:len(parents_to_keep), :] = parents_to_keep
2679        else:
2680            parents_to_keep, _ = self.steady_state_selection(self.last_generation_fitness,
2681                                                             num_parents=self.keep_elitism)
2682            temp_population[0:len(parents_to_keep), :] = parents_to_keep
2683
2684        temp_population[len(parents_to_keep):, :] = offspring
2685
2686        fitness[:self.last_generation_parents.shape[0]] = self.last_generation_fitness[
2687            self.last_generation_parents_indices]
2688
2689        for idx in range(len(parents_to_keep), fitness.shape[0]):
2690            # fitness[idx] = self.fitness_func(temp_population[idx], None)
2691            fitness[idx] = self.fitness_func(temp_population[idx], None, self.args)  # FERMATRICA FIX
2692        average_fitness = numpy.mean(fitness)
2693
2694        return average_fitness, fitness[len(parents_to_keep):]
2695
2696    def adaptive_mutation(self, offspring):
2697
2698        """
2699        Applies the adaptive mutation which changes the values of a number of genes randomly. In adaptive mutation, the number of genes to mutate differs based on the fitness value of the solution.
2700        The random value is selected either using the 'gene_space' parameter or the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2701        It accepts a single parameter:
2702            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2703        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2704        """
2705
2706        # If the attribute 'gene_space' exists (i.e. not None), then the mutation values are selected from the 'gene_space' parameter according to the space of values of each gene. Otherwise, it is selected randomly based on the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2707        # When the 'mutation_probability' parameter exists (i.e. not None), then it is used in the mutation. Otherwise, the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter is used.
2708
2709        if self.mutation_probability is None:
2710            # When the 'mutation_probability' parameter does not exist (i.e. None), then the parameter 'mutation_num_genes' is used in the mutation.
2711            if not (self.gene_space is None):
2712                # When the attribute 'gene_space' exists (i.e. not None), the mutation values are selected randomly from the space of values of each gene.
2713                offspring = self.adaptive_mutation_by_space(offspring)
2714            else:
2715                # When the attribute 'gene_space' does not exist (i.e. None), the mutation values are selected randomly based on the continuous range specified by the 2 attributes 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2716                offspring = self.adaptive_mutation_randomly(offspring)
2717        else:
2718            # When the 'mutation_probability' parameter exists (i.e. not None), then it is used in the mutation.
2719            if not (self.gene_space is None):
2720                # When the attribute 'gene_space' exists (i.e. not None), the mutation values are selected randomly from the space of values of each gene.
2721                offspring = self.adaptive_mutation_probs_by_space(offspring)
2722            else:
2723                # When the attribute 'gene_space' does not exist (i.e. None), the mutation values are selected randomly based on the continuous range specified by the 2 attributes 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2724                offspring = self.adaptive_mutation_probs_randomly(offspring)
2725
2726        return offspring
2727
2728    def adaptive_mutation_by_space(self, offspring):
2729
2730        """
2731        Applies the adaptive mutation based on the 2 parameters 'mutation_num_genes' and 'gene_space'.
2732        A number of genes equal are selected randomly for mutation. This number depends on the fitness of the solution.
2733        The random values are selected from the 'gene_space' parameter.
2734        It accepts a single parameter:
2735            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2736        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2737        """
2738
2739        # For each offspring, a value from the gene space is selected randomly and assigned to the selected gene for mutation.
2740
2741        average_fitness, offspring_fitness = self.adaptive_mutation_population_fitness(offspring)
2742
2743        # Adaptive mutation changes one or more genes in each offspring randomly.
2744        # The number of genes to mutate depends on the solution's fitness value.
2745        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2746            if offspring_fitness[offspring_idx] < average_fitness:
2747                adaptive_mutation_num_genes = self.mutation_num_genes[0]
2748            else:
2749                adaptive_mutation_num_genes = self.mutation_num_genes[1]
2750            mutation_indices = numpy.array(random.sample(range(0, self.num_genes), adaptive_mutation_num_genes))
2751            for gene_idx in mutation_indices:
2752
2753                if self.gene_space_nested:
2754                    # Returning the current gene space from the 'gene_space' attribute.
2755                    if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [numpy.ndarray, list]:
2756                        curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
2757                    else:
2758                        curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
2759
2760                    # If the gene space has only a single value, use it as the new gene value.
2761                    if type(curr_gene_space) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
2762                        value_from_space = curr_gene_space
2763                    # If the gene space is None, apply mutation by adding a random value between the range defined by the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2764                    elif curr_gene_space is None:
2765                        rand_val = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2766                                                        high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2767                                                        size=1)
2768                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2769                            value_from_space = rand_val
2770                        else:
2771                            value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + rand_val
2772                    elif type(curr_gene_space) is dict:
2773                        # Selecting a value randomly from the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2774                        if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
2775                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=curr_gene_space['low'],
2776                                                                                stop=curr_gene_space['high'],
2777                                                                                step=curr_gene_space['step']),
2778                                                                   size=1)
2779                        else:
2780                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=curr_gene_space['low'],
2781                                                                    high=curr_gene_space['high'],
2782                                                                    size=1)
2783                    else:
2784                        # Selecting a value randomly from the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2785                        # If the gene space has only 1 value, then select it. The old and new values of the gene are identical.
2786                        if len(curr_gene_space) == 1:
2787                            value_from_space = curr_gene_space[0]
2788                        # If the gene space has more than 1 value, then select a new one that is different from the current value.
2789                        else:
2790                            values_to_select_from = list(
2791                                set(curr_gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2792                            if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2793                                value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2794                            else:
2795                                value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2796                else:
2797                    # Selecting a value randomly from the global gene space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2798                    if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
2799                        if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
2800                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
2801                                                                                stop=self.gene_space['high'],
2802                                                                                step=self.gene_space['step']),
2803                                                                   size=1)
2804                        else:
2805                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
2806                                                                    high=self.gene_space['high'],
2807                                                                    size=1)
2808                    else:
2809                        values_to_select_from = list(set(self.gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2810                        if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2811                            value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2812                        else:
2813                            value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2814
2815                if value_from_space is None:
2816                    value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2817                                                            high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2818                                                            size=1)
2819
2820                # Assinging the selected value from the space to the gene.
2821                if self.gene_type_single == True:
2822                    if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
2823                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(self.gene_type[0](value_from_space),
2824                                                                         self.gene_type[1])
2825                    else:
2826                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[0](value_from_space)
2827                else:
2828                    if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
2829                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space),
2830                                                                         self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
2831                    else:
2832                        offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space)
2833
2834                if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
2835                    offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(
2836                        solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
2837                        gene_type=self.gene_type,
2838                        num_trials=10)
2839        return offspring
2840
2841    def adaptive_mutation_randomly(self, offspring):
2842
2843        """
2844        Applies the adaptive mutation based on the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter.
2845        A number of genes equal are selected randomly for mutation. This number depends on the fitness of the solution.
2846        The random values are selected based on the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2847        It accepts a single parameter:
2848            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2849        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2850        """
2851
2852        average_fitness, offspring_fitness = self.adaptive_mutation_population_fitness(offspring)
2853
2854        # Adaptive random mutation changes one or more genes in each offspring randomly.
2855        # The number of genes to mutate depends on the solution's fitness value.
2856        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2857            if offspring_fitness[offspring_idx] < average_fitness:
2858                adaptive_mutation_num_genes = self.mutation_num_genes[0]
2859            else:
2860                adaptive_mutation_num_genes = self.mutation_num_genes[1]
2861            mutation_indices = numpy.array(random.sample(range(0, self.num_genes), adaptive_mutation_num_genes))
2862            for gene_idx in mutation_indices:
2863                # Generating a random value.
2864                random_value = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2865                                                    high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2866                                                    size=1)
2867                # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is True, then the random value replaces the current gene value.
2868                if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2869                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2870                        random_value = self.gene_type[0](random_value)
2871                    else:
2872                        random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](random_value)
2873                        if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
2874                            random_value = random_value[0]
2875                # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is False, then the random value is added to the gene value.
2876                else:
2877                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2878                        random_value = self.gene_type[0](offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
2879                    else:
2880                        random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
2881                        if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
2882                            random_value = random_value[0]
2883
2884                if self.gene_type_single == True:
2885                    if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
2886                        random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[1])
2887                else:
2888                    if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
2889                        random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
2890
2891                offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = random_value
2892
2893                if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
2894                    offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(
2895                        solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
2896                        min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2897                        max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2898                        mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
2899                        gene_type=self.gene_type,
2900                        num_trials=10)
2901        return offspring
2902
2903    def adaptive_mutation_probs_by_space(self, offspring):
2904
2905        """
2906        Applies the adaptive mutation based on the 2 parameters 'mutation_probability' and 'gene_space'.
2907        Based on whether the solution fitness is above or below a threshold, the mutation is applied diffrently by mutating high or low number of genes.
2908        The random values are selected based on space of values for each gene.
2909        It accepts a single parameter:
2910            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
2911        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
2912        """
2913
2914        # For each offspring, a value from the gene space is selected randomly and assigned to the selected gene for mutation.
2915
2916        average_fitness, offspring_fitness = self.adaptive_mutation_population_fitness(offspring)
2917
2918        # Adaptive random mutation changes one or more genes in each offspring randomly.
2919        # The probability of mutating a gene depends on the solution's fitness value.
2920        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
2921            if offspring_fitness[offspring_idx] < average_fitness:
2922                adaptive_mutation_probability = self.mutation_probability[0]
2923            else:
2924                adaptive_mutation_probability = self.mutation_probability[1]
2925
2926            probs = numpy.random.random(size=offspring.shape[1])
2927            for gene_idx in range(offspring.shape[1]):
2928                if probs[gene_idx] <= adaptive_mutation_probability:
2929                    if self.gene_space_nested:
2930                        # Returning the current gene space from the 'gene_space' attribute.
2931                        if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [numpy.ndarray, list]:
2932                            curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
2933                        else:
2934                            curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
2935
2936                        # If the gene space has only a single value, use it as the new gene value.
2937                        if type(curr_gene_space) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
2938                            value_from_space = curr_gene_space
2939                        # If the gene space is None, apply mutation by adding a random value between the range defined by the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
2940                        elif curr_gene_space is None:
2941                            rand_val = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2942                                                            high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2943                                                            size=1)
2944                            if self.mutation_by_replacement:
2945                                value_from_space = rand_val
2946                            else:
2947                                value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + rand_val
2948                        elif type(curr_gene_space) is dict:
2949                            # Selecting a value randomly from the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2950                            if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
2951                                value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=curr_gene_space['low'],
2952                                                                                    stop=curr_gene_space['high'],
2953                                                                                    step=curr_gene_space['step']),
2954                                                                       size=1)
2955                            else:
2956                                value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=curr_gene_space['low'],
2957                                                                        high=curr_gene_space['high'],
2958                                                                        size=1)
2959                        else:
2960                            # Selecting a value randomly from the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2961                            # If the gene space has only 1 value, then select it. The old and new values of the gene are identical.
2962                            if len(curr_gene_space) == 1:
2963                                value_from_space = curr_gene_space[0]
2964                            # If the gene space has more than 1 value, then select a new one that is different from the current value.
2965                            else:
2966                                values_to_select_from = list(
2967                                    set(curr_gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2968                                if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2969                                    value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2970                                else:
2971                                    value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2972                    else:
2973                        # Selecting a value randomly from the global gene space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
2974                        if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
2975                            if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
2976                                value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
2977                                                                                    stop=self.gene_space['high'],
2978                                                                                    step=self.gene_space['step']),
2979                                                                       size=1)
2980                            else:
2981                                value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
2982                                                                        high=self.gene_space['high'],
2983                                                                        size=1)
2984                        else:
2985                            values_to_select_from = list(
2986                                set(self.gene_space) - set([offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]]))
2987                            if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
2988                                value_from_space = offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx]
2989                            else:
2990                                value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
2991
2992                    if value_from_space is None:
2993                        value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
2994                                                                high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
2995                                                                size=1)
2996
2997                    # Assinging the selected value from the space to the gene.
2998                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
2999                        if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
3000                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(self.gene_type[0](value_from_space),
3001                                                                             self.gene_type[1])
3002                        else:
3003                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[0](value_from_space)
3004                    else:
3005                        if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
3006                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.round(
3007                                self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space),
3008                                self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
3009                        else:
3010                            offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space)
3011
3012                    if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
3013                        offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(
3014                            solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
3015                            gene_type=self.gene_type,
3016                            num_trials=10)
3017        return offspring
3018
3019    def adaptive_mutation_probs_randomly(self, offspring):
3020
3021        """
3022        Applies the adaptive mutation based on the 'mutation_probability' parameter.
3023        Based on whether the solution fitness is above or below a threshold, the mutation is applied diffrently by mutating high or low number of genes.
3024        The random values are selected based on the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
3025        It accepts a single parameter:
3026            -offspring: The offspring to mutate.
3027        It returns an array of the mutated offspring.
3028        """
3029
3030        average_fitness, offspring_fitness = self.adaptive_mutation_population_fitness(offspring)
3031
3032        # Adaptive random mutation changes one or more genes in each offspring randomly.
3033        # The probability of mutating a gene depends on the solution's fitness value.
3034        for offspring_idx in range(offspring.shape[0]):
3035            if offspring_fitness[offspring_idx] < average_fitness:
3036                adaptive_mutation_probability = self.mutation_probability[0]
3037            else:
3038                adaptive_mutation_probability = self.mutation_probability[1]
3039
3040            probs = numpy.random.random(size=offspring.shape[1])
3041            for gene_idx in range(offspring.shape[1]):
3042                if probs[gene_idx] <= adaptive_mutation_probability:
3043                    # Generating a random value.
3044                    random_value = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3045                                                        high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3046                                                        size=1)
3047                    # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is True, then the random value replaces the current gene value.
3048                    if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3049                        if self.gene_type_single == True:
3050                            random_value = self.gene_type[0](random_value)
3051                        else:
3052                            random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](random_value)
3053                            if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
3054                                random_value = random_value[0]
3055                    # If the mutation_by_replacement attribute is False, then the random value is added to the gene value.
3056                    else:
3057                        if self.gene_type_single == True:
3058                            random_value = self.gene_type[0](offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
3059                        else:
3060                            random_value = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](
3061                                offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] + random_value)
3062                            if type(random_value) is numpy.ndarray:
3063                                random_value = random_value[0]
3064
3065                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
3066                        if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
3067                            random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[1])
3068                    else:
3069                        if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
3070                            random_value = numpy.round(random_value, self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
3071
3072                    offspring[offspring_idx, gene_idx] = random_value
3073
3074                    if self.allow_duplicate_genes == False:
3075                        offspring[offspring_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(
3076                            solution=offspring[offspring_idx],
3077                            min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3078                            max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3079                            mutation_by_replacement=self.mutation_by_replacement,
3080                            gene_type=self.gene_type,
3081                            num_trials=10)
3082        return offspring
3083
3084    def solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(self, solution, min_val, max_val, mutation_by_replacement, gene_type,
3085                                       num_trials=10):
3086
3087        """
3088        Solves the duplicates in a solution by randomly selecting new values for the duplicating genes.
3089
3090        solution: A solution with duplicate values.
3091        min_val: Minimum value of the range to sample a number randomly.
3092        max_val: Maximum value of the range to sample a number randomly.
3093        mutation_by_replacement: Identical to the self.mutation_by_replacement attribute.
3094        gene_type: Exactly the same as the self.gene_type attribute.
3095        num_trials: Maximum number of trials to change the gene value to solve the duplicates.
3096
3097        Returns:
3098            new_solution: Solution after trying to solve its duplicates. If no duplicates solved, then it is identical to the passed solution parameter.
3099            not_unique_indices: Indices of the genes with duplicate values.
3100            num_unsolved_duplicates: Number of unsolved duplicates.
3101        """
3102
3103        new_solution = solution.copy()
3104
3105        _, unique_gene_indices = numpy.unique(solution, return_index=True)
3106        not_unique_indices = set(range(len(solution))) - set(unique_gene_indices)
3107
3108        num_unsolved_duplicates = 0
3109        if len(not_unique_indices) > 0:
3110            for duplicate_index in not_unique_indices:
3111                for trial_index in range(num_trials):
3112                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
3113                        if gene_type[0] in GA.supported_int_types:
3114                            temp_val = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=new_solution,
3115                                                                       gene_index=duplicate_index,
3116                                                                       min_val=min_val,
3117                                                                       max_val=max_val,
3118                                                                       mutation_by_replacement=mutation_by_replacement,
3119                                                                       gene_type=gene_type)
3120                        else:
3121                            temp_val = numpy.random.uniform(low=min_val,
3122                                                            high=max_val,
3123                                                            size=1)
3124                            if mutation_by_replacement:
3125                                pass
3126                            else:
3127                                temp_val = new_solution[duplicate_index] + temp_val
3128                    else:
3129                        if gene_type[duplicate_index] in GA.supported_int_types:
3130                            temp_val = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=new_solution,
3131                                                                       gene_index=duplicate_index,
3132                                                                       min_val=min_val,
3133                                                                       max_val=max_val,
3134                                                                       mutation_by_replacement=mutation_by_replacement,
3135                                                                       gene_type=gene_type)
3136                        else:
3137                            temp_val = numpy.random.uniform(low=min_val,
3138                                                            high=max_val,
3139                                                            size=1)
3140                            if mutation_by_replacement:
3141                                pass
3142                            else:
3143                                temp_val = new_solution[duplicate_index] + temp_val
3144
3145                    if self.gene_type_single == True:
3146                        if not gene_type[1] is None:
3147                            temp_val = numpy.round(gene_type[0](temp_val),
3148                                                   gene_type[1])
3149                        else:
3150                            temp_val = gene_type[0](temp_val)
3151                    else:
3152                        if not gene_type[duplicate_index][1] is None:
3153                            temp_val = numpy.round(gene_type[duplicate_index][0](temp_val),
3154                                                   gene_type[duplicate_index][1])
3155                        else:
3156                            temp_val = gene_type[duplicate_index][0](temp_val)
3157
3158                    if temp_val in new_solution and trial_index == (num_trials - 1):
3159                        num_unsolved_duplicates = num_unsolved_duplicates + 1
3160                        if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3161                            "Failed to find a unique value for gene with index {gene_idx} whose value is {gene_value}. Consider adding more values in the gene space or use a wider range for initial population or random mutation.".format(
3162                                gene_idx=duplicate_index, gene_value=solution[duplicate_index]))
3163                    elif temp_val in new_solution:
3164                        continue
3165                    else:
3166                        new_solution[duplicate_index] = temp_val
3167                        break
3168
3169                # Update the list of duplicate indices after each iteration.
3170                _, unique_gene_indices = numpy.unique(new_solution, return_index=True)
3171                not_unique_indices = set(range(len(solution))) - set(unique_gene_indices)
3172                # print("not_unique_indices INSIDE", not_unique_indices)
3173
3174        return new_solution, not_unique_indices, num_unsolved_duplicates
3175
3176    def solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(self, solution, gene_type, num_trials=10, build_initial_pop=False):
3177
3178        """
3179        Solves the duplicates in a solution by selecting values for the duplicating genes from the gene space.
3180
3181        solution: A solution with duplicate values.
3182        gene_type: Exactly the same as the self.gene_type attribute.
3183        num_trials: Maximum number of trials to change the gene value to solve the duplicates.
3184
3185        Returns:
3186            new_solution: Solution after trying to solve its duplicates. If no duplicates solved, then it is identical to the passed solution parameter.
3187            not_unique_indices: Indices of the genes with duplicate values.
3188            num_unsolved_duplicates: Number of unsolved duplicates.
3189        """
3190
3191        new_solution = solution.copy()
3192
3193        _, unique_gene_indices = numpy.unique(solution, return_index=True)
3194        not_unique_indices = set(range(len(solution))) - set(unique_gene_indices)
3195        # print("not_unique_indices OUTSIDE", not_unique_indices)
3196
3197        # First try to solve the duplicates.
3198        # For a solution like [3 2 0 0], the indices of the 2 duplicating genes are 2 and 3.
3199        # The next call to the find_unique_value() method tries to change the value of the gene with index 3 to solve the duplicate.
3200        if len(not_unique_indices) > 0:
3201            new_solution, not_unique_indices, num_unsolved_duplicates = self.unique_genes_by_space(
3202                new_solution=new_solution,
3203                gene_type=gene_type,
3204                not_unique_indices=not_unique_indices,
3205                num_trials=10,
3206                build_initial_pop=build_initial_pop)
3207        else:
3208            return new_solution, not_unique_indices, len(not_unique_indices)
3209
3210        # Do another try if there exist duplicate genes.
3211        # If there are no possible values for the gene 3 with index 3 to solve the duplicate, try to change the value of the other gene with index 2.
3212        if len(not_unique_indices) > 0:
3213            not_unique_indices = set(numpy.where(new_solution == new_solution[list(not_unique_indices)[0]])[0]) - set(
3214                [list(not_unique_indices)[0]])
3215            new_solution, not_unique_indices, num_unsolved_duplicates = self.unique_genes_by_space(
3216                new_solution=new_solution,
3217                gene_type=gene_type,
3218                not_unique_indices=not_unique_indices,
3219                num_trials=10,
3220                build_initial_pop=build_initial_pop)
3221        else:
3222            # If there exist duplicate genes, then changing either of the 2 duplicating genes (with indices 2 and 3) will not solve the problem.
3223            # This problem can be solved by randomly changing one of the non-duplicating genes that may make a room for a unique value in one the 2 duplicating genes.
3224            # For example, if gene_space=[[3, 0, 1], [4, 1, 2], [0, 2], [3, 2, 0]] and the solution is [3 2 0 0], then the values of the last 2 genes duplicate.
3225            # There are no possible changes in the last 2 genes to solve the problem. But it could be solved by changing the second gene from 2 to 4.
3226            # As a result, any of the last 2 genes can take the value 2 and solve the duplicates.
3227            return new_solution, not_unique_indices, len(not_unique_indices)
3228
3229        return new_solution, not_unique_indices, num_unsolved_duplicates
3230
3231    def solve_duplicate_genes_by_space_OLD(self, solution, gene_type, num_trials=10):
3232        # /////////////////////////
3233        # Just for testing purposes.
3234        # /////////////////////////
3235
3236        new_solution = solution.copy()
3237
3238        _, unique_gene_indices = numpy.unique(solution, return_index=True)
3239        not_unique_indices = set(range(len(solution))) - set(unique_gene_indices)
3240        # print("not_unique_indices OUTSIDE", not_unique_indices)
3241
3242        num_unsolved_duplicates = 0
3243        if len(not_unique_indices) > 0:
3244            for duplicate_index in not_unique_indices:
3245                for trial_index in range(num_trials):
3246                    temp_val = self.unique_gene_by_space(solution=solution,
3247                                                         gene_idx=duplicate_index,
3248                                                         gene_type=gene_type)
3249
3250                    if temp_val in new_solution and trial_index == (num_trials - 1):
3251                        # print("temp_val, duplicate_index", temp_val, duplicate_index, new_solution)
3252                        num_unsolved_duplicates = num_unsolved_duplicates + 1
3253                        if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3254                            "Failed to find a unique value for gene with index {gene_idx}".format(
3255                                gene_idx=duplicate_index))
3256                    elif temp_val in new_solution:
3257                        continue
3258                    else:
3259                        new_solution[duplicate_index] = temp_val
3260                        # print("SOLVED", duplicate_index)
3261                        break
3262
3263                # Update the list of duplicate indices after each iteration.
3264                _, unique_gene_indices = numpy.unique(new_solution, return_index=True)
3265                not_unique_indices = set(range(len(solution))) - set(unique_gene_indices)
3266                # print("not_unique_indices INSIDE", not_unique_indices)
3267
3268        return new_solution, not_unique_indices, num_unsolved_duplicates
3269
3270    def unique_int_gene_from_range(self, solution, gene_index, min_val, max_val, mutation_by_replacement, gene_type,
3271                                   step=None):
3272
3273        """
3274        Finds a unique integer value for the gene.
3275
3276        solution: A solution with duplicate values.
3277        gene_index: Index of the gene to find a unique value.
3278        min_val: Minimum value of the range to sample a number randomly.
3279        max_val: Maximum value of the range to sample a number randomly.
3280        mutation_by_replacement: Identical to the self.mutation_by_replacement attribute.
3281        gene_type: Exactly the same as the self.gene_type attribute.
3282
3283        Returns:
3284            selected_value: The new value of the gene. It may be identical to the original gene value in case there are no possible unique values for the gene.
3285        """
3286
3287        if self.gene_type_single == True:
3288            if step is None:
3289                all_gene_values = numpy.arange(min_val, max_val, dtype=gene_type[0])
3290            else:
3291                # For non-integer steps, the numpy.arange() function returns zeros id the dtype parameter is set to an integer data type. So, this returns zeros if step is non-integer and dtype is set to an int data type: numpy.arange(min_val, max_val, step, dtype=gene_type[0])
3292                # To solve this issue, the data type casting will not be handled inside numpy.arange(). The range is generated by numpy.arange() and then the data type is converted using the numpy.asarray() function.
3293                all_gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.arange(min_val, max_val, step), dtype=gene_type[0])
3294        else:
3295            if step is None:
3296                all_gene_values = numpy.arange(min_val, max_val, dtype=gene_type[gene_index][0])
3297            else:
3298                all_gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.arange(min_val, max_val, step), dtype=gene_type[gene_index][0])
3299
3300        if mutation_by_replacement:
3301            pass
3302        else:
3303            all_gene_values = all_gene_values + solution[gene_index]
3304
3305        if self.gene_type_single == True:
3306            if not gene_type[1] is None:
3307                all_gene_values = numpy.round(gene_type[0](all_gene_values),
3308                                              gene_type[1])
3309            else:
3310                if type(all_gene_values) is numpy.ndarray:
3311                    all_gene_values = numpy.asarray(all_gene_values, dtype=gene_type[0])
3312                else:
3313                    all_gene_values = gene_type[0](all_gene_values)
3314        else:
3315            if not gene_type[gene_index][1] is None:
3316                all_gene_values = numpy.round(gene_type[gene_index][0](all_gene_values),
3317                                              gene_type[gene_index][1])
3318            else:
3319                all_gene_values = gene_type[gene_index][0](all_gene_values)
3320
3321        values_to_select_from = list(set(all_gene_values) - set(solution))
3322
3323        if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
3324            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3325                "You set 'allow_duplicate_genes=False' but there is no enough values to prevent duplicates.")
3326            selected_value = solution[gene_index]
3327        else:
3328            selected_value = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
3329
3330        # if self.gene_type_single == True:
3331        #    selected_value = gene_type[0](selected_value)
3332        # else:
3333        #    selected_value = gene_type[gene_index][0](selected_value)
3334
3335        return selected_value
3336
3337    def unique_genes_by_space(self, new_solution, gene_type, not_unique_indices, num_trials=10,
3338                              build_initial_pop=False):
3339
3340        """
3341        Loops through all the duplicating genes to find unique values that from their gene spaces to solve the duplicates.
3342        For each duplicating gene, a call to the unique_gene_by_space() is made.
3343
3344        new_solution: A solution with duplicate values.
3345        gene_type: Exactly the same as the self.gene_type attribute.
3346        not_unique_indices: Indices with duplicating values.
3347        num_trials: Maximum number of trials to change the gene value to solve the duplicates.
3348
3349        Returns:
3350            new_solution: Solution after trying to solve all of its duplicates. If no duplicates solved, then it is identical to the passed solution parameter.
3351            not_unique_indices: Indices of the genes with duplicate values.
3352            num_unsolved_duplicates: Number of unsolved duplicates.
3353        """
3354
3355        num_unsolved_duplicates = 0
3356        for duplicate_index in not_unique_indices:
3357            for trial_index in range(num_trials):
3358                temp_val = self.unique_gene_by_space(solution=new_solution,
3359                                                     gene_idx=duplicate_index,
3360                                                     gene_type=gene_type,
