3361                                                     build_initial_pop=build_initial_pop)
3362
3363                if temp_val in new_solution and trial_index == (num_trials - 1):
3364                    # print("temp_val, duplicate_index", temp_val, duplicate_index, new_solution)
3365                    num_unsolved_duplicates = num_unsolved_duplicates + 1
3366                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3367                        "Failed to find a unique value for gene with index {gene_idx} whose value is {gene_value}. Consider adding more values in the gene space or use a wider range for initial population or random mutation.".format(
3368                            gene_idx=duplicate_index, gene_value=new_solution[duplicate_index]))
3369                elif temp_val in new_solution:
3370                    continue
3371                else:
3372                    new_solution[duplicate_index] = temp_val
3373                    # print("SOLVED", duplicate_index)
3374                    break
3375
3376        # Update the list of duplicate indices after each iteration.
3377        _, unique_gene_indices = numpy.unique(new_solution, return_index=True)
3378        not_unique_indices = set(range(len(new_solution))) - set(unique_gene_indices)
3379        # print("not_unique_indices INSIDE", not_unique_indices)
3380
3381        return new_solution, not_unique_indices, num_unsolved_duplicates
3382
3383    def unique_gene_by_space(self, solution, gene_idx, gene_type, build_initial_pop=False):
3384
3385        """
3386        Returns a unique gene value for a single gene based on its value space to solve the duplicates.
3387
3388        solution: A solution with duplicate values.
3389        gene_idx: The index of the gene that duplicates its value with another gene.
3390        gene_type: Exactly the same as the self.gene_type attribute.
3391
3392        Returns:
3393            A unique value, if exists, for the gene.
3394        """
3395
3396        if self.gene_space_nested:
3397            # Returning the current gene space from the 'gene_space' attribute.
3398            if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [numpy.ndarray, list]:
3399                curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
3400            else:
3401                curr_gene_space = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
3402
3403            # If the gene space has only a single value, use it as the new gene value.
3404            if type(curr_gene_space) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
3405                value_from_space = curr_gene_space
3406                # If the gene space is None, apply mutation by adding a random value between the range defined by the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val'.
3407            elif curr_gene_space is None:
3408                if self.gene_type_single == True:
3409                    if gene_type[0] in GA.supported_int_types:
3410                        if build_initial_pop == True:
3411                            value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3412                                                                               gene_index=gene_idx,
3413                                                                               min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3414                                                                               max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3415                                                                               mutation_by_replacement=True,
3416                                                                               gene_type=gene_type)
3417                        else:
3418                            value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3419                                                                               gene_index=gene_idx,
3420                                                                               min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3421                                                                               max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3422                                                                               mutation_by_replacement=True,
3423                                                                               # self.mutation_by_replacement,
3424                                                                               gene_type=gene_type)
3425                    else:
3426                        value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3427                                                                high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3428                                                                size=1)
3429                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3430                            pass
3431                        else:
3432                            value_from_space = solution[gene_idx] + value_from_space
3433                else:
3434                    if gene_type[gene_idx] in GA.supported_int_types:
3435                        if build_initial_pop == True:
3436                            value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3437                                                                               gene_index=gene_idx,
3438                                                                               min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3439                                                                               max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3440                                                                               mutation_by_replacement=True,
3441                                                                               gene_type=gene_type)
3442                        else:
3443                            value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3444                                                                               gene_index=gene_idx,
3445                                                                               min_val=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3446                                                                               max_val=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3447                                                                               mutation_by_replacement=True,
3448                                                                               # self.mutation_by_replacement,
3449                                                                               gene_type=gene_type)
3450                    else:
3451                        value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3452                                                                high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3453                                                                size=1)
3454                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3455                            pass
3456                        else:
3457                            value_from_space = solution[gene_idx] + value_from_space
3458
3459            elif type(curr_gene_space) is dict:
3460                if self.gene_type_single == True:
3461                    if gene_type[0] in GA.supported_int_types:
3462                        if build_initial_pop == True:
3463                            if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
3464                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3465                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3466                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3467                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3468                                                                                   step=curr_gene_space['step'],
3469                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3470                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3471                            else:
3472                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3473                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3474                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3475                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3476                                                                                   step=None,
3477                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3478                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3479                        else:
3480                            if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
3481                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3482                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3483                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3484                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3485                                                                                   step=curr_gene_space['step'],
3486                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3487                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3488                            else:
3489                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3490                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3491                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3492                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3493                                                                                   step=None,
3494                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3495                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3496                    else:
3497                        if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
3498                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=curr_gene_space['low'],
3499                                                                                stop=curr_gene_space['high'],
3500                                                                                step=curr_gene_space['step']),
3501                                                                   size=1)
3502                        else:
3503                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=curr_gene_space['low'],
3504                                                                    high=curr_gene_space['high'],
3505                                                                    size=1)
3506                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3507                            pass
3508                        else:
3509                            value_from_space = solution[gene_idx] + value_from_space
3510                else:
3511                    if gene_type[gene_idx] in GA.supported_int_types:
3512                        if build_initial_pop == True:
3513                            if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
3514                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3515                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3516                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3517                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3518                                                                                   step=curr_gene_space['step'],
3519                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3520                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3521                            else:
3522                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3523                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3524                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3525                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3526                                                                                   step=None,
3527                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3528                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3529                        else:
3530                            if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
3531                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3532                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3533                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3534                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3535                                                                                   step=curr_gene_space['step'],
3536                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3537                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3538                            else:
3539                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3540                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3541                                                                                   min_val=curr_gene_space['low'],
3542                                                                                   max_val=curr_gene_space['high'],
3543                                                                                   step=None,
3544                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3545                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3546                    else:
3547                        if 'step' in curr_gene_space.keys():
3548                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=curr_gene_space['low'],
3549                                                                                stop=curr_gene_space['high'],
3550                                                                                step=curr_gene_space['step']),
3551                                                                   size=1)
3552                        else:
3553                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=curr_gene_space['low'],
3554                                                                    high=curr_gene_space['high'],
3555                                                                    size=1)
3556                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3557                            pass
3558                        else:
3559                            value_from_space = solution[gene_idx] + value_from_space
3560
3561            else:
3562                # Selecting a value randomly based on the current gene's space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
3563                # If the gene space has only 1 value, then select it. The old and new values of the gene are identical.
3564                if len(curr_gene_space) == 1:
3565                    value_from_space = curr_gene_space[0]
3566                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3567                        "You set 'allow_duplicate_genes=False' but the space of the gene with index {gene_idx} has only a single value. Thus, duplicates are possible.".format(
3568                            gene_idx=gene_idx))
3569                # If the gene space has more than 1 value, then select a new one that is different from the current value.
3570                else:
3571                    values_to_select_from = list(set(curr_gene_space) - set(solution))
3572                    if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
3573                        if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3574                            "You set 'allow_duplicate_genes=False' but the gene space does not have enough values to prevent duplicates.")
3575                        value_from_space = solution[gene_idx]
3576                    else:
3577                        value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
3578        else:
3579            # Selecting a value randomly from the global gene space in the 'gene_space' attribute.
3580            if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
3581                if self.gene_type_single == True:
3582                    if gene_type[0] in GA.supported_int_types:
3583                        if build_initial_pop == True:
3584                            if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
3585                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3586                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3587                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3588                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3589                                                                                   step=self.gene_space['step'],
3590                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3591                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3592                            else:
3593                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3594                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3595                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3596                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3597                                                                                   step=None,
3598                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3599                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3600                        else:
3601                            if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
3602                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3603                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3604                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3605                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3606                                                                                   step=self.gene_space['step'],
3607                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3608                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3609                            else:
3610                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3611                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3612                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3613                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3614                                                                                   step=None,
3615                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3616                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3617                    else:
3618                        # When the gene_space is assigned a dict object, then it specifies the lower and upper limits of all genes in the space.
3619                        if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
3620                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
3621                                                                                stop=self.gene_space['high'],
3622                                                                                step=self.gene_space['step']),
3623                                                                   size=1)
3624                        else:
3625                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
3626                                                                    high=self.gene_space['high'],
3627                                                                    size=1)
3628                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3629                            pass
3630                        else:
3631                            value_from_space = solution[gene_idx] + value_from_space
3632                else:
3633                    if gene_type[gene_idx] in GA.supported_int_types:
3634                        if build_initial_pop == True:
3635                            if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
3636                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3637                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3638                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3639                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3640                                                                                   step=self.gene_space['step'],
3641                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3642                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3643                            else:
3644                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3645                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3646                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3647                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3648                                                                                   step=None,
3649                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3650                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3651                        else:
3652                            if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
3653                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3654                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3655                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3656                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3657                                                                                   step=self.gene_space['step'],
3658                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3659                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3660                            else:
3661                                value_from_space = self.unique_int_gene_from_range(solution=solution,
3662                                                                                   gene_index=gene_idx,
3663                                                                                   min_val=self.gene_space['low'],
3664                                                                                   max_val=self.gene_space['high'],
3665                                                                                   step=None,
3666                                                                                   mutation_by_replacement=True,
3667                                                                                   gene_type=gene_type)
3668                    else:
3669                        # When the gene_space is assigned a dict object, then it specifies the lower and upper limits of all genes in the space.
3670                        if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
3671                            value_from_space = numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
3672                                                                                stop=self.gene_space['high'],
3673                                                                                step=self.gene_space['step']),
3674                                                                   size=1)
3675                        else:
3676                            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
3677                                                                    high=self.gene_space['high'],
3678                                                                    size=1)
3679                        if self.mutation_by_replacement:
3680                            pass
3681                        else:
3682                            value_from_space = solution[gene_idx] + value_from_space
3683
3684            else:
3685                # If the space type is not of type dict, then a value is randomly selected from the gene_space attribute.
3686                values_to_select_from = list(set(self.gene_space) - set(solution))
3687                if len(values_to_select_from) == 0:
3688                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
3689                        "You set 'allow_duplicate_genes=False' but the gene space does not have enough values to prevent duplicates.")
3690                    value_from_space = solution[gene_idx]
3691                else:
3692                    value_from_space = random.choice(values_to_select_from)
3693
3694        if value_from_space is None:
3695            value_from_space = numpy.random.uniform(low=self.random_mutation_min_val,
3696                                                    high=self.random_mutation_max_val,
3697                                                    size=1)
3698
3699        if self.gene_type_single == True:
3700            if not gene_type[1] is None:
3701                value_from_space = numpy.round(gene_type[0](value_from_space),
3702                                               gene_type[1])
3703            else:
3704                value_from_space = gene_type[0](value_from_space)
3705        else:
3706            if not gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
3707                value_from_space = numpy.round(gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space),
3708                                               gene_type[gene_idx][1])
3709            else:
3710                value_from_space = gene_type[gene_idx][0](value_from_space)
3711
3712        return value_from_space
3713
3714    def best_solution(self, pop_fitness=None):
3715
3716        """
3717        Returns information about the best solution found by the genetic algorithm.
3718        Accepts the following parameters:
3719            pop_fitness: An optional parameter holding the fitness values of the solutions in the current population. If None, then the cal_pop_fitness() method is called to calculate the fitness of the population.
3720        The following are returned:
3721            -best_solution: Best solution in the current population.
3722            -best_solution_fitness: Fitness value of the best solution.
3723            -best_match_idx: Index of the best solution in the current population.
3724        """
3725
3726        # Getting the best solution after finishing all generations.
3727        # At first, the fitness is calculated for each solution in the final generation.
3728        if pop_fitness is None:
3729            pop_fitness = self.cal_pop_fitness()
3730        # Then return the index of that solution corresponding to the best fitness.
3731        best_match_idx = numpy.where(pop_fitness == numpy.max(pop_fitness))[0][0]
3732
3733        best_solution = self.population[best_match_idx, :].copy()
3734        best_solution_fitness = pop_fitness[best_match_idx]
3735        # print(best_solution_fitness)
3736        return best_solution, best_solution_fitness, best_match_idx
3737
3738    def plot_result(self,
3739                    title="PyGAD - Generation vs. Fitness",
3740                    xlabel="Generation",
3741                    ylabel="Fitness",
3742                    linewidth=3,
3743                    font_size=14,
3744                    plot_type="plot",
3745                    color="#3870FF",
3746                    save_dir=None):
3747
3748        if not self.suppress_warnings:
3749            warnings.warn(
3750                "Please use the plot_fitness() method instead of plot_result(). The plot_result() method will be removed in the future.")
3751
3752        return self.plot_fitness(title=title,
3753                                 xlabel=xlabel,
3754                                 ylabel=ylabel,
3755                                 linewidth=linewidth,
3756                                 font_size=font_size,
3757                                 plot_type=plot_type,
3758                                 color=color,
3759                                 save_dir=save_dir)
3760
3761    def plot_fitness(self,
3762                     title="PyGAD - Generation vs. Fitness",
3763                     xlabel="Generation",
3764                     ylabel="Fitness",
3765                     linewidth=3,
3766                     font_size=14,
3767                     plot_type="plot",
3768                     color="#3870FF",
3769                     save_dir=None):
3770
3771        """
3772        Creates, shows, and returns a figure that summarizes how the fitness value evolved by generation. Can only be called after completing at least 1 generation. If no generation is completed, an exception is raised.
3773
3774        Accepts the following:
3775            title: Figure title.
3776            xlabel: Label on the X-axis.
3777            ylabel: Label on the Y-axis.
3778            linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3.
3779            font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14.
3780            plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar".
3781            color: Color of the plot which defaults to "#3870FF".
3782            save_dir: Directory to save the figure.
3783
3784        Returns the figure.
3785        """
3786
3787        if self.generations_completed < 1:
3788            raise RuntimeError(
3789                "The plot_fitness() (i.e. plot_result()) method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3790                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3791
3792        #        if self.run_completed == False:
3793        #            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn("Warning calling the plot_result() method: \nGA is not executed yet and there are no results to display. Please call the run() method before calling the plot_result() method.\n")
3794
3795        fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure()
3796        if plot_type == "plot":
3797            matplotlib.pyplot.plot(self.best_solutions_fitness, linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3798        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3799            matplotlib.pyplot.scatter(range(self.generations_completed + 1), self.best_solutions_fitness,
3800                                      linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3801        elif plot_type == "bar":
3802            matplotlib.pyplot.bar(range(self.generations_completed + 1), self.best_solutions_fitness,
3803                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3804        matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
3805        matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
3806        matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
3807
3808        if not save_dir is None:
3809            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
3810                                      bbox_inches='tight')
3811        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
3812
3813        return fig
3814
3815    def plot_new_solution_rate(self,
3816                               title="PyGAD - Generation vs. New Solution Rate",
3817                               xlabel="Generation",
3818                               ylabel="New Solution Rate",
3819                               linewidth=3,
3820                               font_size=14,
3821                               plot_type="plot",
3822                               color="#3870FF",
3823                               save_dir=None):
3824
3825        """
3826        Creates, shows, and returns a figure that summarizes the rate of exploring new solutions. This method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.
3827
3828        Accepts the following:
3829            title: Figure title.
3830            xlabel: Label on the X-axis.
3831            ylabel: Label on the Y-axis.
3832            linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3.
3833            font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14.
3834            plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar".
3835            color: Color of the plot which defaults to "#3870FF".
3836            save_dir: Directory to save the figure.
3837
3838        Returns the figure.
3839        """
3840
3841        if self.generations_completed < 1:
3842            raise RuntimeError(
3843                "The plot_new_solution_rate() method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3844                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3845
3846        if self.save_solutions == False:
3847            raise RuntimeError(
3848                "The plot_new_solution_rate() method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.")
3849
3850        unique_solutions = set()
3851        num_unique_solutions_per_generation = []
3852        for generation_idx in range(self.generations_completed):
3853
3854            len_before = len(unique_solutions)
3855
3856            start = generation_idx * self.sol_per_pop
3857            end = start + self.sol_per_pop
3858
3859            for sol in self.solutions[start:end]:
3860                unique_solutions.add(tuple(sol))
3861
3862            len_after = len(unique_solutions)
3863
3864            generation_num_unique_solutions = len_after - len_before
3865            num_unique_solutions_per_generation.append(generation_num_unique_solutions)
3866
3867        fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure()
3868        if plot_type == "plot":
3869            matplotlib.pyplot.plot(num_unique_solutions_per_generation, linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3870        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3871            matplotlib.pyplot.scatter(range(self.generations_completed), num_unique_solutions_per_generation,
3872                                      linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3873        elif plot_type == "bar":
3874            matplotlib.pyplot.bar(range(self.generations_completed), num_unique_solutions_per_generation,
3875                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3876        matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
3877        matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
3878        matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
3879
3880        if not save_dir is None:
3881            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
3882                                      bbox_inches='tight')
3883        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
3884
3885        return fig
3886
3887    def plot_genes(self,
3888                   title="PyGAD - Gene",
3889                   xlabel="Gene",
3890                   ylabel="Value",
3891                   linewidth=3,
3892                   font_size=14,
3893                   plot_type="plot",
3894                   graph_type="plot",
3895                   fill_color="#3870FF",
3896                   color="black",
3897                   solutions="all",
3898                   save_dir=None):
3899
3900        """
3901        Creates, shows, and returns a figure with number of subplots equal to the number of genes. Each subplot shows the gene value for each generation.
3902        This method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.
3903        It also works only after completing at least 1 generation. If no generation is completed, an exception is raised.
3904
3905        Accepts the following:
3906            title: Figure title.
3907            xlabel: Label on the X-axis.
3908            ylabel: Label on the Y-axis.
3909            linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3.
3910            font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14.
3911            plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar".
3912            graph_type: Type of the graph which can be either "plot" (default), "boxplot", or "histogram".
3913            fill_color: Fill color of the graph which defaults to "#3870FF". This has no effect if graph_type="plot".
3914            color: Color of the plot which defaults to "black".
3915            solutions: Defaults to "all" which means use all solutions. If "best" then only the best solutions are used.
3916            save_dir: Directory to save the figure.
3917
3918        Returns the figure.
3919        """
3920
3921        if self.generations_completed < 1:
3922            raise RuntimeError(
3923                "The plot_genes() method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3924                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3925
3926        if type(solutions) is str:
3927            if solutions == 'all':
3928                if self.save_solutions:
3929                    solutions_to_plot = numpy.array(self.solutions)
3930                else:
3931                    raise RuntimeError(
3932                        "The plot_genes() method with solutions='all' can only be called if 'save_solutions=True' in the pygad.GA class constructor.")
3933            elif solutions == 'best':
3934                if self.save_best_solutions:
3935                    solutions_to_plot = self.best_solutions
3936                else:
3937                    raise RuntimeError(
3938                        "The plot_genes() method with solutions='best' can only be called if 'save_best_solutions=True' in the pygad.GA class constructor.")
3939            else:
3940                raise RuntimeError(
3941                    "The solutions parameter can be either 'all' or 'best' but {solutions} found.".format(
3942                        solutions=solutions))
3943        else:
3944            raise RuntimeError("The solutions parameter must be a string but {solutions_type} found.".format(
3945                solutions_type=type(solutions)))
3946
3947        if graph_type == "plot":
3948            # num_rows will be always be >= 1
3949            # num_cols can only be 0 if num_genes=1
3950            num_rows = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / 5.0))
3951            num_cols = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / num_rows))
3952
3953            if num_cols == 0:
3954                figsize = (10, 8)
3955                # There is only a single gene
3956                fig, ax = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, figsize=figsize)
3957                if plot_type == "plot":
3958                    ax.plot(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3959                elif plot_type == "scatter":
3960                    ax.scatter(range(self.generations_completed + 1), solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth,
3961                               color=fill_color)
3962                elif plot_type == "bar":
3963                    ax.bar(range(self.generations_completed + 1), solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth,
3964                           color=fill_color)
3965                ax.set_xlabel(0, fontsize=font_size)
3966            else:
3967                fig, axs = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, num_cols)
3968
3969                if num_cols == 1 and num_rows == 1:
3970                    fig.set_figwidth(5 * num_cols)
3971                    fig.set_figheight(4)
3972                    axs.plot(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3973                    axs.set_xlabel("Gene " + str(0), fontsize=font_size)
3974                elif num_cols == 1 or num_rows == 1:
3975                    fig.set_figwidth(5 * num_cols)
3976                    fig.set_figheight(4)
3977                    for gene_idx in range(len(axs)):
3978                        if plot_type == "plot":
3979                            axs[gene_idx].plot(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3980                        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3981                            axs[gene_idx].scatter(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]), solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
3982                                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3983                        elif plot_type == "bar":
3984                            axs[gene_idx].bar(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]), solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
3985                                              linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3986                        axs[gene_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
3987                else:
3988                    gene_idx = 0
3989                    fig.set_figwidth(25)
3990                    fig.set_figheight(4 * num_rows)
3991                    for row_idx in range(num_rows):
3992                        for col_idx in range(num_cols):
3993                            if gene_idx >= self.num_genes:
3994                                # axs[row_idx, col_idx].remove()
3995                                break
3996                            if plot_type == "plot":
3997                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].plot(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
3998                                                           color=fill_color)
3999                            elif plot_type == "scatter":
4000                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].scatter(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]),
4001                                                              solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
4002                                                              color=fill_color)
4003                            elif plot_type == "bar":
4004                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].bar(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]),
4005                                                          solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
4006                                                          color=fill_color)
4007                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4008                            gene_idx += 1
4009
4010            fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=font_size, y=1.001)
4011            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4012
4013        elif graph_type == "boxplot":
4014            fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure(1, figsize=(0.7 * self.num_genes, 6))
4015
4016            # Create an axes instance
4017            ax = fig.add_subplot(111)
4018            boxeplots = ax.boxplot(solutions_to_plot,
4019                                   labels=range(self.num_genes),
4020                                   patch_artist=True)
4021            # adding horizontal grid lines
4022            ax.yaxis.grid(True)
4023
4024            for box in boxeplots['boxes']:
4025                # change outline color
4026                box.set(color='black', linewidth=linewidth)
4027                # change fill color https://color.adobe.com/create/color-wheel
4028                box.set_facecolor(fill_color)
4029
4030            for whisker in boxeplots['whiskers']:
4031                whisker.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4032            for median in boxeplots['medians']:
4033                median.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4034            for cap in boxeplots['caps']:
4035                cap.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4036
4037            matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
4038            matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
4039            matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
4040            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4041
4042        elif graph_type == "histogram":
4043            # num_rows will be always be >= 1
4044            # num_cols can only be 0 if num_genes=1
4045            num_rows = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / 5.0))
4046            num_cols = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / num_rows))
4047
4048            if num_cols == 0:
4049                figsize = (10, 8)
4050                # There is only a single gene
4051                fig, ax = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows,
4052                                                     figsize=figsize)
4053                ax.hist(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], color=fill_color)
4054                ax.set_xlabel(0, fontsize=font_size)
4055            else:
4056                fig, axs = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, num_cols)
4057
4058                if num_cols == 1 and num_rows == 1:
4059                    fig.set_figwidth(4 * num_cols)
4060                    fig.set_figheight(3)
4061                    axs.hist(solutions_to_plot[:, 0],
4062                             color=fill_color,
4063                             rwidth=0.95)
4064                    axs.set_xlabel("Gene " + str(0), fontsize=font_size)
4065                elif num_cols == 1 or num_rows == 1:
4066                    fig.set_figwidth(4 * num_cols)
4067                    fig.set_figheight(3)
4068                    for gene_idx in range(len(axs)):
4069                        axs[gene_idx].hist(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
4070                                           color=fill_color,
4071                                           rwidth=0.95)
4072                        axs[gene_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4073                else:
4074                    gene_idx = 0
4075                    fig.set_figwidth(20)
4076                    fig.set_figheight(3 * num_rows)
4077                    for row_idx in range(num_rows):
4078                        for col_idx in range(num_cols):
4079                            if gene_idx >= self.num_genes:
4080                                # axs[row_idx, col_idx].remove()
4081                                break
4082                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].hist(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
4083                                                       color=fill_color,
4084                                                       rwidth=0.95)
4085                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4086                            gene_idx += 1
4087
4088            fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=font_size, y=1.001)
4089            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4090
4091        if not save_dir is None:
4092            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
4093                                      bbox_inches='tight')
4094
4095        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
4096
4097        return fig
4098
4099
4100    def close_parallel(self):
4101        if self.parallel_processing is not None:
4102            # print('before close')
4103            self._pool.close()
4104            # print('after close')
4105            self._pool.join()
4106            # print('after join')
4107            self._pool.terminate()
4108            # print('after terminate')
4109
4110    def save(self, filename):
4111
4112        """
4113        Saves the genetic algorithm instance:
4114            -filename: Name of the file to save the instance. No extension is needed.
4115        """
4116
4117        with open(filename + ".pkl", 'wb') as file:
4118            pickle.dump(self, file)
4119
4120
4121def load(filename):
4122    """
4123    Reads a saved instance of the genetic algorithm:
4124        -filename: Name of the file to read the instance. No extension is needed.
4125    Returns the genetic algorithm instance.
4126    """
4127
4128    try:
4129        with open(filename + ".pkl", 'rb') as file:
4130            ga_in = pickle.load(file)
4131    except FileNotFoundError:
4132        raise FileNotFoundError(
4133            "Error reading the file {filename}. Please check your inputs.".format(filename=filename))
4134    except:
4135        raise BaseException(
4136            "Error loading the file. If the file already exists, please reload all the functions previously used (e.g. fitness function).")
4137    return ga_in
class GA: 
  61class GA:
  62    supported_int_types = [int, numpy.int8, numpy.int16, numpy.int32, numpy.int64, numpy.uint, numpy.uint8,
  63                           numpy.uint16, numpy.uint32, numpy.uint64]
  64    supported_float_types = [float, numpy.float16, numpy.float32, numpy.float64]
  65    supported_int_float_types = supported_int_types + supported_float_types
  66
  67    def __init__(self,
  68                 num_generations,
  69                 num_parents_mating,
  70                 fitness_func,
  71                 args=None,
  72                 initial_population=None,
  73                 sol_per_pop=None,
  74                 num_genes=None,
  75                 init_range_low=-4,
  76                 init_range_high=4,
  77                 gene_type=float,
  78                 parent_selection_type="sss",
  79                 keep_parents=-1,
  80                 keep_elitism=1,
  81                 K_tournament=3,
  82                 crossover_type="single_point",
  83                 crossover_probability=None,
  84                 mutation_type="random",
  85                 mutation_probability=None,
  86                 mutation_by_replacement=False,
  87                 mutation_percent_genes='default',
  88                 mutation_num_genes=None,
  89                 random_mutation_min_val=-1.0,
  90                 random_mutation_max_val=1.0,
  91                 gene_space=None,
  92                 allow_duplicate_genes=True,
  93                 on_start=None,
  94                 on_fitness=None,
  95                 on_parents=None,
  96                 on_crossover=None,
  97                 on_mutation=None,
  98                 callback_generation=None,
  99                 on_generation=None,
 100                 on_stop=None,
 101                 delay_after_gen=0.0,
 102                 save_best_solutions=False,
 103                 save_solutions=False,
 104                 suppress_warnings=False,
 105                 stop_criteria=None,
 106                 ftol_abs=0.0,
 107                 parallel_processing=None,
 108                 random_seed=None):
 109
 110        """
 111        The constructor of the GA class accepts all parameters required to create an instance of the GA class. It validates such parameters.
 112
 113        num_generations: Number of generations.
 114        num_parents_mating: Number of solutions to be selected as parents in the mating pool.
 115
 116        fitness_func: Accepts a function that must accept 2 parameters (a single solution and its index in the population) and return the fitness value of the solution. Available starting from PyGAD 1.0.17 until 1.0.20 with a single parameter representing the solution. Changed in PyGAD 2.0.0 and higher to include the second parameter representing the solution index.
 117
 118        initial_population: A user-defined initial population. It is useful when the user wants to start the generations with a custom initial population. It defaults to None which means no initial population is specified by the user. In this case, PyGAD creates an initial population using the 'sol_per_pop' and 'num_genes' parameters. An exception is raised if the 'initial_population' is None while any of the 2 parameters ('sol_per_pop' or 'num_genes') is also None.
 119        sol_per_pop: Number of solutions in the population.
 120        num_genes: Number of parameters in the function.
 121
 122        init_range_low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher.
 123        init_range_high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.
 124        # It is OK to set the value of any of the 2 parameters ('init_range_low' and 'init_range_high') to be equal, higher or lower than the other parameter (i.e. init_range_low is not needed to be lower than init_range_high).
 125
 126        gene_type: The type of the gene. It is assigned to any of these types (int, float, numpy.int, numpy.int8, numpy.int16, numpy.int32, numpy.int64, numpy.uint, numpy.uint8, numpy.uint16, numpy.uint32, numpy.uint64, numpy.float, numpy.float16, numpy.float32, numpy.float64) and forces all the genes to be of that type.
 127
 128        parent_selection_type: Type of parent selection.
 129        keep_parents: If 0, this means no parent in the current population will be used in the next population. If -1, this means all parents in the current population will be used in the next population. If set to a value > 0, then the specified value refers to the number of parents in the current population to be used in the next population. Some parent selection operators such as rank selection, favor population diversity and therefore keeping the parents in the next generation can be beneficial. However, some other parent selection operators, such as roulette wheel selection (RWS), have higher selection pressure and keeping more than one parent in the next generation can seriously harm population diversity. This parameter have an effect only when the keep_elitism parameter is 0. Thanks to Prof. Fernando Jimnez Barrionuevo (http://webs.um.es/fernan) for editing this sentence.
 130        K_tournament: When the value of 'parent_selection_type' is 'tournament', the 'K_tournament' parameter specifies the number of solutions from which a parent is selected randomly.
 131
 132        keep_elitism: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It can take the value 0 or a positive integer that satisfies (0 <= keep_elitism <= sol_per_pop). It defaults to 1 which means only the best solution in the current generation is kept in the next generation. If assigned 0, this means it has no effect. If assigned a positive integer K, then the best K solutions are kept in the next generation. It cannot be assigned a value greater than the value assigned to the sol_per_pop parameter. If this parameter has a value different than 0, then the keep_parents parameter will have no effect.
 133
 134        crossover_type: Type of the crossover opreator. If  crossover_type=None, then the crossover step is bypassed which means no crossover is applied and thus no offspring will be created in the next generations. The next generation will use the solutions in the current population.
 135        crossover_probability: The probability of selecting a solution for the crossover operation. If the solution probability is <= crossover_probability, the solution is selected. The value must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
 136
 137        mutation_type: Type of the mutation opreator. If mutation_type=None, then the mutation step is bypassed which means no mutation is applied and thus no changes are applied to the offspring created using the crossover operation. The offspring will be used unchanged in the next generation.
 138        mutation_probability: The probability of selecting a gene for the mutation operation. If the gene probability is <= mutation_probability, the gene is selected. It accepts either a single value for fixed mutation or a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of 2 values for adaptive mutation. The values must be between 0 and 1 inclusive. If specified, then no need for the 2 parameters mutation_percent_genes and mutation_num_genes.
 139
 140        mutation_by_replacement: An optional bool parameter. It works only when the selected type of mutation is random (mutation_type="random"). In this case, setting mutation_by_replacement=True means replace the gene by the randomly generated value. If False, then it has no effect and random mutation works by adding the random value to the gene.
 141
 142        mutation_percent_genes: Percentage of genes to mutate which defaults to the string 'default' which means 10%. This parameter has no action if any of the 2 parameters mutation_probability or mutation_num_genes exist.
 143        mutation_num_genes: Number of genes to mutate which defaults to None. If the parameter mutation_num_genes exists, then no need for the parameter mutation_percent_genes. This parameter has no action if the mutation_probability parameter exists.
 144        random_mutation_min_val: The minimum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to -1.0.
 145        random_mutation_max_val: The maximum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to 1.0.
 146
 147        gene_space: It accepts a list of all possible values of the gene. This list is used in the mutation step. Should be used only if the gene space is a set of discrete values. No need for the 2 parameters (random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val) if the parameter gene_space exists. Added in PyGAD 2.5.0. In PyGAD 2.11.0, the gene_space can be assigned a dict.
 148
 149        on_start: Accepts a function to be called only once before the genetic algorithm starts its evolution. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 150        on_fitness: Accepts a function to be called after calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the population. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of all solutions' fitness values. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 151        on_parents: Accepts a function to be called after selecting the parents that mates. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the selected parents. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 152        on_crossover: Accepts a function to be called each time the crossover operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring generated using crossover. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 153        on_mutation: Accepts a function to be called each time the mutation operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring after applying the mutation. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 154        callback_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Starting from PyGAD 2.6.0, the callback_generation parameter is deprecated and should be replaced by the on_generation parameter.
 155        on_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 156        on_stop: Accepts a function to be called only once exactly before the genetic algorithm stops or when it completes all the generations. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of fitness values of the last population's solutions. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 157
 158        delay_after_gen: Added in PyGAD 2.4.0. It accepts a non-negative number specifying the number of seconds to wait after a generation completes and before going to the next generation. It defaults to 0.0 which means no delay after the generation.
 159
 160        save_best_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.9.0 and its type is bool. If True, then the best solution in each generation is saved into the 'best_solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations or the number of genes is large.
 161        save_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0 and its type is bool. If True, then all solutions in each generation are saved into the 'solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations, number of genes, or number of solutions in population is large.
 162
 163        suppress_warnings: Added in PyGAD 2.10.0 and its type is bool. If True, then no warning messages will be displayed. It defaults to False.
 164
 165        allow_duplicate_genes: Added in PyGAD 2.13.0. If True, then a solution/chromosome may have duplicate gene values. If False, then each gene will have a unique value in its solution.
 166
 167        stop_criteria: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0. It is assigned to some criteria to stop the evolution if at least one criterion holds.
 168
 169        parallel_processing: Added in PyGAD 2.17.0. Defaults to `None` which means no parallel processing is used. If a positive integer is assigned, it specifies the number of threads to be used. If a list or a tuple of exactly 2 elements is assigned, then: 1) The first element can be either "process" or "thread" to specify whether processes or threads are used, respectively. 2) The second element can be: 1) A positive integer to select the maximum number of processes or threads to be used. 2) 0 to indicate that parallel processing is not used. This is identical to setting 'parallel_processing=None'. 3) None to use the default value as calculated by the concurrent.futures module.
 170
 171        random_seed: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It defines the random seed to be used by the random function generators (we use random functions in the NumPy and random modules). This helps to reproduce the same results by setting the same random seed.
 172        """
 173
 174        self.random_seed = random_seed
 175        if random_seed is None:
 176            pass
 177        else:
 178            numpy.random.seed(self.random_seed)
 179            random.seed(self.random_seed)
 180
 181        # If suppress_warnings is bool and its valud is False, then print warning messages.
 182        if type(suppress_warnings) is bool:
 183            self.suppress_warnings = suppress_warnings
 184        else:
 185            self.valid_parameters = False
 186            raise TypeError(
 187                "The expected type of the 'suppress_warnings' parameter is bool but {suppress_warnings_type} found.".format(
 188                    suppress_warnings_type=type(suppress_warnings)))
 189
 190        # Validating mutation_by_replacement
 191        if not (type(mutation_by_replacement) is bool):
 192            self.valid_parameters = False
 193            raise TypeError(
 194                "The expected type of the 'mutation_by_replacement' parameter is bool but ({mutation_by_replacement_type}) found.".format(
 195                    mutation_by_replacement_type=type(mutation_by_replacement)))
 196
 197        self.mutation_by_replacement = mutation_by_replacement
 198
 199        # Validate gene_space
 200        self.gene_space_nested = False
 201        if type(gene_space) is type(None):
 202            pass
 203        elif type(gene_space) in [list, tuple, range, numpy.ndarray]:
 204            if len(gene_space) == 0:
 205                self.valid_parameters = False
 206                raise ValueError("'gene_space' cannot be empty (i.e. its length must be >= 0).")
 207            else:
 208                for index, el in enumerate(gene_space):
 209                    if type(el) in [list, tuple, range, numpy.ndarray]:
 210                        if len(el) == 0:
 211                            self.valid_parameters = False
 212                            raise ValueError(
 213                                "The element indexed {index} of 'gene_space' with type {el_type} cannot be empty (i.e. its length must be >= 0).".format(
 214                                    index=index, el_type=type(el)))
 215                        else:
 216                            for val in el:
 217                                if not (type(val) in [type(None)] + GA.supported_int_float_types):
 218                                    raise TypeError(
 219                                        "All values in the sublists inside the 'gene_space' attribute must be numeric of type int/float/None but ({val}) of type {typ} found.".format(
 220                                            val=val, typ=type(val)))
 221                        self.gene_space_nested = True
 222                    elif type(el) == type(None):
 223                        pass
 224                        # self.gene_space_nested = True
 225                    elif type(el) is dict:
 226                        if len(el.items()) == 2:
 227                            if ('low' in el.keys()) and ('high' in el.keys()):
 228                                pass
 229                            else:
 230                                self.valid_parameters = False
 231                                raise ValueError(
 232                                    "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 233                                        gene_space_dict_keys=el.keys()))
 234                        elif len(el.items()) == 3:
 235                            if ('low' in el.keys()) and ('high' in el.keys()) and ('step' in el.keys()):
 236                                pass
 237                            else:
 238                                self.valid_parameters = False
 239                                raise ValueError(
 240                                    "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 241                                        gene_space_dict_keys=el.keys()))
 242                        else:
 243                            self.valid_parameters = False
 244                            raise ValueError(
 245                                "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it must have only 2 items but ({num_items}) items found.".format(
 246                                    num_items=len(el.items())))
 247                        self.gene_space_nested = True
 248                    elif not (type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types):
 249                        self.valid_parameters = False
 250                        raise TypeError(
 251                            "Unexpected type {el_type} for the element indexed {index} of 'gene_space'. The accepted types are list/tuple/range/numpy.ndarray of numbers, a single number (int/float), or None.".format(
 252                                index=index, el_type=type(el)))
 253
 254        elif type(gene_space) is dict:
 255            if len(gene_space.items()) == 2:
 256                if ('low' in gene_space.keys()) and ('high' in gene_space.keys()):
 257                    pass
 258                else:
 259                    self.valid_parameters = False
 260                    raise ValueError(
 261                        "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have only the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 262                            gene_space_dict_keys=gene_space.keys()))
 263            elif len(gene_space.items()) == 3:
 264                if ('low' in gene_space.keys()) and ('high' in gene_space.keys()) and ('step' in gene_space.keys()):
 265                    pass
 266                else:
 267                    self.valid_parameters = False
 268                    raise ValueError(
 269                        "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have only the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 270                            gene_space_dict_keys=gene_space.keys()))
 271            else:
 272                self.valid_parameters = False
 273                raise ValueError(
 274                    "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it must have only 2 items but ({num_items}) items found.".format(
 275                        num_items=len(gene_space.items())))
 276
 277        else:
 278            self.valid_parameters = False
 279            raise TypeError(
 280                "The expected type of 'gene_space' is list, tuple, range, or numpy.ndarray but ({gene_space_type}) found.".format(
 281                    gene_space_type=type(gene_space)))
 282
 283        self.gene_space = gene_space
 284
 285        # Validate init_range_low and init_range_high
 286        if type(init_range_low) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 287            if type(init_range_high) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 288                self.init_range_low = init_range_low
 289                self.init_range_high = init_range_high
 290            else:
 291                self.valid_parameters = False
 292                raise ValueError(
 293                    "The value passed to the 'init_range_high' parameter must be either integer or floating-point number but the value ({init_range_high_value}) of type {init_range_high_type} found.".format(
 294                        init_range_high_value=init_range_high, init_range_high_type=type(init_range_high)))
 295        else:
 296            self.valid_parameters = False
 297            raise ValueError(
 298                "The value passed to the 'init_range_low' parameter must be either integer or floating-point number but the value ({init_range_low_value}) of type {init_range_low_type} found.".format(
 299                    init_range_low_value=init_range_low, init_range_low_type=type(init_range_low)))
 300
 301        # Validate random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val
 302        if type(random_mutation_min_val) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 303            if type(random_mutation_max_val) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 304                if random_mutation_min_val == random_mutation_max_val:
 305                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 306                        "The values of the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val' are equal and this causes a fixed change to all genes.")
 307            else:
 308                self.valid_parameters = False
 309                raise TypeError(
 310                    "The expected type of the 'random_mutation_max_val' parameter is numeric but ({random_mutation_max_val_type}) found.".format(
 311                        random_mutation_max_val_type=type(random_mutation_max_val)))
 312        else:
 313            self.valid_parameters = False
 314            raise TypeError(
 315                "The expected type of the 'random_mutation_min_val' parameter is numeric but ({random_mutation_min_val_type}) found.".format(
 316                    random_mutation_min_val_type=type(random_mutation_min_val)))
 317        self.random_mutation_min_val = random_mutation_min_val
 318        self.random_mutation_max_val = random_mutation_max_val
 319
 320        # Validate gene_type
 321        if gene_type in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 322            self.gene_type = [gene_type, None]
 323            self.gene_type_single = True
 324        # A single data type of float with precision.
 325        elif len(gene_type) == 2 and gene_type[0] in GA.supported_float_types and (
 326                type(gene_type[1]) in GA.supported_int_types or gene_type[1] is None):
 327            self.gene_type = gene_type
 328            self.gene_type_single = True
 329        elif type(gene_type) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 330            if not len(gene_type) == num_genes:
 331                self.valid_parameters = False
 332                raise ValueError(
 333                    "When the parameter 'gene_type' is nested, then it can be either [float, int<precision>] or with length equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, value {gene_type_val} with len(gene_type) ({len_gene_type}) != len(num_genes) ({num_genes}) found.".format(
 334                        gene_type_val=gene_type, len_gene_type=len(gene_type), num_genes=num_genes))
 335            for gene_type_idx, gene_type_val in enumerate(gene_type):
 336                if gene_type_val in GA.supported_float_types:
 337                    # If the gene type is float and no precision is passed, set it to None.
 338                    gene_type[gene_type_idx] = [gene_type_val, None]
 339                elif gene_type_val in GA.supported_int_types:
 340                    gene_type[gene_type_idx] = [gene_type_val, None]
 341                elif type(gene_type_val) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 342                    # A float type is expected in a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of length 2.
 343                    if len(gene_type_val) == 2:
 344                        if gene_type_val[0] in GA.supported_float_types:
 345                            if type(gene_type_val[1]) in GA.supported_int_types:
 346                                pass
 347                            else:
 348                                self.valid_parameters = False
 349                                raise TypeError(
 350                                    "In the 'gene_type' parameter, the precision for float gene data types must be an integer but the element {gene_type_val} at index {gene_type_idx} has a precision of {gene_type_precision_val} with type {gene_type_type} .".format(
 351                                        gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_precision_val=gene_type_val[1],
 352                                        gene_type_type=gene_type_val[0], gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 353                        else:
 354                            self.valid_parameters = False
 355                            raise TypeError(
 356                                "In the 'gene_type' parameter, a precision is expected only for float gene data types but the element {gene_type} found at index {gene_type_idx}. Note that the data type must be at index 0 followed by precision at index 1.".format(
 357                                    gene_type=gene_type_val, gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 358                    else:
 359                        self.valid_parameters = False
 360                        raise ValueError(
 361                            "In the 'gene_type' parameter, a precision is specified in a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of length 2 but value ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} with length {gene_type_length} found at index {gene_type_idx}.".format(
 362                                gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_type=type(gene_type_val),
 363                                gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx, gene_type_length=len(gene_type_val)))
 364                else:
 365                    self.valid_parameters = False
 366                    raise ValueError(
 367                        "When a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is assigned to the 'gene_type' parameter, then its elements must be of integer, floating-point, list, tuple, or numpy.ndarray data types but the value ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} found at index {gene_type_idx}.".format(
 368                            gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_type=type(gene_type_val),
 369                            gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 370            self.gene_type = gene_type
 371            self.gene_type_single = False
 372        else:
 373            self.valid_parameters = False
 374            raise ValueError(
 375                "The value passed to the 'gene_type' parameter must be either a single integer, floating-point, list, tuple, or numpy.ndarray but ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} found.".format(
 376                    gene_type_val=gene_type, gene_type_type=type(gene_type)))
 377
 378        # Build the initial population
 379        if initial_population is None:
 380            if (sol_per_pop is None) or (num_genes is None):
 381                self.valid_parameters = False
