3790                "The plot_fitness() (i.e. plot_result()) method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3791                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3792
3793        #        if self.run_completed == False:
3794        #            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn("Warning calling the plot_result() method: \nGA is not executed yet and there are no results to display. Please call the run() method before calling the plot_result() method.\n")
3795
3796        fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure()
3797        if plot_type == "plot":
3798            matplotlib.pyplot.plot(self.best_solutions_fitness, linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3799        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3800            matplotlib.pyplot.scatter(range(self.generations_completed + 1), self.best_solutions_fitness,
3801                                      linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3802        elif plot_type == "bar":
3803            matplotlib.pyplot.bar(range(self.generations_completed + 1), self.best_solutions_fitness,
3804                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3805        matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
3806        matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
3807        matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
3808
3809        if not save_dir is None:
3810            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
3811                                      bbox_inches='tight')
3812        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
3813
3814        return fig
3815
3816    def plot_new_solution_rate(self,
3817                               title="PyGAD - Generation vs. New Solution Rate",
3818                               xlabel="Generation",
3819                               ylabel="New Solution Rate",
3820                               linewidth=3,
3821                               font_size=14,
3822                               plot_type="plot",
3823                               color="#3870FF",
3824                               save_dir=None):
3825
3826        """
3827        Creates, shows, and returns a figure that summarizes the rate of exploring new solutions. This method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.
3828
3829        Accepts the following:
3830            title: Figure title.
3831            xlabel: Label on the X-axis.
3832            ylabel: Label on the Y-axis.
3833            linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3.
3834            font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14.
3835            plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar".
3836            color: Color of the plot which defaults to "#3870FF".
3837            save_dir: Directory to save the figure.
3838
3839        Returns the figure.
3840        """
3841
3842        if self.generations_completed < 1:
3843            raise RuntimeError(
3844                "The plot_new_solution_rate() method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3845                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3846
3847        if self.save_solutions == False:
3848            raise RuntimeError(
3849                "The plot_new_solution_rate() method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.")
3850
3851        unique_solutions = set()
3852        num_unique_solutions_per_generation = []
3853        for generation_idx in range(self.generations_completed):
3854
3855            len_before = len(unique_solutions)
3856
3857            start = generation_idx * self.sol_per_pop
3858            end = start + self.sol_per_pop
3859
3860            for sol in self.solutions[start:end]:
3861                unique_solutions.add(tuple(sol))
3862
3863            len_after = len(unique_solutions)
3864
3865            generation_num_unique_solutions = len_after - len_before
3866            num_unique_solutions_per_generation.append(generation_num_unique_solutions)
3867
3868        fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure()
3869        if plot_type == "plot":
3870            matplotlib.pyplot.plot(num_unique_solutions_per_generation, linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3871        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3872            matplotlib.pyplot.scatter(range(self.generations_completed), num_unique_solutions_per_generation,
3873                                      linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3874        elif plot_type == "bar":
3875            matplotlib.pyplot.bar(range(self.generations_completed), num_unique_solutions_per_generation,
3876                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=color)
3877        matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
3878        matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
3879        matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
3880
3881        if not save_dir is None:
3882            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
3883                                      bbox_inches='tight')
3884        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
3885
3886        return fig
3887
3888    def plot_genes(self,
3889                   title="PyGAD - Gene",
3890                   xlabel="Gene",
3891                   ylabel="Value",
3892                   linewidth=3,
3893                   font_size=14,
3894                   plot_type="plot",
3895                   graph_type="plot",
3896                   fill_color="#3870FF",
3897                   color="black",
3898                   solutions="all",
3899                   save_dir=None):
3900
3901        """
3902        Creates, shows, and returns a figure with number of subplots equal to the number of genes. Each subplot shows the gene value for each generation.
3903        This method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.
3904        It also works only after completing at least 1 generation. If no generation is completed, an exception is raised.
3905
3906        Accepts the following:
3907            title: Figure title.
3908            xlabel: Label on the X-axis.
3909            ylabel: Label on the Y-axis.
3910            linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3.
3911            font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14.
3912            plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar".
3913            graph_type: Type of the graph which can be either "plot" (default), "boxplot", or "histogram".
3914            fill_color: Fill color of the graph which defaults to "#3870FF". This has no effect if graph_type="plot".
3915            color: Color of the plot which defaults to "black".
3916            solutions: Defaults to "all" which means use all solutions. If "best" then only the best solutions are used.
3917            save_dir: Directory to save the figure.
3918
3919        Returns the figure.
3920        """
3921
3922        if self.generations_completed < 1:
3923            raise RuntimeError(
3924                "The plot_genes() method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3925                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3926
3927        if type(solutions) is str:
3928            if solutions == 'all':
3929                if self.save_solutions:
3930                    solutions_to_plot = numpy.array(self.solutions)
3931                else:
3932                    raise RuntimeError(
3933                        "The plot_genes() method with solutions='all' can only be called if 'save_solutions=True' in the pygad.GA class constructor.")
3934            elif solutions == 'best':
3935                if self.save_best_solutions:
3936                    solutions_to_plot = self.best_solutions
3937                else:
3938                    raise RuntimeError(
3939                        "The plot_genes() method with solutions='best' can only be called if 'save_best_solutions=True' in the pygad.GA class constructor.")
3940            else:
3941                raise RuntimeError(
3942                    "The solutions parameter can be either 'all' or 'best' but {solutions} found.".format(
3943                        solutions=solutions))
3944        else:
3945            raise RuntimeError("The solutions parameter must be a string but {solutions_type} found.".format(
3946                solutions_type=type(solutions)))
3947
3948        if graph_type == "plot":
3949            # num_rows will be always be >= 1
3950            # num_cols can only be 0 if num_genes=1
3951            num_rows = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / 5.0))
3952            num_cols = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / num_rows))
3953
3954            if num_cols == 0:
3955                figsize = (10, 8)
3956                # There is only a single gene
3957                fig, ax = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, figsize=figsize)
3958                if plot_type == "plot":
3959                    ax.plot(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3960                elif plot_type == "scatter":
3961                    ax.scatter(range(self.generations_completed + 1), solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth,
3962                               color=fill_color)
3963                elif plot_type == "bar":
3964                    ax.bar(range(self.generations_completed + 1), solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth,
3965                           color=fill_color)
3966                ax.set_xlabel(0, fontsize=font_size)
3967            else:
3968                fig, axs = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, num_cols)
3969
3970                if num_cols == 1 and num_rows == 1:
3971                    fig.set_figwidth(5 * num_cols)
3972                    fig.set_figheight(4)
3973                    axs.plot(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3974                    axs.set_xlabel("Gene " + str(0), fontsize=font_size)
3975                elif num_cols == 1 or num_rows == 1:
3976                    fig.set_figwidth(5 * num_cols)
3977                    fig.set_figheight(4)
3978                    for gene_idx in range(len(axs)):
3979                        if plot_type == "plot":
3980                            axs[gene_idx].plot(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3981                        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3982                            axs[gene_idx].scatter(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]), solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
3983                                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3984                        elif plot_type == "bar":
3985                            axs[gene_idx].bar(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]), solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
3986                                              linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3987                        axs[gene_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
3988                else:
3989                    gene_idx = 0
3990                    fig.set_figwidth(25)
3991                    fig.set_figheight(4 * num_rows)
3992                    for row_idx in range(num_rows):
3993                        for col_idx in range(num_cols):
3994                            if gene_idx >= self.num_genes:
3995                                # axs[row_idx, col_idx].remove()
3996                                break
3997                            if plot_type == "plot":
3998                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].plot(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
3999                                                           color=fill_color)
4000                            elif plot_type == "scatter":
4001                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].scatter(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]),
4002                                                              solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
4003                                                              color=fill_color)
4004                            elif plot_type == "bar":
4005                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].bar(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]),
4006                                                          solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
4007                                                          color=fill_color)
4008                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4009                            gene_idx += 1
4010
4011            fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=font_size, y=1.001)
4012            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4013
4014        elif graph_type == "boxplot":
4015            fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure(1, figsize=(0.7 * self.num_genes, 6))
4016
4017            # Create an axes instance
4018            ax = fig.add_subplot(111)
4019            boxeplots = ax.boxplot(solutions_to_plot,
4020                                   labels=range(self.num_genes),
4021                                   patch_artist=True)
4022            # adding horizontal grid lines
4023            ax.yaxis.grid(True)
4024
4025            for box in boxeplots['boxes']:
4026                # change outline color
4027                box.set(color='black', linewidth=linewidth)
4028                # change fill color https://color.adobe.com/create/color-wheel
4029                box.set_facecolor(fill_color)
4030
4031            for whisker in boxeplots['whiskers']:
4032                whisker.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4033            for median in boxeplots['medians']:
4034                median.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4035            for cap in boxeplots['caps']:
4036                cap.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4037
4038            matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
4039            matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
4040            matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
4041            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4042
4043        elif graph_type == "histogram":
4044            # num_rows will be always be >= 1
4045            # num_cols can only be 0 if num_genes=1
4046            num_rows = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / 5.0))
4047            num_cols = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / num_rows))
4048
4049            if num_cols == 0:
4050                figsize = (10, 8)
4051                # There is only a single gene
4052                fig, ax = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows,
4053                                                     figsize=figsize)
4054                ax.hist(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], color=fill_color)
4055                ax.set_xlabel(0, fontsize=font_size)
4056            else:
4057                fig, axs = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, num_cols)
4058
4059                if num_cols == 1 and num_rows == 1:
4060                    fig.set_figwidth(4 * num_cols)
4061                    fig.set_figheight(3)
4062                    axs.hist(solutions_to_plot[:, 0],
4063                             color=fill_color,
4064                             rwidth=0.95)
4065                    axs.set_xlabel("Gene " + str(0), fontsize=font_size)
4066                elif num_cols == 1 or num_rows == 1:
4067                    fig.set_figwidth(4 * num_cols)
4068                    fig.set_figheight(3)
4069                    for gene_idx in range(len(axs)):
4070                        axs[gene_idx].hist(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
4071                                           color=fill_color,
4072                                           rwidth=0.95)
4073                        axs[gene_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4074                else:
4075                    gene_idx = 0
4076                    fig.set_figwidth(20)
4077                    fig.set_figheight(3 * num_rows)
4078                    for row_idx in range(num_rows):
4079                        for col_idx in range(num_cols):
4080                            if gene_idx >= self.num_genes:
4081                                # axs[row_idx, col_idx].remove()
4082                                break
4083                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].hist(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
4084                                                       color=fill_color,
4085                                                       rwidth=0.95)
4086                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4087                            gene_idx += 1
4088
4089            fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=font_size, y=1.001)
4090            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4091
4092        if not save_dir is None:
4093            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
4094                                      bbox_inches='tight')
4095
4096        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
4097
4098        return fig
4099
4100
4101    def close_parallel(self):
4102        if self.parallel_processing is not None:
4103            # print('before close')
4104            self._pool.close()
4105            # print('after close')
4106            self._pool.join()
4107            # print('after join')
4108            self._pool.terminate()
4109            # print('after terminate')
4110
4111    def save(self, filename):
4112
4113        """
4114        Saves the genetic algorithm instance:
4115            -filename: Name of the file to save the instance. No extension is needed.
4116        """
4117
4118        with open(filename + ".pkl", 'wb') as file:
4119            pickle.dump(self, file)
GA( num_generations, num_parents_mating, fitness_func, args=None, initial_population=None, sol_per_pop=None, num_genes=None, init_range_low=-4, init_range_high=4, gene_type=<class 'float'>, parent_selection_type='sss', keep_parents=-1, keep_elitism=1, K_tournament=3, crossover_type='single_point', crossover_probability=None, mutation_type='random', mutation_probability=None, mutation_by_replacement=False, mutation_percent_genes='default', mutation_num_genes=None, random_mutation_min_val=-1.0, random_mutation_max_val=1.0, gene_space=None, allow_duplicate_genes=True, on_start=None, on_fitness=None, on_parents=None, on_crossover=None, on_mutation=None, callback_generation=None, on_generation=None, on_stop=None, delay_after_gen=0.0, save_best_solutions=False, save_solutions=False, suppress_warnings=False, stop_criteria=None, ftol_abs=0.0, parallel_processing=None, random_seed=None) 
  67    def __init__(self,
  68                 num_generations,
  69                 num_parents_mating,
  70                 fitness_func,
  71                 args=None,
  72                 initial_population=None,
  73                 sol_per_pop=None,
  74                 num_genes=None,
  75                 init_range_low=-4,
  76                 init_range_high=4,
  77                 gene_type=float,
  78                 parent_selection_type="sss",
  79                 keep_parents=-1,
  80                 keep_elitism=1,
  81                 K_tournament=3,
  82                 crossover_type="single_point",
  83                 crossover_probability=None,
  84                 mutation_type="random",
  85                 mutation_probability=None,
  86                 mutation_by_replacement=False,
  87                 mutation_percent_genes='default',
  88                 mutation_num_genes=None,
  89                 random_mutation_min_val=-1.0,
  90                 random_mutation_max_val=1.0,
  91                 gene_space=None,
  92                 allow_duplicate_genes=True,
  93                 on_start=None,
  94                 on_fitness=None,
  95                 on_parents=None,
  96                 on_crossover=None,
  97                 on_mutation=None,
  98                 callback_generation=None,
  99                 on_generation=None,
 100                 on_stop=None,
 101                 delay_after_gen=0.0,
 102                 save_best_solutions=False,
 103                 save_solutions=False,
 104                 suppress_warnings=False,
 105                 stop_criteria=None,
 106                 ftol_abs=0.0,
 107                 parallel_processing=None,
 108                 random_seed=None):
 109
 110        """
 111        The constructor of the GA class accepts all parameters required to create an instance of the GA class. It validates such parameters.
 112
 113        num_generations: Number of generations.
 114        num_parents_mating: Number of solutions to be selected as parents in the mating pool.
 115
 116        fitness_func: Accepts a function that must accept 2 parameters (a single solution and its index in the population) and return the fitness value of the solution. Available starting from PyGAD 1.0.17 until 1.0.20 with a single parameter representing the solution. Changed in PyGAD 2.0.0 and higher to include the second parameter representing the solution index.
 117
 118        initial_population: A user-defined initial population. It is useful when the user wants to start the generations with a custom initial population. It defaults to None which means no initial population is specified by the user. In this case, PyGAD creates an initial population using the 'sol_per_pop' and 'num_genes' parameters. An exception is raised if the 'initial_population' is None while any of the 2 parameters ('sol_per_pop' or 'num_genes') is also None.
 119        sol_per_pop: Number of solutions in the population.
 120        num_genes: Number of parameters in the function.
 121
 122        init_range_low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher.
 123        init_range_high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.
 124        # It is OK to set the value of any of the 2 parameters ('init_range_low' and 'init_range_high') to be equal, higher or lower than the other parameter (i.e. init_range_low is not needed to be lower than init_range_high).
 125
 126        gene_type: The type of the gene. It is assigned to any of these types (int, float, numpy.int, numpy.int8, numpy.int16, numpy.int32, numpy.int64, numpy.uint, numpy.uint8, numpy.uint16, numpy.uint32, numpy.uint64, numpy.float, numpy.float16, numpy.float32, numpy.float64) and forces all the genes to be of that type.
 127
 128        parent_selection_type: Type of parent selection.
 129        keep_parents: If 0, this means no parent in the current population will be used in the next population. If -1, this means all parents in the current population will be used in the next population. If set to a value > 0, then the specified value refers to the number of parents in the current population to be used in the next population. Some parent selection operators such as rank selection, favor population diversity and therefore keeping the parents in the next generation can be beneficial. However, some other parent selection operators, such as roulette wheel selection (RWS), have higher selection pressure and keeping more than one parent in the next generation can seriously harm population diversity. This parameter have an effect only when the keep_elitism parameter is 0. Thanks to Prof. Fernando Jimnez Barrionuevo (http://webs.um.es/fernan) for editing this sentence.
 130        K_tournament: When the value of 'parent_selection_type' is 'tournament', the 'K_tournament' parameter specifies the number of solutions from which a parent is selected randomly.
 131
 132        keep_elitism: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It can take the value 0 or a positive integer that satisfies (0 <= keep_elitism <= sol_per_pop). It defaults to 1 which means only the best solution in the current generation is kept in the next generation. If assigned 0, this means it has no effect. If assigned a positive integer K, then the best K solutions are kept in the next generation. It cannot be assigned a value greater than the value assigned to the sol_per_pop parameter. If this parameter has a value different than 0, then the keep_parents parameter will have no effect.
 133
 134        crossover_type: Type of the crossover opreator. If  crossover_type=None, then the crossover step is bypassed which means no crossover is applied and thus no offspring will be created in the next generations. The next generation will use the solutions in the current population.
 135        crossover_probability: The probability of selecting a solution for the crossover operation. If the solution probability is <= crossover_probability, the solution is selected. The value must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
 136
 137        mutation_type: Type of the mutation opreator. If mutation_type=None, then the mutation step is bypassed which means no mutation is applied and thus no changes are applied to the offspring created using the crossover operation. The offspring will be used unchanged in the next generation.
 138        mutation_probability: The probability of selecting a gene for the mutation operation. If the gene probability is <= mutation_probability, the gene is selected. It accepts either a single value for fixed mutation or a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of 2 values for adaptive mutation. The values must be between 0 and 1 inclusive. If specified, then no need for the 2 parameters mutation_percent_genes and mutation_num_genes.
 139
 140        mutation_by_replacement: An optional bool parameter. It works only when the selected type of mutation is random (mutation_type="random"). In this case, setting mutation_by_replacement=True means replace the gene by the randomly generated value. If False, then it has no effect and random mutation works by adding the random value to the gene.
 141
 142        mutation_percent_genes: Percentage of genes to mutate which defaults to the string 'default' which means 10%. This parameter has no action if any of the 2 parameters mutation_probability or mutation_num_genes exist.
 143        mutation_num_genes: Number of genes to mutate which defaults to None. If the parameter mutation_num_genes exists, then no need for the parameter mutation_percent_genes. This parameter has no action if the mutation_probability parameter exists.
 144        random_mutation_min_val: The minimum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to -1.0.
 145        random_mutation_max_val: The maximum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to 1.0.
 146
 147        gene_space: It accepts a list of all possible values of the gene. This list is used in the mutation step. Should be used only if the gene space is a set of discrete values. No need for the 2 parameters (random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val) if the parameter gene_space exists. Added in PyGAD 2.5.0. In PyGAD 2.11.0, the gene_space can be assigned a dict.
 148
 149        on_start: Accepts a function to be called only once before the genetic algorithm starts its evolution. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 150        on_fitness: Accepts a function to be called after calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the population. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of all solutions' fitness values. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 151        on_parents: Accepts a function to be called after selecting the parents that mates. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the selected parents. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 152        on_crossover: Accepts a function to be called each time the crossover operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring generated using crossover. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 153        on_mutation: Accepts a function to be called each time the mutation operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring after applying the mutation. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 154        callback_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Starting from PyGAD 2.6.0, the callback_generation parameter is deprecated and should be replaced by the on_generation parameter.
 155        on_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 156        on_stop: Accepts a function to be called only once exactly before the genetic algorithm stops or when it completes all the generations. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of fitness values of the last population's solutions. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.
 157
 158        delay_after_gen: Added in PyGAD 2.4.0. It accepts a non-negative number specifying the number of seconds to wait after a generation completes and before going to the next generation. It defaults to 0.0 which means no delay after the generation.
 159
 160        save_best_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.9.0 and its type is bool. If True, then the best solution in each generation is saved into the 'best_solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations or the number of genes is large.
 161        save_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0 and its type is bool. If True, then all solutions in each generation are saved into the 'solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations, number of genes, or number of solutions in population is large.
 162
 163        suppress_warnings: Added in PyGAD 2.10.0 and its type is bool. If True, then no warning messages will be displayed. It defaults to False.
 164
 165        allow_duplicate_genes: Added in PyGAD 2.13.0. If True, then a solution/chromosome may have duplicate gene values. If False, then each gene will have a unique value in its solution.
 166
 167        stop_criteria: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0. It is assigned to some criteria to stop the evolution if at least one criterion holds.
 168
 169        parallel_processing: Added in PyGAD 2.17.0. Defaults to `None` which means no parallel processing is used. If a positive integer is assigned, it specifies the number of threads to be used. If a list or a tuple of exactly 2 elements is assigned, then: 1) The first element can be either "process" or "thread" to specify whether processes or threads are used, respectively. 2) The second element can be: 1) A positive integer to select the maximum number of processes or threads to be used. 2) 0 to indicate that parallel processing is not used. This is identical to setting 'parallel_processing=None'. 3) None to use the default value as calculated by the concurrent.futures module.
 170
 171        random_seed: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It defines the random seed to be used by the random function generators (we use random functions in the NumPy and random modules). This helps to reproduce the same results by setting the same random seed.
 172        """
 173
 174        self.random_seed = random_seed
 175        if random_seed is None:
 176            pass
 177        else:
 178            numpy.random.seed(self.random_seed)
 179            random.seed(self.random_seed)
 180
 181        # If suppress_warnings is bool and its valud is False, then print warning messages.
 182        if type(suppress_warnings) is bool:
 183            self.suppress_warnings = suppress_warnings
 184        else:
 185            self.valid_parameters = False
 186            raise TypeError(
 187                "The expected type of the 'suppress_warnings' parameter is bool but {suppress_warnings_type} found.".format(
 188                    suppress_warnings_type=type(suppress_warnings)))
 189
 190        # Validating mutation_by_replacement
 191        if not (type(mutation_by_replacement) is bool):
 192            self.valid_parameters = False
 193            raise TypeError(
 194                "The expected type of the 'mutation_by_replacement' parameter is bool but ({mutation_by_replacement_type}) found.".format(
 195                    mutation_by_replacement_type=type(mutation_by_replacement)))
 196
 197        self.mutation_by_replacement = mutation_by_replacement
 198
 199        # Validate gene_space
 200        self.gene_space_nested = False
 201        if type(gene_space) is type(None):
 202            pass
 203        elif type(gene_space) in [list, tuple, range, numpy.ndarray]:
 204            if len(gene_space) == 0:
 205                self.valid_parameters = False
 206                raise ValueError("'gene_space' cannot be empty (i.e. its length must be >= 0).")
 207            else:
 208                for index, el in enumerate(gene_space):
 209                    if type(el) in [list, tuple, range, numpy.ndarray]:
 210                        if len(el) == 0:
 211                            self.valid_parameters = False
 212                            raise ValueError(
 213                                "The element indexed {index} of 'gene_space' with type {el_type} cannot be empty (i.e. its length must be >= 0).".format(
 214                                    index=index, el_type=type(el)))
 215                        else:
 216                            for val in el:
 217                                if not (type(val) in [type(None)] + GA.supported_int_float_types):
 218                                    raise TypeError(
 219                                        "All values in the sublists inside the 'gene_space' attribute must be numeric of type int/float/None but ({val}) of type {typ} found.".format(
 220                                            val=val, typ=type(val)))
 221                        self.gene_space_nested = True
 222                    elif type(el) == type(None):
 223                        pass
 224                        # self.gene_space_nested = True
 225                    elif type(el) is dict:
 226                        if len(el.items()) == 2:
 227                            if ('low' in el.keys()) and ('high' in el.keys()):
 228                                pass
 229                            else:
 230                                self.valid_parameters = False
 231                                raise ValueError(
 232                                    "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 233                                        gene_space_dict_keys=el.keys()))
 234                        elif len(el.items()) == 3:
 235                            if ('low' in el.keys()) and ('high' in el.keys()) and ('step' in el.keys()):
 236                                pass
 237                            else:
 238                                self.valid_parameters = False
 239                                raise ValueError(
 240                                    "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 241                                        gene_space_dict_keys=el.keys()))
 242                        else:
 243                            self.valid_parameters = False
 244                            raise ValueError(
 245                                "When an element in the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it must have only 2 items but ({num_items}) items found.".format(
 246                                    num_items=len(el.items())))
 247                        self.gene_space_nested = True
 248                    elif not (type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types):
 249                        self.valid_parameters = False
 250                        raise TypeError(
 251                            "Unexpected type {el_type} for the element indexed {index} of 'gene_space'. The accepted types are list/tuple/range/numpy.ndarray of numbers, a single number (int/float), or None.".format(
 252                                index=index, el_type=type(el)))
 253
 254        elif type(gene_space) is dict:
 255            if len(gene_space.items()) == 2:
 256                if ('low' in gene_space.keys()) and ('high' in gene_space.keys()):
 257                    pass
 258                else:
 259                    self.valid_parameters = False
 260                    raise ValueError(
 261                        "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have only the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 262                            gene_space_dict_keys=gene_space.keys()))
 263            elif len(gene_space.items()) == 3:
 264                if ('low' in gene_space.keys()) and ('high' in gene_space.keys()) and ('step' in gene_space.keys()):
 265                    pass
 266                else:
 267                    self.valid_parameters = False
 268                    raise ValueError(
 269                        "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it can have only the keys 'low', 'high', and 'step' (optional) but the following keys found: {gene_space_dict_keys}".format(
 270                            gene_space_dict_keys=gene_space.keys()))
 271            else:
 272                self.valid_parameters = False
 273                raise ValueError(
 274                    "When the 'gene_space' parameter is of type dict, then it must have only 2 items but ({num_items}) items found.".format(
 275                        num_items=len(gene_space.items())))
 276
 277        else:
 278            self.valid_parameters = False
 279            raise TypeError(
 280                "The expected type of 'gene_space' is list, tuple, range, or numpy.ndarray but ({gene_space_type}) found.".format(
 281                    gene_space_type=type(gene_space)))
 282
 283        self.gene_space = gene_space
 284
 285        # Validate init_range_low and init_range_high
 286        if type(init_range_low) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 287            if type(init_range_high) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 288                self.init_range_low = init_range_low
 289                self.init_range_high = init_range_high
 290            else:
 291                self.valid_parameters = False
 292                raise ValueError(
 293                    "The value passed to the 'init_range_high' parameter must be either integer or floating-point number but the value ({init_range_high_value}) of type {init_range_high_type} found.".format(
 294                        init_range_high_value=init_range_high, init_range_high_type=type(init_range_high)))
 295        else:
 296            self.valid_parameters = False
 297            raise ValueError(
 298                "The value passed to the 'init_range_low' parameter must be either integer or floating-point number but the value ({init_range_low_value}) of type {init_range_low_type} found.".format(
 299                    init_range_low_value=init_range_low, init_range_low_type=type(init_range_low)))
 300
 301        # Validate random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val
 302        if type(random_mutation_min_val) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 303            if type(random_mutation_max_val) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 304                if random_mutation_min_val == random_mutation_max_val:
 305                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 306                        "The values of the 2 parameters 'random_mutation_min_val' and 'random_mutation_max_val' are equal and this causes a fixed change to all genes.")
 307            else:
 308                self.valid_parameters = False
 309                raise TypeError(
 310                    "The expected type of the 'random_mutation_max_val' parameter is numeric but ({random_mutation_max_val_type}) found.".format(
 311                        random_mutation_max_val_type=type(random_mutation_max_val)))
 312        else:
 313            self.valid_parameters = False
 314            raise TypeError(
 315                "The expected type of the 'random_mutation_min_val' parameter is numeric but ({random_mutation_min_val_type}) found.".format(
 316                    random_mutation_min_val_type=type(random_mutation_min_val)))
 317        self.random_mutation_min_val = random_mutation_min_val
 318        self.random_mutation_max_val = random_mutation_max_val
 319
 320        # Validate gene_type
 321        if gene_type in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 322            self.gene_type = [gene_type, None]
 323            self.gene_type_single = True
 324        # A single data type of float with precision.
 325        elif len(gene_type) == 2 and gene_type[0] in GA.supported_float_types and (
 326                type(gene_type[1]) in GA.supported_int_types or gene_type[1] is None):
 327            self.gene_type = gene_type
 328            self.gene_type_single = True
 329        elif type(gene_type) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 330            if not len(gene_type) == num_genes:
 331                self.valid_parameters = False
 332                raise ValueError(
 333                    "When the parameter 'gene_type' is nested, then it can be either [float, int<precision>] or with length equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, value {gene_type_val} with len(gene_type) ({len_gene_type}) != len(num_genes) ({num_genes}) found.".format(
 334                        gene_type_val=gene_type, len_gene_type=len(gene_type), num_genes=num_genes))
 335            for gene_type_idx, gene_type_val in enumerate(gene_type):
 336                if gene_type_val in GA.supported_float_types:
 337                    # If the gene type is float and no precision is passed, set it to None.
 338                    gene_type[gene_type_idx] = [gene_type_val, None]
 339                elif gene_type_val in GA.supported_int_types:
 340                    gene_type[gene_type_idx] = [gene_type_val, None]
 341                elif type(gene_type_val) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 342                    # A float type is expected in a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of length 2.
 343                    if len(gene_type_val) == 2:
 344                        if gene_type_val[0] in GA.supported_float_types:
 345                            if type(gene_type_val[1]) in GA.supported_int_types:
 346                                pass
 347                            else:
 348                                self.valid_parameters = False
 349                                raise TypeError(
 350                                    "In the 'gene_type' parameter, the precision for float gene data types must be an integer but the element {gene_type_val} at index {gene_type_idx} has a precision of {gene_type_precision_val} with type {gene_type_type} .".format(
 351                                        gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_precision_val=gene_type_val[1],
 352                                        gene_type_type=gene_type_val[0], gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 353                        else:
 354                            self.valid_parameters = False
 355                            raise TypeError(
 356                                "In the 'gene_type' parameter, a precision is expected only for float gene data types but the element {gene_type} found at index {gene_type_idx}. Note that the data type must be at index 0 followed by precision at index 1.".format(
 357                                    gene_type=gene_type_val, gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 358                    else:
 359                        self.valid_parameters = False
 360                        raise ValueError(
 361                            "In the 'gene_type' parameter, a precision is specified in a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of length 2 but value ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} with length {gene_type_length} found at index {gene_type_idx}.".format(
 362                                gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_type=type(gene_type_val),
 363                                gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx, gene_type_length=len(gene_type_val)))
 364                else:
 365                    self.valid_parameters = False
 366                    raise ValueError(
 367                        "When a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is assigned to the 'gene_type' parameter, then its elements must be of integer, floating-point, list, tuple, or numpy.ndarray data types but the value ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} found at index {gene_type_idx}.".format(
 368                            gene_type_val=gene_type_val, gene_type_type=type(gene_type_val),
 369                            gene_type_idx=gene_type_idx))
 370            self.gene_type = gene_type
 371            self.gene_type_single = False
 372        else:
 373            self.valid_parameters = False
 374            raise ValueError(
 375                "The value passed to the 'gene_type' parameter must be either a single integer, floating-point, list, tuple, or numpy.ndarray but ({gene_type_val}) of type {gene_type_type} found.".format(
 376                    gene_type_val=gene_type, gene_type_type=type(gene_type)))
 377
 378        # Build the initial population
 379        if initial_population is None:
 380            if (sol_per_pop is None) or (num_genes is None):
 381                self.valid_parameters = False
 382                raise TypeError(
 383                    "Error creating the initial population\n\nWhen the parameter initial_population is None, then neither of the 2 parameters sol_per_pop and num_genes can be None at the same time.\nThere are 2 options to prepare the initial population:\n1) Create an initial population and assign it to the initial_population parameter. In this case, the values of the 2 parameters sol_per_pop and num_genes will be deduced.\n2) Allow the genetic algorithm to create the initial population automatically by passing valid integer values to the sol_per_pop and num_genes parameters.")
 384            elif (type(sol_per_pop) is int) and (type(num_genes) is int):
 385                # Validating the number of solutions in the population (sol_per_pop)
 386                if sol_per_pop <= 0:
 387                    self.valid_parameters = False
 388                    raise ValueError(
 389                        "The number of solutions in the population (sol_per_pop) must be > 0 but ({sol_per_pop}) found. \nThe following parameters must be > 0: \n1) Population size (i.e. number of solutions per population) (sol_per_pop).\n2) Number of selected parents in the mating pool (num_parents_mating).\n".format(
 390                            sol_per_pop=sol_per_pop))
 391                # Validating the number of gene.
 392                if (num_genes <= 0):
 393                    self.valid_parameters = False
 394                    raise ValueError(
 395                        "The number of genes cannot be <= 0 but ({num_genes}) found.\n".format(num_genes=num_genes))
 396                # When initial_population=None and the 2 parameters sol_per_pop and num_genes have valid integer values, then the initial population is created.
 397                # Inside the initialize_population() method, the initial_population attribute is assigned to keep the initial population accessible.
 398                self.num_genes = num_genes  # Number of genes in the solution.
 399
 400                # In case the 'gene_space' parameter is nested, then make sure the number of its elements equals to the number of genes.
 401                if self.gene_space_nested:
 402                    if len(gene_space) != self.num_genes:
 403                        self.valid_parameters = False
 404                        raise ValueError(
 405                            "When the parameter 'gene_space' is nested, then its length must be equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, length of gene_space ({len_gene_space}) != num_genes ({num_genes})".format(
 406                                len_gene_space=len(gene_space), num_genes=self.num_genes))
 407
 408                self.sol_per_pop = sol_per_pop  # Number of solutions in the population.
 409                self.initialize_population(self.init_range_low, self.init_range_high, allow_duplicate_genes, True,
 410                                           self.gene_type)
 411            else:
 412                self.valid_parameters = False
 413                raise TypeError(
 414                    "The expected type of both the sol_per_pop and num_genes parameters is int but ({sol_per_pop_type}) and {num_genes_type} found.".format(
 415                        sol_per_pop_type=type(sol_per_pop), num_genes_type=type(num_genes)))
 416        elif numpy.array(initial_population).ndim != 2:
 417            self.valid_parameters = False
 418            raise ValueError(
 419                "A 2D list is expected to the initail_population parameter but a ({initial_population_ndim}-D) list found.".format(
 420                    initial_population_ndim=numpy.array(initial_population).ndim))
 421        else:
 422            # Forcing the initial_population array to have the data type assigned to the gene_type parameter.
 423            if self.gene_type_single == True:
 424                if self.gene_type[1] == None:
 425                    self.initial_population = numpy.array(initial_population, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
 426                else:
 427                    self.initial_population = numpy.round(numpy.array(initial_population, dtype=self.gene_type[0]),
 428                                                          self.gene_type[1])
 429            else:
 430                initial_population = numpy.array(initial_population)
 431                self.initial_population = numpy.zeros(shape=(initial_population.shape[0], initial_population.shape[1]),
 432                                                      dtype=object)
 433                for gene_idx in range(initial_population.shape[1]):
 434                    if self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
 435                        self.initial_population[:, gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(initial_population[:, gene_idx],
 436                                                                             dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
 437                    else:
 438                        self.initial_population[:, gene_idx] = numpy.round(
 439                            numpy.asarray(initial_population[:, gene_idx],
 440                                          dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0]),
 441                            self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
 442
 443            self.population = self.initial_population.copy()  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
 444            self.num_genes = self.initial_population.shape[1]  # Number of genes in the solution.
 445            self.sol_per_pop = self.initial_population.shape[0]  # Number of solutions in the population.
 446            self.pop_size = (self.sol_per_pop, self.num_genes)  # The population size.
 447
 448        # Round initial_population and population
 449        self.initial_population = self.round_genes(self.initial_population)
 450        self.population = self.round_genes(self.population)
 451
 452        # In case the 'gene_space' parameter is nested, then make sure the number of its elements equals to the number of genes.
 453        if self.gene_space_nested:
 454            if len(gene_space) != self.num_genes:
 455                self.valid_parameters = False
 456                raise ValueError(
 457                    "When the parameter 'gene_space' is nested, then its length must be equal to the value passed to the 'num_genes' parameter. Instead, length of gene_space ({len_gene_space}) != num_genes ({len_num_genes})".format(
 458                        len_gene_space=len(gene_space), len_num_genes=self.num_genes))
 459
 460        # Validating the number of parents to be selected for mating (num_parents_mating)
 461        if num_parents_mating <= 0:
 462            self.valid_parameters = False
 463            raise ValueError(
 464                "The number of parents mating (num_parents_mating) parameter must be > 0 but ({num_parents_mating}) found. \nThe following parameters must be > 0: \n1) Population size (i.e. number of solutions per population) (sol_per_pop).\n2) Number of selected parents in the mating pool (num_parents_mating).\n".format(
 465                    num_parents_mating=num_parents_mating))
 466
 467        # Validating the number of parents to be selected for mating: num_parents_mating
 468        if (num_parents_mating > self.sol_per_pop):
 469            self.valid_parameters = False
 470            raise ValueError(
 471                "The number of parents to select for mating ({num_parents_mating}) cannot be greater than the number of solutions in the population ({sol_per_pop}) (i.e., num_parents_mating must always be <= sol_per_pop).\n".format(
 472                    num_parents_mating=num_parents_mating, sol_per_pop=self.sol_per_pop))
 473
 474        self.num_parents_mating = num_parents_mating
 475
 476        # crossover: Refers to the method that applies the crossover operator based on the selected type of crossover in the crossover_type property.
 477        # Validating the crossover type: crossover_type
 478        if (crossover_type is None):
 479            self.crossover = None
 480        elif callable(crossover_type):
 481            # Check if the crossover_type is a function that accepts 2 paramaters.
 482            if (crossover_type.__code__.co_argcount == 3):
 483                # The crossover function assigned to the crossover_type parameter is validated.
 484                self.crossover = crossover_type
 485            else:
 486                self.valid_parameters = False
 487                raise ValueError(
 488                    "When 'crossover_type' is assigned to a function, then this crossover function must accept 2 parameters:\n1) The selected parents.\n2) The size of the offspring to be produced.3) The instance from the pygad.GA class to retrieve any property like population, gene data type, gene space, etc.\n\nThe passed crossover function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 489                        funcname=crossover_type.__code__.co_name, argcount=crossover_type.__code__.co_argcount))
 490        elif not (type(crossover_type) is str):
 491            self.valid_parameters = False
 492            raise TypeError(
 493                "The expected type of the 'crossover_type' parameter is either callable or str but ({crossover_type}) found.".format(
 494                    crossover_type=type(crossover_type)))
 495        else:  # type crossover_type is str
 496            crossover_type = crossover_type.lower()
 497            if (crossover_type == "single_point"):
 498                self.crossover = self.single_point_crossover
 499            elif (crossover_type == "two_points"):
 500                self.crossover = self.two_points_crossover
 501            elif (crossover_type == "uniform"):
 502                self.crossover = self.uniform_crossover
 503            elif (crossover_type == "scattered"):
 504                self.crossover = self.scattered_crossover
 505            else:
 506                self.valid_parameters = False
 507                raise TypeError(
 508                    "Undefined crossover type. \nThe assigned value to the crossover_type ({crossover_type}) parameter does not refer to one of the supported crossover types which are: \n-single_point (for single point crossover)\n-two_points (for two points crossover)\n-uniform (for uniform crossover)\n-scattered (for scattered crossover).\n".format(
 509                        crossover_type=crossover_type))
 510
 511        self.crossover_type = crossover_type
 512
 513        # Calculate the value of crossover_probability
 514        if crossover_probability is None:
 515            self.crossover_probability = None
 516        elif type(crossover_probability) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 517            if crossover_probability >= 0 and crossover_probability <= 1:
 518                self.crossover_probability = crossover_probability
 519            else:
 520                self.valid_parameters = False
 521                raise ValueError(
 522                    "The value assigned to the 'crossover_probability' parameter must be between 0 and 1 inclusive but ({crossover_probability_value}) found.".format(
 523                        crossover_probability_value=crossover_probability))
 524        else:
 525            self.valid_parameters = False
 526            raise TypeError(
 527                "Unexpected type for the 'crossover_probability' parameter. Float is expected but ({crossover_probability_value}) of type {crossover_probability_type} found.".format(
 528                    crossover_probability_value=crossover_probability,
 529                    crossover_probability_type=type(crossover_probability)))
 530
 531        # mutation: Refers to the method that applies the mutation operator based on the selected type of mutation in the mutation_type property.
 532        # Validating the mutation type: mutation_type
 533        # "adaptive" mutation is supported starting from PyGAD 2.10.0
 534        if mutation_type is None:
 535            self.mutation = None
 536        elif callable(mutation_type):
 537            # Check if the mutation_type is a function that accepts 1 paramater.
 538            if (mutation_type.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 539                # The mutation function assigned to the mutation_type parameter is validated.
 540                self.mutation = mutation_type
 541            else:
 542                self.valid_parameters = False
 543                raise ValueError(
 544                    "When 'mutation_type' is assigned to a function, then this mutation function must accept 2 parameters:\n1) The offspring to be mutated.\n2) The instance from the pygad.GA class to retrieve any property like population, gene data type, gene space, etc.\n\nThe passed mutation function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 545                        funcname=mutation_type.__code__.co_name, argcount=mutation_type.__code__.co_argcount))
 546        elif not (type(mutation_type) is str):
 547            self.valid_parameters = False
 548            raise TypeError(
 549                "The expected type of the 'mutation_type' parameter is either callable or str but ({mutation_type}) found.".format(
 550                    mutation_type=type(mutation_type)))
 551        else:  # type mutation_type is str
 552            mutation_type = mutation_type.lower()
 553            if (mutation_type == "random"):
 554                self.mutation = self.random_mutation
 555            elif (mutation_type == "swap"):
 556                self.mutation = self.swap_mutation
 557            elif (mutation_type == "scramble"):
 558                self.mutation = self.scramble_mutation
 559            elif (mutation_type == "inversion"):
 560                self.mutation = self.inversion_mutation
 561            elif (mutation_type == "adaptive"):
 562                self.mutation = self.adaptive_mutation
 563            else:
 564                self.valid_parameters = False
 565                raise TypeError(
 566                    "Undefined mutation type. \nThe assigned string value to the 'mutation_type' parameter ({mutation_type}) does not refer to one of the supported mutation types which are: \n-random (for random mutation)\n-swap (for swap mutation)\n-inversion (for inversion mutation)\n-scramble (for scramble mutation)\n-adaptive (for adaptive mutation).\n".format(
 567                        mutation_type=mutation_type))
 568
 569        self.mutation_type = mutation_type
 570
 571        # Calculate the value of mutation_probability
 572        if not (self.mutation_type is None):
 573            if mutation_probability is None:
 574                self.mutation_probability = None
 575            elif (mutation_type != "adaptive"):
 576                # Mutation probability is fixed not adaptive.
 577                if type(mutation_probability) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 578                    if mutation_probability >= 0 and mutation_probability <= 1:
 579                        self.mutation_probability = mutation_probability
 580                    else:
 581                        self.valid_parameters = False
 582                        raise ValueError(
 583                            "The value assigned to the 'mutation_probability' parameter must be between 0 and 1 inclusive but ({mutation_probability_value}) found.".format(
 584                                mutation_probability_value=mutation_probability))
 585                else:
 586                    self.valid_parameters = False
 587                    raise TypeError(
 588                        "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_probability' parameter. A numeric value is expected but ({mutation_probability_value}) of type {mutation_probability_type} found.".format(
 589                            mutation_probability_value=mutation_probability,
 590                            mutation_probability_type=type(mutation_probability)))
 591            else:
 592                # Mutation probability is adaptive not fixed.
 593                if type(mutation_probability) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 594                    if len(mutation_probability) == 2:
 595                        for el in mutation_probability:
 596                            if type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 597                                if el >= 0 and el <= 1:
 598                                    pass
 599                                else:
 600                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 601                                    raise ValueError(
 602                                        "The values assigned to the 'mutation_probability' parameter must be between 0 and 1 inclusive but ({mutation_probability_value}) found.".format(
 603                                            mutation_probability_value=el))
 604                            else:
 605                                self.valid_parameters = False
 606                                raise TypeError(
 607                                    "Unexpected type for a value assigned to the 'mutation_probability' parameter. A numeric value is expected but ({mutation_probability_value}) of type {mutation_probability_type} found.".format(
 608                                        mutation_probability_value=el, mutation_probability_type=type(el)))
 609                        if mutation_probability[0] < mutation_probability[1]:
 610                            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 611                                "The first element in the 'mutation_probability' parameter is {first_el} which is smaller than the second element {second_el}. This means the mutation rate for the high-quality solutions is higher than the mutation rate of the low-quality ones. This causes high disruption in the high qualitiy solutions while making little changes in the low quality solutions. Please make the first element higher than the second element.".format(
 612                                    first_el=mutation_probability[0], second_el=mutation_probability[1]))
 613                        self.mutation_probability = mutation_probability
 614                    else:
 615                        self.valid_parameters = False
 616                        raise ValueError(
 617                            "When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_probability' parameter must have only 2 elements but ({mutation_probability_length}) element(s) found.".format(
 618                                mutation_probability_length=len(mutation_probability)))
 619                else:
 620                    self.valid_parameters = False
 621                    raise TypeError(
 622                        "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_probability' parameter. When mutation_type='adaptive', then list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is expected but ({mutation_probability_value}) of type {mutation_probability_type} found.".format(
 623                            mutation_probability_value=mutation_probability,
 624                            mutation_probability_type=type(mutation_probability)))
 625        else:
 626            pass
 627
 628        # Calculate the value of mutation_num_genes
 629        if not (self.mutation_type is None):
 630            if mutation_num_genes is None:
 631                # The mutation_num_genes parameter does not exist. Checking whether adaptive mutation is used.
 632                if (mutation_type != "adaptive"):
 633                    # The percent of genes to mutate is fixed not adaptive.
 634                    if mutation_percent_genes == 'default'.lower():
 635                        mutation_percent_genes = 10
 636                        # Based on the mutation percentage in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter, the number of genes to mutate is calculated.
 637                        mutation_num_genes = numpy.uint32((mutation_percent_genes * self.num_genes) / 100)
 638                        # Based on the mutation percentage of genes, if the number of selected genes for mutation is less than the least possible value which is 1, then the number will be set to 1.
 639                        if mutation_num_genes == 0:
 640                            if self.mutation_probability is None:
 641                                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 642                                    "The percentage of genes to mutate (mutation_percent_genes={mutation_percent}) resutled in selecting ({mutation_num}) genes. The number of genes to mutate is set to 1 (mutation_num_genes=1).\nIf you do not want to mutate any gene, please set mutation_type=None.".format(
 643                                        mutation_percent=mutation_percent_genes, mutation_num=mutation_num_genes))
 644                            mutation_num_genes = 1
 645
 646                    elif type(mutation_percent_genes) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 647                        if (mutation_percent_genes <= 0 or mutation_percent_genes > 100):
 648                            self.valid_parameters = False
 649                            raise ValueError(
 650                                "The percentage of selected genes for mutation (mutation_percent_genes) must be > 0 and <= 100 but ({mutation_percent_genes}) found.\n".format(
 651                                    mutation_percent_genes=mutation_percent_genes))
 652                        else:
 653                            # If mutation_percent_genes equals the string "default", then it is replaced by the numeric value 10.
 654                            if mutation_percent_genes == 'default'.lower():
 655                                mutation_percent_genes = 10
 656
 657                            # Based on the mutation percentage in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter, the number of genes to mutate is calculated.
 658                            mutation_num_genes = numpy.uint32((mutation_percent_genes * self.num_genes) / 100)
 659                            # Based on the mutation percentage of genes, if the number of selected genes for mutation is less than the least possible value which is 1, then the number will be set to 1.
 660                            if mutation_num_genes == 0:
 661                                if self.mutation_probability is None:
 662                                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 663                                        "The percentage of genes to mutate (mutation_percent_genes={mutation_percent}) resutled in selecting ({mutation_num}) genes. The number of genes to mutate is set to 1 (mutation_num_genes=1).\nIf you do not want to mutate any gene, please set mutation_type=None.".format(
 664                                            mutation_percent=mutation_percent_genes, mutation_num=mutation_num_genes))
 665                                mutation_num_genes = 1
 666                    else:
 667                        self.valid_parameters = False
 668                        raise TypeError(
 669                            "Unexpected value or type of the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter. It only accepts the string 'default' or a numeric value but ({mutation_percent_genes_value}) of type {mutation_percent_genes_type} found.".format(
 670                                mutation_percent_genes_value=mutation_percent_genes,
 671                                mutation_percent_genes_type=type(mutation_percent_genes)))
 672                else:
 673                    # The percent of genes to mutate is adaptive not fixed.
 674                    if type(mutation_percent_genes) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 675                        if len(mutation_percent_genes) == 2:
 676                            mutation_num_genes = numpy.zeros_like(mutation_percent_genes, dtype=numpy.uint32)
 677                            for idx, el in enumerate(mutation_percent_genes):
 678                                if type(el) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
 679                                    if (el <= 0 or el > 100):
 680                                        self.valid_parameters = False
 681                                        raise ValueError(
 682                                            "The values assigned to the 'mutation_percent_genes' must be > 0 and <= 100 but ({mutation_percent_genes}) found.\n".format(
 683                                                mutation_percent_genes=mutation_percent_genes))
 684                                else:
 685                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 686                                    raise TypeError(
 687                                        "Unexpected type for a value assigned to the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter. An integer value is expected but ({mutation_percent_genes_value}) of type {mutation_percent_genes_type} found.".format(
 688                                            mutation_percent_genes_value=el, mutation_percent_genes_type=type(el)))
 689                                # At this point of the loop, the current value assigned to the parameter 'mutation_percent_genes' is validated.
 690                                # Based on the mutation percentage in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter, the number of genes to mutate is calculated.
 691                                mutation_num_genes[idx] = numpy.uint32(
 692                                    (mutation_percent_genes[idx] * self.num_genes) / 100)
 693                                # Based on the mutation percentage of genes, if the number of selected genes for mutation is less than the least possible value which is 1, then the number will be set to 1.
 694                                if mutation_num_genes[idx] == 0:
 695                                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 696                                        "The percentage of genes to mutate ({mutation_percent}) resutled in selecting ({mutation_num}) genes. The number of genes to mutate is set to 1 (mutation_num_genes=1).\nIf you do not want to mutate any gene, please set mutation_type=None.".format(
 697                                            mutation_percent=mutation_percent_genes[idx],
 698                                            mutation_num=mutation_num_genes[idx]))
 699                                    mutation_num_genes[idx] = 1
 700                            if mutation_percent_genes[0] < mutation_percent_genes[1]:
 701                                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 702                                    "The first element in the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter is ({first_el}) which is smaller than the second element ({second_el}).\nThis means the mutation rate for the high-quality solutions is higher than the mutation rate of the low-quality ones. This causes high disruption in the high qualitiy solutions while making little changes in the low quality solutions.\nPlease make the first element higher than the second element.".format(
 703                                        first_el=mutation_percent_genes[0], second_el=mutation_percent_genes[1]))
 704                            # At this point outside the loop, all values of the parameter 'mutation_percent_genes' are validated. Eveyrthing is OK.
 705                        else:
 706                            self.valid_parameters = False
 707                            raise ValueError(
 708                                "When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter must have only 2 elements but ({mutation_percent_genes_length}) element(s) found.".format(
 709                                    mutation_percent_genes_length=len(mutation_percent_genes)))
 710                    else:
 711                        if self.mutation_probability is None:
 712                            self.valid_parameters = False
 713                            raise TypeError(
 714                                "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter. When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_percent_genes' parameter should exist and assigned a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray with 2 values but ({mutation_percent_genes_value}) found.".format(
 715                                    mutation_percent_genes_value=mutation_percent_genes))
 716            # The mutation_num_genes parameter exists. Checking whether adaptive mutation is used.
 717            elif (mutation_type != "adaptive"):
 718                # Number of genes to mutate is fixed not adaptive.
 719                if type(mutation_num_genes) in GA.supported_int_types:
 720                    if (mutation_num_genes <= 0):
 721                        self.valid_parameters = False
 722                        raise ValueError(
 723                            "The number of selected genes for mutation (mutation_num_genes) cannot be <= 0 but ({mutation_num_genes}) found. If you do not want to use mutation, please set mutation_type=None\n".format(
 724                                mutation_num_genes=mutation_num_genes))
 725                    elif (mutation_num_genes > self.num_genes):
 726                        self.valid_parameters = False
 727                        raise ValueError(
 728                            "The number of selected genes for mutation (mutation_num_genes), which is ({mutation_num_genes}), cannot be greater than the number of genes ({num_genes}).\n".format(
 729                                mutation_num_genes=mutation_num_genes, num_genes=self.num_genes))
 730                else:
 731                    self.valid_parameters = False
 732                    raise TypeError(
 733                        "The 'mutation_num_genes' parameter is expected to be a positive integer but the value ({mutation_num_genes_value}) of type {mutation_num_genes_type} found.\n".format(
 734                            mutation_num_genes_value=mutation_num_genes,
 735                            mutation_num_genes_type=type(mutation_num_genes)))
 736            else:
 737                # Number of genes to mutate is adaptive not fixed.
 738                if type(mutation_num_genes) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
 739                    if len(mutation_num_genes) == 2:
 740                        for el in mutation_num_genes:
 741                            if type(el) in GA.supported_int_types:
 742                                if (el <= 0):
 743                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 744                                    raise ValueError(
 745                                        "The values assigned to the 'mutation_num_genes' cannot be <= 0 but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) found. If you do not want to use mutation, please set mutation_type=None\n".format(
 746                                            mutation_num_genes_value=el))
 747                                elif (el > self.num_genes):
 748                                    self.valid_parameters = False
 749                                    raise ValueError(
 750                                        "The values assigned to the 'mutation_num_genes' cannot be greater than the number of genes ({num_genes}) but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) found.\n".format(
 751                                            mutation_num_genes_value=el, num_genes=self.num_genes))
 752                            else:
 753                                self.valid_parameters = False
 754                                raise TypeError(
 755                                    "Unexpected type for a value assigned to the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter. An integer value is expected but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) of type {mutation_num_genes_type} found.".format(
 756                                        mutation_num_genes_value=el, mutation_num_genes_type=type(el)))
 757                            # At this point of the loop, the current value assigned to the parameter 'mutation_num_genes' is validated.
 758                        if mutation_num_genes[0] < mutation_num_genes[1]:
 759                            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 760                                "The first element in the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter is {first_el} which is smaller than the second element {second_el}. This means the mutation rate for the high-quality solutions is higher than the mutation rate of the low-quality ones. This causes high disruption in the high qualitiy solutions while making little changes in the low quality solutions. Please make the first element higher than the second element.".format(
 761                                    first_el=mutation_num_genes[0], second_el=mutation_num_genes[1]))
 762                        # At this point outside the loop, all values of the parameter 'mutation_num_genes' are validated. Eveyrthing is OK.
 763                    else:
 764                        self.valid_parameters = False
 765                        raise ValueError(
