 766                            "When mutation_type='adaptive', then the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter must have only 2 elements but ({mutation_num_genes_length}) element(s) found.".format(
 767                                mutation_num_genes_length=len(mutation_num_genes)))
 768                else:
 769                    self.valid_parameters = False
 770                    raise TypeError(
 771                        "Unexpected type for the 'mutation_num_genes' parameter. When mutation_type='adaptive', then list/tuple/numpy.ndarray is expected but ({mutation_num_genes_value}) of type {mutation_num_genes_type} found.".format(
 772                            mutation_num_genes_value=mutation_num_genes,
 773                            mutation_num_genes_type=type(mutation_num_genes)))
 774        else:
 775            pass
 776
 777        # Validating mutation_by_replacement and mutation_type
 778        if self.mutation_type != "random" and self.mutation_by_replacement:
 779            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 780                "The mutation_by_replacement parameter is set to True while the mutation_type parameter is not set to random but ({mut_type}). Note that the mutation_by_replacement parameter has an effect only when mutation_type='random'.".format(
 781                    mut_type=mutation_type))
 782
 783        # Check if crossover and mutation are both disabled.
 784        if (self.mutation_type is None) and (self.crossover_type is None):
 785            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 786                "The 2 parameters mutation_type and crossover_type are None. This disables any type of evolution the genetic algorithm can make. As a result, the genetic algorithm cannot find a better solution that the best solution in the initial population.")
 787
 788        # select_parents: Refers to a method that selects the parents based on the parent selection type specified in the parent_selection_type attribute.
 789        # Validating the selected type of parent selection: parent_selection_type
 790        if callable(parent_selection_type):
 791            # Check if the parent_selection_type is a function that accepts 3 paramaters.
 792            if (parent_selection_type.__code__.co_argcount == 3):
 793                # population: Added in PyGAD 2.16.0. It should used only to support custom parent selection functions. Otherwise, it should be left to None to retirve the population by self.population.
 794                # The parent selection function assigned to the parent_selection_type parameter is validated.
 795                self.select_parents = parent_selection_type
 796            else:
 797                self.valid_parameters = False
 798                raise ValueError(
 799                    "When 'parent_selection_type' is assigned to a user-defined function, then this parent selection function must accept 3 parameters:\n1) The fitness values of the current population.\n2) The number of parents needed.\n3) The instance from the pygad.GA class to retrieve any property like population, gene data type, gene space, etc.\n\nThe passed parent selection function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 800                        funcname=parent_selection_type.__code__.co_name,
 801                        argcount=parent_selection_type.__code__.co_argcount))
 802        elif not (type(parent_selection_type) is str):
 803            self.valid_parameters = False
 804            raise TypeError(
 805                "The expected type of the 'parent_selection_type' parameter is either callable or str but ({parent_selection_type}) found.".format(
 806                    parent_selection_type=type(parent_selection_type)))
 807        else:
 808            parent_selection_type = parent_selection_type.lower()
 809            if (parent_selection_type == "sss"):
 810                self.select_parents = self.steady_state_selection
 811            elif (parent_selection_type == "rws"):
 812                self.select_parents = self.roulette_wheel_selection
 813            elif (parent_selection_type == "sus"):
 814                self.select_parents = self.stochastic_universal_selection
 815            elif (parent_selection_type == "random"):
 816                self.select_parents = self.random_selection
 817            elif (parent_selection_type == "tournament"):
 818                self.select_parents = self.tournament_selection
 819            elif (parent_selection_type == "rank"):
 820                self.select_parents = self.rank_selection
 821            else:
 822                self.valid_parameters = False
 823                raise TypeError(
 824                    "Undefined parent selection type: {parent_selection_type}. \nThe assigned value to the 'parent_selection_type' parameter does not refer to one of the supported parent selection techniques which are: \n-sss (for steady state selection)\n-rws (for roulette wheel selection)\n-sus (for stochastic universal selection)\n-rank (for rank selection)\n-random (for random selection)\n-tournament (for tournament selection).\n".format(
 825                        parent_selection_type=parent_selection_type))
 826
 827        # For tournament selection, validate the K value.
 828        if (parent_selection_type == "tournament"):
 829            if (K_tournament > self.sol_per_pop):
 830                K_tournament = self.sol_per_pop
 831                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 832                    "K of the tournament selection ({K_tournament}) should not be greater than the number of solutions within the population ({sol_per_pop}).\nK will be clipped to be equal to the number of solutions in the population (sol_per_pop).\n".format(
 833                        K_tournament=K_tournament, sol_per_pop=self.sol_per_pop))
 834            elif (K_tournament <= 0):
 835                self.valid_parameters = False
 836                raise ValueError("K of the tournament selection cannot be <=0 but ({K_tournament}) found.\n".format(
 837                    K_tournament=K_tournament))
 838
 839        self.K_tournament = K_tournament
 840
 841        # Validating the number of parents to keep in the next population: keep_parents
 842        if not (type(keep_parents) in GA.supported_int_types):
 843            self.valid_parameters = False
 844            raise TypeError(
 845                "Incorrect type of the value assigned to the keep_parents parameter. The value {keep_parents} of type {keep_parents_type} found but an integer is expected.".format(
 846                    keep_parents=keep_parents, keep_parents_type=type(keep_parents)))
 847        elif (keep_parents > self.sol_per_pop or keep_parents > self.num_parents_mating or keep_parents < -1):
 848            self.valid_parameters = False
 849            raise ValueError(
 850                "Incorrect value to the keep_parents parameter: {keep_parents}. \nThe assigned value to the keep_parent parameter must satisfy the following conditions: \n1) Less than or equal to sol_per_pop\n2) Less than or equal to num_parents_mating\n3) Greater than or equal to -1.".format(
 851                    keep_parents=keep_parents))
 852
 853        self.keep_parents = keep_parents
 854
 855        if parent_selection_type == "sss" and self.keep_parents == 0:
 856            if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
 857                "The steady-state parent (sss) selection operator is used despite that no parents are kept in the next generation.")
 858
 859        # Validating the number of elitism to keep in the next population: keep_elitism
 860        if not (type(keep_elitism) in GA.supported_int_types):
 861            self.valid_parameters = False
 862            raise TypeError(
 863                "Incorrect type of the value assigned to the keep_elitism parameter. The value {keep_elitism} of type {keep_elitism_type} found but an integer is expected.".format(
 864                    keep_elitism=keep_elitism, keep_elitism_type=type(keep_elitism)))
 865        elif (keep_elitism > self.sol_per_pop or keep_elitism < 0):
 866            self.valid_parameters = False
 867            raise ValueError(
 868                "Incorrect value to the keep_elitism parameter: {keep_elitism}. \nThe assigned value to the keep_elitism parameter must satisfy the following conditions: \n1) Less than or equal to sol_per_pop\n2) Greater than or equal to 0.".format(
 869                    keep_elitism=keep_elitism))
 870
 871        self.keep_elitism = keep_elitism
 872
 873        # Validate keep_parents.
 874        if self.keep_elitism == 0:
 875            if (self.keep_parents == -1):  # Keep all parents in the next population.
 876                self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop - self.num_parents_mating
 877            elif (self.keep_parents == 0):  # Keep no parents in the next population.
 878                self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop
 879            elif (self.keep_parents > 0):  # Keep the specified number of parents in the next population.
 880                self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop - self.keep_parents
 881        else:
 882            self.num_offspring = self.sol_per_pop - self.keep_elitism
 883
 884        # Check if the fitness_func is a function.
 885        if callable(fitness_func):
 886            # Check if the fitness function accepts 2 paramaters.
 887            if (fitness_func.__code__.co_argcount >= 2):
 888                self.fitness_func = fitness_func
 889            else:
 890                self.valid_parameters = False
 891                raise ValueError(
 892                    "The fitness function must accept 2 parameters:\n1) A solution to calculate its fitness value.\n2) The solution's index within the population.\n\nThe passed fitness function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 893                        funcname=fitness_func.__code__.co_name, argcount=fitness_func.__code__.co_argcount))
 894        else:
 895            self.valid_parameters = False
 896            raise TypeError(
 897                "The value assigned to the fitness_func parameter is expected to be of type function but ({fitness_func_type}) found.".format(
 898                    fitness_func_type=type(fitness_func)))
 899
 900        self.args = args
 901
 902        # Check if the on_start exists.
 903        if not (on_start is None):
 904            # Check if the on_start is a function.
 905            if callable(on_start):
 906                # Check if the on_start function accepts only a single paramater.
 907                if (on_start.__code__.co_argcount == 1):
 908                    self.on_start = on_start
 909                else:
 910                    self.valid_parameters = False
 911                    raise ValueError(
 912                        "The function assigned to the on_start parameter must accept only 1 parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 913                            funcname=on_start.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_start.__code__.co_argcount))
 914            else:
 915                self.valid_parameters = False
 916                raise TypeError(
 917                    "The value assigned to the on_start parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_start_type}) found.".format(
 918                        on_start_type=type(on_start)))
 919        else:
 920            self.on_start = None
 921
 922        # Check if the on_fitness exists.
 923        if not (on_fitness is None):
 924            # Check if the on_fitness is a function.
 925            if callable(on_fitness):
 926                # Check if the on_fitness function accepts 2 paramaters.
 927                if (on_fitness.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 928                    self.on_fitness = on_fitness
 929                else:
 930                    self.valid_parameters = False
 931                    raise ValueError(
 932                        "The function assigned to the on_fitness parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the fitness values of all solutions.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 933                            funcname=on_fitness.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_fitness.__code__.co_argcount))
 934            else:
 935                self.valid_parameters = False
 936                raise TypeError(
 937                    "The value assigned to the on_fitness parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_fitness_type}) found.".format(
 938                        on_fitness_type=type(on_fitness)))
 939        else:
 940            self.on_fitness = None
 941
 942        # Check if the on_parents exists.
 943        if not (on_parents is None):
 944            # Check if the on_parents is a function.
 945            if callable(on_parents):
 946                # Check if the on_parents function accepts 2 paramaters.
 947                if (on_parents.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 948                    self.on_parents = on_parents
 949                else:
 950                    self.valid_parameters = False
 951                    raise ValueError(
 952                        "The function assigned to the on_parents parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the fitness values of all solutions.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 953                            funcname=on_parents.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_parents.__code__.co_argcount))
 954            else:
 955                self.valid_parameters = False
 956                raise TypeError(
 957                    "The value assigned to the on_parents parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_parents_type}) found.".format(
 958                        on_parents_type=type(on_parents)))
 959        else:
 960            self.on_parents = None
 961
 962        # Check if the on_crossover exists.
 963        if not (on_crossover is None):
 964            # Check if the on_crossover is a function.
 965            if callable(on_crossover):
 966                # Check if the on_crossover function accepts 2 paramaters.
 967                if (on_crossover.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 968                    self.on_crossover = on_crossover
 969                else:
 970                    self.valid_parameters = False
 971                    raise ValueError(
 972                        "The function assigned to the on_crossover parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the offspring generated using crossover.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 973                            funcname=on_crossover.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_crossover.__code__.co_argcount))
 974            else:
 975                self.valid_parameters = False
 976                raise TypeError(
 977                    "The value assigned to the on_crossover parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_crossover_type}) found.".format(
 978                        on_crossover_type=type(on_crossover)))
 979        else:
 980            self.on_crossover = None
 981
 982        # Check if the on_mutation exists.
 983        if not (on_mutation is None):
 984            # Check if the on_mutation is a function.
 985            if callable(on_mutation):
 986                # Check if the on_mutation function accepts 2 paramaters.
 987                if (on_mutation.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
 988                    self.on_mutation = on_mutation
 989                else:
 990                    self.valid_parameters = False
 991                    raise ValueError(
 992                        "The function assigned to the on_mutation parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and the offspring after applying the mutation operation.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
 993                            funcname=on_mutation.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_mutation.__code__.co_argcount))
 994            else:
 995                self.valid_parameters = False
 996                raise TypeError(
 997                    "The value assigned to the on_mutation parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_mutation_type}) found.".format(
 998                        on_mutation_type=type(on_mutation)))
 999        else:
1000            self.on_mutation = None
1001
1002        # Check if the callback_generation exists.
1003        if not (callback_generation is None):
1004            # Check if the callback_generation is a function.
1005            if callable(callback_generation):
1006                # Check if the callback_generation function accepts only a single paramater.
1007                if (callback_generation.__code__.co_argcount == 1):
1008                    self.callback_generation = callback_generation
1009                    on_generation = callback_generation
1010                    if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
1011                        "Starting from PyGAD 2.6.0, the callback_generation parameter is deprecated and will be removed in a later release of PyGAD. Please use the on_generation parameter instead.")
1012                else:
1013                    self.valid_parameters = False
1014                    raise ValueError(
1015                        "The function assigned to the callback_generation parameter must accept only 1 parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
1016                            funcname=callback_generation.__code__.co_name,
1017                            argcount=callback_generation.__code__.co_argcount))
1018            else:
1019                self.valid_parameters = False
1020                raise TypeError(
1021                    "The value assigned to the callback_generation parameter is expected to be of type function but ({callback_generation_type}) found.".format(
1022                        callback_generation_type=type(callback_generation)))
1023        else:
1024            self.callback_generation = None
1025
1026        # Check if the on_generation exists.
1027        if not (on_generation is None):
1028            # Check if the on_generation is a function.
1029            if callable(on_generation):
1030                # Check if the on_generation function accepts only a single paramater.
1031                if (on_generation.__code__.co_argcount == 1):
1032                    self.on_generation = on_generation
1033                else:
1034                    self.valid_parameters = False
1035                    raise ValueError(
1036                        "The function assigned to the on_generation parameter must accept only 1 parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
1037                            funcname=on_generation.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_generation.__code__.co_argcount))
1038            else:
1039                self.valid_parameters = False
1040                raise TypeError(
1041                    "The value assigned to the on_generation parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_generation_type}) found.".format(
1042                        on_generation_type=type(on_generation)))
1043        else:
1044            self.on_generation = None
1045
1046        # Check if the on_stop exists.
1047        if not (on_stop is None):
1048            # Check if the on_stop is a function.
1049            if callable(on_stop):
1050                # Check if the on_stop function accepts 2 paramaters.
1051                if (on_stop.__code__.co_argcount == 2):
1052                    self.on_stop = on_stop
1053                else:
1054                    self.valid_parameters = False
1055                    raise ValueError(
1056                        "The function assigned to the on_stop parameter must accept 2 parameters representing the instance of the genetic algorithm and a list of the fitness values of the solutions in the last population.\nThe passed function named '{funcname}' accepts {argcount} parameter(s).".format(
1057                            funcname=on_stop.__code__.co_name, argcount=on_stop.__code__.co_argcount))
1058            else:
1059                self.valid_parameters = False
1060                raise TypeError(
1061                    "The value assigned to the 'on_stop' parameter is expected to be of type function but ({on_stop_type}) found.".format(
1062                        on_stop_type=type(on_stop)))
1063        else:
1064            self.on_stop = None
1065
1066        # Validate delay_after_gen
1067        if type(delay_after_gen) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1068            if delay_after_gen >= 0.0:
1069                self.delay_after_gen = delay_after_gen
1070            else:
1071                self.valid_parameters = False
1072                raise ValueError(
1073                    "The value passed to the 'delay_after_gen' parameter must be a non-negative number. The value passed is {delay_after_gen} of type {delay_after_gen_type}.".format(
1074                        delay_after_gen=delay_after_gen, delay_after_gen_type=type(delay_after_gen)))
1075        else:
1076            self.valid_parameters = False
1077            raise TypeError(
1078                "The value passed to the 'delay_after_gen' parameter must be of type int or float but ({delay_after_gen_type}) found.".format(
1079                    delay_after_gen_type=type(delay_after_gen)))
1080
1081        # Validate save_best_solutions
1082        if type(save_best_solutions) is bool:
1083            if save_best_solutions == True:
1084                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
1085                    "Use the 'save_best_solutions' parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations or number of genes is large.")
1086        else:
1087            self.valid_parameters = False
1088            raise TypeError(
1089                "The value passed to the 'save_best_solutions' parameter must be of type bool but ({save_best_solutions_type}) found.".format(
1090                    save_best_solutions_type=type(save_best_solutions)))
1091
1092        # Validate save_solutions
1093        if type(save_solutions) is bool:
1094            if save_solutions == True:
1095                if not self.suppress_warnings: warnings.warn(
1096                    "Use the 'save_solutions' parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations, number of genes, or number of solutions in population is large.")
1097        else:
1098            self.valid_parameters = False
1099            raise TypeError(
1100                "The value passed to the 'save_solutions' parameter must be of type bool but ({save_solutions_type}) found.".format(
1101                    save_solutions_type=type(save_solutions)))
1102
1103        # Validate allow_duplicate_genes
1104        if not (type(allow_duplicate_genes) is bool):
1105            self.valid_parameters = False
1106            raise TypeError(
1107                "The expected type of the 'allow_duplicate_genes' parameter is bool but ({allow_duplicate_genes_type}) found.".format(
1108                    allow_duplicate_genes_type=type(allow_duplicate_genes)))
1109
1110        self.allow_duplicate_genes = allow_duplicate_genes
1111
1112        self.stop_criteria = []
1113        self.supported_stop_words = ["reach", "saturate"]
1114        if stop_criteria is None:
1115            # None: Stop after passing through all generations.
1116            self.stop_criteria = None
1117        elif type(stop_criteria) is str:
1118            # reach_{target_fitness}: Stop if the target fitness value is reached.
1119            # saturate_{num_generations}: Stop if the fitness value does not change (saturates) for the given number of generations.
1120            criterion = stop_criteria.split("_")
1121            if len(criterion) == 2:
1122                stop_word = criterion[0]
1123                number = criterion[1]
1124
1125                if stop_word in self.supported_stop_words:
1126                    pass
1127                else:
1128                    self.valid_parameters = False
1129                    raise ValueError(
1130                        "In the 'stop_criteria' parameter, the supported stop words are '{supported_stop_words}' but '{stop_word}' found.".format(
1131                            supported_stop_words=self.supported_stop_words, stop_word=stop_word))
1132
1133                if number.replace(".", "").isnumeric():
1134                    number = float(number)
1135                else:
1136                    self.valid_parameters = False
1137                    raise ValueError(
1138                        "The value following the stop word in the 'stop_criteria' parameter must be a number but the value '{stop_val}' of type {stop_val_type} found.".format(
1139                            stop_val=number, stop_val_type=type(number)))
1140
1141                self.stop_criteria.append([stop_word, number, ftol_abs])
1142
1143            else:
1144                self.valid_parameters = False
1145                raise ValueError(
1146                    "For format of a single criterion in the 'stop_criteria' parameter is 'word_number' but '{stop_criteria}' found.".format(
1147                        stop_criteria=stop_criteria))
1148
1149        elif type(stop_criteria) in [list, tuple, numpy.ndarray]:
1150            # Remove duplicate criterira by converting the list to a set then back to a list.
1151            stop_criteria = list(set(stop_criteria))
1152            for idx, val in enumerate(stop_criteria):
1153                if type(val) is str:
1154                    criterion = val.split("_")
1155                    if len(criterion) == 2:
1156                        stop_word = criterion[0]
1157                        number = criterion[1]
1158
1159                        if stop_word in self.supported_stop_words:
1160                            pass
1161                        else:
1162                            self.valid_parameters = False
1163                            raise ValueError(
1164                                "In the 'stop_criteria' parameter, the supported stop words are {supported_stop_words} but '{stop_word}' found.".format(
1165                                    supported_stop_words=self.supported_stop_words, stop_word=stop_word))
1166
1167                        if number.replace(".", "").isnumeric():
1168                            number = float(number)
1169                        else:
1170                            self.valid_parameters = False
1171                            raise ValueError(
1172                                "The value following the stop word in the 'stop_criteria' parameter must be a number but the value '{stop_val}' of type {stop_val_type} found.".format(
1173                                    stop_val=number, stop_val_type=type(number)))
1174
1175                        self.stop_criteria.append([stop_word, number, ftol_abs])
1176
1177                    else:
1178                        self.valid_parameters = False
1179                        raise ValueError(
1180                            "The format of a single criterion in the 'stop_criteria' parameter is 'word_number' but {stop_criteria} found.".format(
1181                                stop_criteria=criterion))
1182                else:
1183                    self.valid_parameters = False
1184                    raise TypeError(
1185                        "When the 'stop_criteria' parameter is assigned a tuple/list/numpy.ndarray, then its elements must be strings but the value '{stop_criteria_val}' of type {stop_criteria_val_type} found at index {stop_criteria_val_idx}.".format(
1186                            stop_criteria_val=val, stop_criteria_val_type=type(val), stop_criteria_val_idx=idx))
1187        else:
1188            self.valid_parameters = False
1189            raise TypeError(
1190                "The expected value of the 'stop_criteria' is a single string or a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of strings but the value {stop_criteria_val} of type {stop_criteria_type} found.".format(
1191                    stop_criteria_val=stop_criteria, stop_criteria_type=type(stop_criteria)))
1192
1193        if parallel_processing is None:
1194            self.parallel_processing = None
1195        elif type(parallel_processing) in GA.supported_int_types:
1196            if parallel_processing > 0:
1197                self.parallel_processing = ["thread", parallel_processing]
1198            else:
1199                self.valid_parameters = False
1200                raise ValueError(
1201                    "When the 'parallel_processing' parameter is assigned an integer, then the integer must be positive but the value ({parallel_processing_value}) found.".format(
1202                        parallel_processing_value=parallel_processing))
1203        elif type(parallel_processing) in [list, tuple]:
1204            if len(parallel_processing) == 2:
1205                if type(parallel_processing[0]) is str:
1206                    if parallel_processing[0] in ["process", "thread"]:
1207                        if (type(parallel_processing[1]) in GA.supported_int_types and parallel_processing[1] > 0) or (
1208                                parallel_processing[1] == 0) or (parallel_processing[1] is None):
1209                            if parallel_processing[1] == 0:
1210                                # If the number of processes/threads is 0, this means no parallel processing is used. It is equivelant to setting parallel_processing=None.
1211                                self.parallel_processing = None
1212                            else:
1213                                # Whether the second value is None or a positive integer.
1214                                self.parallel_processing = parallel_processing
1215                        else:
1216                            self.valid_parameters = False
1217                            raise TypeError(
1218                                "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then the second element must be an integer but the value ({second_value}) of type ({second_value_type}) found.".format(
1219                                    second_value=parallel_processing[1],
1220                                    second_value_type=type(parallel_processing[1])))
1221                    else:
1222                        self.valid_parameters = False
1223                        raise ValueError(
1224                            "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then the value of the first element must be either 'process' or 'thread' but the value ({first_value}) found.".format(
1225                                first_value=parallel_processing[0]))
1226                else:
1227                    self.valid_parameters = False
1228                    raise TypeError(
1229                        "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then the first element must be of type 'str' but the value ({first_value}) of type ({first_value_type}) found.".format(
1230                            first_value=parallel_processing[0], first_value_type=type(parallel_processing[0])))
1231            else:
1232                self.valid_parameters = False
1233                raise ValueError(
1234                    "When a list or tuple is assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter, then it must have 2 elements but ({num_elements}) found.".format(
1235                        num_elements=len(parallel_processing)))
1236        else:
1237            self.valid_parameters = False
1238            raise ValueError(
1239                "Unexpected value ({parallel_processing_value}) of type ({parallel_processing_type}) assigned to the 'parallel_processing' parameter. The accepted values for this parameter are:\n1) None: (Default) It means no parallel processing is used.\n2) A positive integer referring to the number of threads to be used (i.e. threads, not processes, are used.\n3) list/tuple: If a list or a tuple of exactly 2 elements is assigned, then:\n\t*1) The first element can be either 'process' or 'thread' to specify whether processes or threads are used, respectively.\n\t*2) The second element can be:\n\t\t**1) A positive integer to select the maximum number of processes or threads to be used.\n\t\t**2) 0 to indicate that parallel processing is not used. This is identical to setting 'parallel_processing=None'.\n\t\t**3) None to use the default value as calculated by the concurrent.futures module.".format(
1240                    parallel_processing_value=parallel_processing, parallel_processing_type=type(parallel_processing)))
1241
1242        self._pool = None
1243
1244        # Set the `run_completed` property to False. It is set to `True` only after the `run()` method is complete.
1245        self.run_completed = False
1246
1247        # The number of completed generations.
1248        self.generations_completed = 0
1249
1250        # At this point, all necessary parameters validation is done successfully and we are sure that the parameters are valid.
1251        self.valid_parameters = True  # Set to True when all the parameters passed in the GA class constructor are valid.
1252
1253        # Parameters of the genetic algorithm.
1254        self.num_generations = abs(num_generations)
1255        self.parent_selection_type = parent_selection_type
1256
1257        # Parameters of the mutation operation.
1258        self.mutation_percent_genes = mutation_percent_genes
1259        self.mutation_num_genes = mutation_num_genes
1260
1261        # Even such this parameter is declared in the class header, it is assigned to the object here to access it after saving the object.
1262        self.best_solutions_fitness = []  # A list holding the fitness value of the best solution for each generation.
1263
1264        self.best_solution_generation = -1  # The generation number at which the best fitness value is reached. It is only assigned the generation number after the `run()` method completes. Otherwise, its value is -1.
1265
1266        self.save_best_solutions = save_best_solutions
1267        self.best_solutions = []  # Holds the best solution in each generation.
1268
1269        self.save_solutions = save_solutions
1270        self.solutions = []  # Holds the solutions in each generation.
1271        self.solutions_fitness = []  # Holds the fitness of the solutions in each generation.
1272
1273        self.last_generation_fitness = None  # A list holding the fitness values of all solutions in the last generation.
1274        self.last_generation_parents = None  # A list holding the parents of the last generation.
1275        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = None  # A list holding the offspring after applying crossover in the last generation.
1276        self.last_generation_offspring_mutation = None  # A list holding the offspring after applying mutation in the last generation.
1277        self.previous_generation_fitness = None  # Holds the fitness values of one generation before the fitness values saved in the last_generation_fitness attribute. Added in PyGAD 2.26.2
1278        self.last_generation_elitism = None  # Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. A NumPy array holding the elitism in the current generation according to the value passed in the keep_elitism parameter.

The constructor of the GA class accepts all parameters required to create an instance of the GA class. It validates such parameters.

num_generations: Number of generations. num_parents_mating: Number of solutions to be selected as parents in the mating pool.

fitness_func: Accepts a function that must accept 2 parameters (a single solution and its index in the population) and return the fitness value of the solution. Available starting from PyGAD 1.0.17 until 1.0.20 with a single parameter representing the solution. Changed in PyGAD 2.0.0 and higher to include the second parameter representing the solution index.

initial_population: A user-defined initial population. It is useful when the user wants to start the generations with a custom initial population. It defaults to None which means no initial population is specified by the user. In this case, PyGAD creates an initial population using the 'sol_per_pop' and 'num_genes' parameters. An exception is raised if the 'initial_population' is None while any of the 2 parameters ('sol_per_pop' or 'num_genes') is also None. sol_per_pop: Number of solutions in the population. num_genes: Number of parameters in the function.

init_range_low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher. init_range_high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.

It is OK to set the value of any of the 2 parameters ('init_range_low' and 'init_range_high') to be equal, higher or lower than the other parameter (i.e. init_range_low is not needed to be lower than init_range_high).

gene_type: The type of the gene. It is assigned to any of these types (int, float, numpy.int, numpy.int8, numpy.int16, numpy.int32, numpy.int64, numpy.uint, numpy.uint8, numpy.uint16, numpy.uint32, numpy.uint64, numpy.float, numpy.float16, numpy.float32, numpy.float64) and forces all the genes to be of that type.

parent_selection_type: Type of parent selection. keep_parents: If 0, this means no parent in the current population will be used in the next population. If -1, this means all parents in the current population will be used in the next population. If set to a value > 0, then the specified value refers to the number of parents in the current population to be used in the next population. Some parent selection operators such as rank selection, favor population diversity and therefore keeping the parents in the next generation can be beneficial. However, some other parent selection operators, such as roulette wheel selection (RWS), have higher selection pressure and keeping more than one parent in the next generation can seriously harm population diversity. This parameter have an effect only when the keep_elitism parameter is 0. Thanks to Prof. Fernando Jimnez Barrionuevo (http://webs.um.es/fernan) for editing this sentence. K_tournament: When the value of 'parent_selection_type' is 'tournament', the 'K_tournament' parameter specifies the number of solutions from which a parent is selected randomly.

keep_elitism: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It can take the value 0 or a positive integer that satisfies (0 <= keep_elitism <= sol_per_pop). It defaults to 1 which means only the best solution in the current generation is kept in the next generation. If assigned 0, this means it has no effect. If assigned a positive integer K, then the best K solutions are kept in the next generation. It cannot be assigned a value greater than the value assigned to the sol_per_pop parameter. If this parameter has a value different than 0, then the keep_parents parameter will have no effect.

crossover_type: Type of the crossover opreator. If crossover_type=None, then the crossover step is bypassed which means no crossover is applied and thus no offspring will be created in the next generations. The next generation will use the solutions in the current population. crossover_probability: The probability of selecting a solution for the crossover operation. If the solution probability is <= crossover_probability, the solution is selected. The value must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

mutation_type: Type of the mutation opreator. If mutation_type=None, then the mutation step is bypassed which means no mutation is applied and thus no changes are applied to the offspring created using the crossover operation. The offspring will be used unchanged in the next generation. mutation_probability: The probability of selecting a gene for the mutation operation. If the gene probability is <= mutation_probability, the gene is selected. It accepts either a single value for fixed mutation or a list/tuple/numpy.ndarray of 2 values for adaptive mutation. The values must be between 0 and 1 inclusive. If specified, then no need for the 2 parameters mutation_percent_genes and mutation_num_genes.

mutation_by_replacement: An optional bool parameter. It works only when the selected type of mutation is random (mutation_type="random"). In this case, setting mutation_by_replacement=True means replace the gene by the randomly generated value. If False, then it has no effect and random mutation works by adding the random value to the gene.

mutation_percent_genes: Percentage of genes to mutate which defaults to the string 'default' which means 10%. This parameter has no action if any of the 2 parameters mutation_probability or mutation_num_genes exist. mutation_num_genes: Number of genes to mutate which defaults to None. If the parameter mutation_num_genes exists, then no need for the parameter mutation_percent_genes. This parameter has no action if the mutation_probability parameter exists. random_mutation_min_val: The minimum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to -1.0. random_mutation_max_val: The maximum value of the range from which a random value is selected to be added to the selected gene(s) to mutate. It defaults to 1.0.

gene_space: It accepts a list of all possible values of the gene. This list is used in the mutation step. Should be used only if the gene space is a set of discrete values. No need for the 2 parameters (random_mutation_min_val and random_mutation_max_val) if the parameter gene_space exists. Added in PyGAD 2.5.0. In PyGAD 2.11.0, the gene_space can be assigned a dict.

on_start: Accepts a function to be called only once before the genetic algorithm starts its evolution. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0. on_fitness: Accepts a function to be called after calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the population. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of all solutions' fitness values. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0. on_parents: Accepts a function to be called after selecting the parents that mates. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the selected parents. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0. on_crossover: Accepts a function to be called each time the crossover operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring generated using crossover. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0. on_mutation: Accepts a function to be called each time the mutation operation is applied. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one represents the offspring after applying the mutation. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0. callback_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Starting from PyGAD 2.6.0, the callback_generation parameter is deprecated and should be replaced by the on_generation parameter. on_generation: Accepts a function to be called after each generation. This function must accept a single parameter representing the instance of the genetic algorithm. If the function returned "stop", then the run() method stops without completing the other generations. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0. on_stop: Accepts a function to be called only once exactly before the genetic algorithm stops or when it completes all the generations. This function must accept 2 parameters: the first one represents the instance of the genetic algorithm and the second one is a list of fitness values of the last population's solutions. Added in PyGAD 2.6.0.

delay_after_gen: Added in PyGAD 2.4.0. It accepts a non-negative number specifying the number of seconds to wait after a generation completes and before going to the next generation. It defaults to 0.0 which means no delay after the generation.

save_best_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.9.0 and its type is bool. If True, then the best solution in each generation is saved into the 'best_solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations or the number of genes is large. save_solutions: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0 and its type is bool. If True, then all solutions in each generation are saved into the 'solutions' attribute. Use this parameter with caution as it may cause memory overflow when either the number of generations, number of genes, or number of solutions in population is large.

suppress_warnings: Added in PyGAD 2.10.0 and its type is bool. If True, then no warning messages will be displayed. It defaults to False.

allow_duplicate_genes: Added in PyGAD 2.13.0. If True, then a solution/chromosome may have duplicate gene values. If False, then each gene will have a unique value in its solution.

stop_criteria: Added in PyGAD 2.15.0. It is assigned to some criteria to stop the evolution if at least one criterion holds.

parallel_processing: Added in PyGAD 2.17.0. Defaults to None which means no parallel processing is used. If a positive integer is assigned, it specifies the number of threads to be used. If a list or a tuple of exactly 2 elements is assigned, then: 1) The first element can be either "process" or "thread" to specify whether processes or threads are used, respectively. 2) The second element can be: 1) A positive integer to select the maximum number of processes or threads to be used. 2) 0 to indicate that parallel processing is not used. This is identical to setting 'parallel_processing=None'. 3) None to use the default value as calculated by the concurrent.futures module.

random_seed: Added in PyGAD 2.18.0. It defines the random seed to be used by the random function generators (we use random functions in the NumPy and random modules). This helps to reproduce the same results by setting the same random seed.

supported_int_types = [<class 'int'>, <class 'numpy.int8'>, <class 'numpy.int16'>, <class 'numpy.int32'>, <class 'numpy.int64'>, <class 'numpy.uint64'>, <class 'numpy.uint8'>, <class 'numpy.uint16'>, <class 'numpy.uint32'>, <class 'numpy.uint64'>]
supported_float_types = [<class 'float'>, <class 'numpy.float16'>, <class 'numpy.float32'>, <class 'numpy.float64'>]
supported_int_float_types = [<class 'int'>, <class 'numpy.int8'>, <class 'numpy.int16'>, <class 'numpy.int32'>, <class 'numpy.int64'>, <class 'numpy.uint64'>, <class 'numpy.uint8'>, <class 'numpy.uint16'>, <class 'numpy.uint32'>, <class 'numpy.uint64'>, <class 'float'>, <class 'numpy.float16'>, <class 'numpy.float32'>, <class 'numpy.float64'>]
random_seed

random_mutation_min_val
random_mutation_max_val

mutation_percent_genes

def round_genes(self, solutions): 
1280    def round_genes(self, solutions):
1281        for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1282            if self.gene_type_single:
1283                if not self.gene_type[1] is None:
1284                    solutions[:, gene_idx] = numpy.round(solutions[:, gene_idx], self.gene_type[1])
1285            else:
1286                if not self.gene_type[gene_idx][1] is None:
1287                    solutions[:, gene_idx] = numpy.round(numpy.asarray(solutions[:, gene_idx],
1288                                                                       dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0]),
1289                                                         self.gene_type[gene_idx][1])
1290        return solutions
def initialize_population( self, low, high, allow_duplicate_genes, mutation_by_replacement, gene_type): 
1292    def initialize_population(self, low, high, allow_duplicate_genes, mutation_by_replacement, gene_type):
1293
1294        """
1295        Creates an initial population randomly as a NumPy array. The array is saved in the instance attribute named 'population'.
1296
1297        low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher.
1298        high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.
1299
1300        This method assigns the values of the following 3 instance attributes:
1301            1. pop_size: Size of the population.
1302            2. population: Initially, holds the initial population and later updated after each generation.
1303            3. init_population: Keeping the initial population.
1304        """
1305
1306        # Population size = (number of chromosomes, number of genes per chromosome)
1307        self.pop_size = (self.sol_per_pop,
1308                         self.num_genes)  # The population will have sol_per_pop chromosome where each chromosome has num_genes genes.
1309
1310        if self.gene_space is None:
1311            # Creating the initial population randomly.
1312            if self.gene_type_single == True:
1313                self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1314                                                                     high=high,
1315                                                                     size=self.pop_size),
1316                                                dtype=self.gene_type[
1317                                                    0])  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
1318            else:
1319                # Create an empty population of dtype=object to support storing mixed data types within the same array.
1320                self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1321                # Loop through the genes, randomly generate the values of a single gene across the entire population, and add the values of each gene to the population.
1322                for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1323                    # A vector of all values of this single gene across all solutions in the population.
1324                    gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1325                                                                     high=high,
1326                                                                     size=self.pop_size[0]),
1327                                                dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1328                    # Adding the current gene values to the population.
1329                    self.population[:, gene_idx] = gene_values
1330
1331            if allow_duplicate_genes == False:
1332                for solution_idx in range(self.population.shape[0]):
1333                    # print("Before", self.population[solution_idx])
1334                    self.population[solution_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_randomly(
1335                        solution=self.population[solution_idx],
1336                        min_val=low,
1337                        max_val=high,
1338                        mutation_by_replacement=True,
1339                        gene_type=gene_type,
1340                        num_trials=10)
1341                    # print("After", self.population[solution_idx])
1342
1343        elif self.gene_space_nested:
1344            if self.gene_type_single == True:
1345                self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1346                for sol_idx in range(self.sol_per_pop):
1347                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1348                        if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [list, tuple, range]:
1349                            # Check if the gene space has None values. If any, then replace it with randomly generated values according to the 3 attributes init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type.
1350                            if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) is range:
1351                                temp = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
1352                            else:
1353                                temp = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1354                            for idx, val in enumerate(self.gene_space[gene_idx]):
1355                                if val is None:
1356                                    self.gene_space[gene_idx][idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1357                                                                                                        high=high,
1358                                                                                                        size=1),
1359                                                                                   dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1360                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = random.choice(self.gene_space[gene_idx])
1361                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[0](self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx])
1362                            self.gene_space[gene_idx] = temp
1363                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) is dict:
1364                            if 'step' in self.gene_space[gene_idx].keys():
1365                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1366                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1367                                                                               stop=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1368                                                                               step=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['step']),
1369                                                                  size=1),
1370                                              dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1371                            else:
1372                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1373                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1374                                                                   high=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1375                                                                   size=1),
1376                                              dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1377                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) == type(None):
1378
1379                            # The following commented code replace the None value with a single number that will not change again.
1380                            # This means the gene value will be the same across all solutions.
1381                            # self.gene_space[gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1382                            #                high=high,
1383                            #                size=1), dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1384                            # self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1385
1386                            # The above problem is solved by keeping the None value in the gene_space parameter. This forces PyGAD to generate this value for each solution.
1387                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1388                                                                                                    high=high,
1389                                                                                                    size=1),
1390                                                                               dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1391                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1392                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
1393            else:
1394                self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1395                for sol_idx in range(self.sol_per_pop):
1396                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1397                        if type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in [list, tuple, range]:
1398                            # Check if the gene space has None values. If any, then replace it with randomly generated values according to the 3 attributes init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type.
1399                            temp = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1400                            for idx, val in enumerate(self.gene_space[gene_idx]):
1401                                if val is None:
1402                                    self.gene_space[gene_idx][idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1403                                                                                                        high=high,
1404                                                                                                        size=1),
1405                                                                                   dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1406                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = random.choice(self.gene_space[gene_idx])
1407                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_type[gene_idx][0](
1408                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx])
1409                            self.gene_space[gene_idx] = temp.copy()
1410                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) is dict:
1411                            if 'step' in self.gene_space[gene_idx].keys():
1412                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1413                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1414                                                                               stop=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1415                                                                               step=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['step']),
1416                                                                  size=1),
1417                                              dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1418                            else:
1419                                self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = \
1420                                numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1421                                                                   high=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1422                                                                   size=1),
1423                                              dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1424                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) == type(None):
1425                            # self.gene_space[gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1426                            #                                                                high=high,
1427                            #                                                                size=1),
1428                            #                                           dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1429
1430                            # self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx].copy()
1431
1432                            temp = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1433                                                                      high=high,
1434                                                                      size=1),
1435                                                 dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1436                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = temp
1437                        elif type(self.gene_space[gene_idx]) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1438                            self.population[sol_idx, gene_idx] = self.gene_space[gene_idx]
1439        else:
1440            if self.gene_type_single == True:
1441                # Replace all the None values with random values using the init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type attributes.
1442                for idx, curr_gene_space in enumerate(self.gene_space):
1443                    if curr_gene_space is None:
1444                        self.gene_space[idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1445                                                                                  high=high,
1446                                                                                  size=1),
1447                                                             dtype=self.gene_type[0])[0]
1448
1449                # Creating the initial population by randomly selecting the genes' values from the values inside the 'gene_space' parameter.
1450                if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
1451                    if 'step' in self.gene_space.keys():
1452                        self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space['low'],
1453                                                                                         stop=self.gene_space['high'],
1454                                                                                         step=self.gene_space['step']),
1455                                                                            size=self.pop_size),
1456                                                        dtype=self.gene_type[0])
1457                    else:
1458                        self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
1459                                                                             high=self.gene_space['high'],
1460                                                                             size=self.pop_size),
1461                                                        dtype=self.gene_type[
1462                                                            0])  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
1463                else:
1464                    self.population = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(self.gene_space,
1465                                                                        size=self.pop_size),
1466                                                    dtype=self.gene_type[
1467                                                        0])  # A NumPy array holding the initial population.
1468            else:
1469                # Replace all the None values with random values using the init_range_low, init_range_high, and gene_type attributes.
1470                for gene_idx, curr_gene_space in enumerate(self.gene_space):
1471                    if curr_gene_space is None:
1472                        self.gene_space[gene_idx] = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=low,
1473                                                                                       high=high,
1474                                                                                       size=1),
1475                                                                  dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])[0]
1476
1477                # Creating the initial population by randomly selecting the genes' values from the values inside the 'gene_space' parameter.
1478                if type(self.gene_space) is dict:
1479                    # Create an empty population of dtype=object to support storing mixed data types within the same array.
1480                    self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1481                    # Loop through the genes, randomly generate the values of a single gene across the entire population, and add the values of each gene to the population.
1482                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1483                        # A vector of all values of this single gene across all solutions in the population.
1484                        if 'step' in self.gene_space[gene_idx].keys():
1485                            gene_values = numpy.asarray(
1486                                numpy.random.choice(numpy.arange(start=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['low'],
1487                                                                 stop=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['high'],
1488                                                                 step=self.gene_space[gene_idx]['step']),
1489                                                    size=self.pop_size[0]),
1490                                dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1491                        else:
1492                            gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.uniform(low=self.gene_space['low'],
1493                                                                             high=self.gene_space['high'],
1494                                                                             size=self.pop_size[0]),
1495                                                        dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1496                        # Adding the current gene values to the population.
1497                        self.population[:, gene_idx] = gene_values
1498
1499                else:
1500                    # Create an empty population of dtype=object to support storing mixed data types within the same array.
1501                    self.population = numpy.zeros(shape=self.pop_size, dtype=object)
1502                    # Loop through the genes, randomly generate the values of a single gene across the entire population, and add the values of each gene to the population.
1503                    for gene_idx in range(self.num_genes):
1504                        # A vector of all values of this single gene across all solutions in the population.
1505                        gene_values = numpy.asarray(numpy.random.choice(self.gene_space,
1506                                                                        size=self.pop_size[0]),
1507                                                    dtype=self.gene_type[gene_idx][0])
1508                        # Adding the current gene values to the population.
1509                        self.population[:, gene_idx] = gene_values
1510
1511        if not (self.gene_space is None):
1512            if allow_duplicate_genes == False:
1513                for sol_idx in range(self.population.shape[0]):
1514                    self.population[sol_idx], _, _ = self.solve_duplicate_genes_by_space(
1515                        solution=self.population[sol_idx],
1516                        gene_type=self.gene_type,
1517                        num_trials=10,
1518                        build_initial_pop=True)
1519
1520        # Keeping the initial population in the initial_population attribute.
1521        self.initial_population = self.population.copy()

Creates an initial population randomly as a NumPy array. The array is saved in the instance attribute named 'population'.

low: The lower value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20 and higher. high: The upper value of the random range from which the gene values in the initial population are selected. It defaults to -4. Available in PyGAD 1.0.20.

This method assigns the values of the following 3 instance attributes: 1. pop_size: Size of the population. 2. population: Initially, holds the initial population and later updated after each generation. 3. init_population: Keeping the initial population.

def cal_pop_fitness(self): 
1523    def cal_pop_fitness(self):
1524
1525        """
1526        Calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the current population.
1527        It returns:
1528            -fitness: An array of the calculated fitness values.
1529        """
1530
1531        if self.valid_parameters == False:
1532            raise Exception(
1533                "ERROR calling the cal_pop_fitness() method: \nPlease check the parameters passed while creating an instance of the GA class.\n")
1534
1535        pop_fitness = ["undefined"] * len(self.population)
1536
1537        if self.parallel_processing is None:
1538            # Calculating the fitness value of each solution in the current population.
1539            for sol_idx, sol in enumerate(self.population):
1540
1541                # Check if the `save_solutions` parameter is `True` and whether the solution already exists in the `solutions` list. If so, use its fitness rather than calculating it again.
1542                if (self.save_solutions) and (list(sol) in self.solutions):
1543                    fitness = self.solutions_fitness[self.solutions.index(list(sol))]
1544                # If the solutions are not saved (i.e. `save_solutions=False`), check if this solution is a parent from the previous generation and its fitness value is already calculated. If so, use the fitness value instead of calling the fitness function.
1545                elif (self.last_generation_parents is not None) and len(
1546                        numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0] > 0):
1547                    # Index of the parent in the parents array (self.last_generation_parents). This is not its index within the population.
1548                    parent_idx = numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0][0]
1549                    # Index of the parent in the population.
1550                    parent_idx = self.last_generation_parents_indices[parent_idx]
1551                    # Use the parent's index to return its pre-calculated fitness value.
1552                    fitness = self.previous_generation_fitness[parent_idx]
1553                else:
1554                    fitness = self.fitness_func(sol, sol_idx, self.args)
1555                    if type(fitness) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1556                        pass
1557                    else:
1558                        raise ValueError(
1559                            "The fitness function should return a number but the value {fit_val} of type {fit_type} found.".format(
1560                                fit_val=fitness, fit_type=type(fitness)))
1561                pop_fitness[sol_idx] = fitness
1562        else:
1563
1564            # Calculating the fitness value of each solution in the current population.
1565            for sol_idx, sol in enumerate(self.population):
1566                # Check if the `save_solutions` parameter is `True` and whether the solution already exists in the `solutions` list. If so, use its fitness rather than calculating it again.
1567                if (self.save_solutions) and (list(sol) in self.solutions):
1568                    fitness = self.solutions_fitness[self.solutions.index(list(sol))]
1569                # If the solutions are not saved (i.e. `save_solutions=False`), check if this solution is a parent from the previous generation and its fitness value is already calculated. If so, use the fitness value instead of calling the fitness function.
1570                if not (self.last_generation_parents is None) and len(
1571                        numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0] > 0):
1572                    # Index of the parent in the parents array (self.last_generation_parents). This is not its index within the population.
1573                    parent_idx = numpy.where(numpy.all(self.last_generation_parents == sol, axis=1))[0][0]
1574                    # Index of the parent in the population.
1575                    parent_idx = self.last_generation_parents_indices[parent_idx]
1576                    # Use the parent's index to return its pre-calculated fitness value.
1577                    fitness = self.last_generation_fitness[parent_idx]
1578
1579                    pop_fitness[sol_idx] = fitness
1580
1581            # Decide which class to use based on whether the user selected "process" or "thread"
1582            # if self.parallel_processing[0] == "process":
1583            #     ExecutorClassR = concurrent.futures.ProcessPoolExecutor
1584            # else:
1585            #     ExecutorClassR = concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor
1586
1587            # with multiprocessing.Pool(self.parallel_processing[1]) as pool:
1588
1589            solutions_to_submit_indices = []
1590            solutions_to_submit = []
1591
1592            for sol_idx, sol in enumerate(self.population):
1593                # The "undefined" value means that the fitness of this solution must be calculated.
1594                if pop_fitness[sol_idx] == "undefined":
1595                    solutions_to_submit.append(sol.copy())
1596                    solutions_to_submit_indices.append(sol_idx)
1597
1598            worker = partial(self.fitness_func, args=self.args)
1599
1600            for index, fitness in zip(solutions_to_submit_indices
1601                    , self._pool.starmap(worker
1602                        , zip(solutions_to_submit
1603                            , range(len(solutions_to_submit_indices)))
1604                                   )):
1605                if type(fitness) in GA.supported_int_float_types:
1606                    pop_fitness[index] = fitness
1607                else:
1608                    raise ValueError(
1609                        "The fitness function should return a number but the value {fit_val} of type {fit_type} found.".format(
1610                            fit_val=fitness, fit_type=type(fitness)))
1611
1612        pop_fitness = numpy.array(pop_fitness)
1613
1614        return pop_fitness

Calculating the fitness values of all solutions in the current population. It returns: -fitness: An array of the calculated fitness values.

def run(self): 
1616    def run(self):
1617
1618        """
1619        Runs the genetic algorithm. This is the main method in which the genetic algorithm is evolved through a number of generations.
1620        """
1621
1622        if self.valid_parameters == False:
1623            raise Exception(
1624                "Error calling the run() method: \nThe run() method cannot be executed with invalid parameters. Please check the parameters passed while creating an instance of the GA class.\n")
1625
1626        # Starting from PyGAD 2.18.0, the 4 properties (best_solutions, best_solutions_fitness, solutions, and solutions_fitness) are no longer reset with each call to the run() method. Instead, they are extended.
1627        # For example, if there are 50 generations and the user set save_best_solutions=True, then the length of the 2 properties best_solutions and best_solutions_fitness will be 50 after the first call to the run() method, then 100 after the second call, 150 after the third, and so on.
1628
1629        # self.best_solutions: Holds the best solution in each generation.
1630        if type(self.best_solutions) is numpy.ndarray:
1631            self.best_solutions = list(self.best_solutions)
1632        # self.best_solutions_fitness: A list holding the fitness value of the best solution for each generation.
1633        if type(self.best_solutions_fitness) is numpy.ndarray:
1634            self.best_solutions_fitness = list(self.best_solutions_fitness)
1635        # self.solutions: Holds the solutions in each generation.
1636        if type(self.solutions) is numpy.ndarray:
1637            self.solutions = list(self.solutions)
1638        # self.solutions_fitness: Holds the fitness of the solutions in each generation.
1639        if type(self.solutions_fitness) is numpy.ndarray:
1640            self.solutions_fitness = list(self.solutions_fitness)
1641
1642        if not (self.on_start is None):
1643            self.on_start(self)
1644
1645        stop_run = False
1646
1647        # Measuring the fitness of each chromosome in the population. Save the fitness in the last_generation_fitness attribute.
1648
1649        if self.parallel_processing is None:
1650            self._pool = None
1651        else:
1652            self._pool = multiprocessing.Pool(self.parallel_processing[1])
1653
1654        self.last_generation_fitness = self.cal_pop_fitness()
1655
1656        best_solution, best_solution_fitness, best_match_idx = self.best_solution(
1657            pop_fitness=self.last_generation_fitness)
1658
1659        # Appending the best solution in the initial population to the best_solutions list.
1660        if self.save_best_solutions:
1661            self.best_solutions.append(best_solution)
1662
1663        for generation in range(self.num_generations):
1664            if not (self.on_fitness is None):
1665                self.on_fitness(self, self.last_generation_fitness)
1666
1667            # Appending the fitness value of the best solution in the current generation to the best_solutions_fitness attribute.
1668            self.best_solutions_fitness.append(best_solution_fitness)
1669
1670            # Appending the solutions in the current generation to the solutions list.
1671            if self.save_solutions:
1672                # self.solutions.extend(self.population.copy())
1673                population_as_list = self.population.copy()
1674                population_as_list = [list(item) for item in population_as_list]
1675                self.solutions.extend(population_as_list)
1676
1677                self.solutions_fitness.extend(self.last_generation_fitness)
1678
1679            # Selecting the best parents in the population for mating.
1680            if callable(self.parent_selection_type):
1681                self.last_generation_parents, self.last_generation_parents_indices = self.select_parents(
1682                    self.last_generation_fitness, self.num_parents_mating, self)
1683            else:
1684                self.last_generation_parents, self.last_generation_parents_indices = self.select_parents(
1685                    self.last_generation_fitness, num_parents=self.num_parents_mating)
1686            if not (self.on_parents is None):
1687                self.on_parents(self, self.last_generation_parents)
1688
1689            # If self.crossover_type=None, then no crossover is applied and thus no offspring will be created in the next generations. The next generation will use the solutions in the current population.
1690            if self.crossover_type is None:
1691                if self.keep_elitism == 0:
1692                    num_parents_to_keep = self.num_parents_mating if self.keep_parents == -1 else self.keep_parents
1693                    if self.num_offspring <= num_parents_to_keep:
1694                        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = self.last_generation_parents[0:self.num_offspring]
1695                    else:
1696                        self.last_generation_offspring_crossover = numpy.concatenate((self.last_generation_parents,
