3898                   solutions="all",
3899                   save_dir=None):
3900
3901        """
3902        Creates, shows, and returns a figure with number of subplots equal to the number of genes. Each subplot shows the gene value for each generation.
3903        This method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class.
3904        It also works only after completing at least 1 generation. If no generation is completed, an exception is raised.
3905
3906        Accepts the following:
3907            title: Figure title.
3908            xlabel: Label on the X-axis.
3909            ylabel: Label on the Y-axis.
3910            linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3.
3911            font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14.
3912            plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar".
3913            graph_type: Type of the graph which can be either "plot" (default), "boxplot", or "histogram".
3914            fill_color: Fill color of the graph which defaults to "#3870FF". This has no effect if graph_type="plot".
3915            color: Color of the plot which defaults to "black".
3916            solutions: Defaults to "all" which means use all solutions. If "best" then only the best solutions are used.
3917            save_dir: Directory to save the figure.
3918
3919        Returns the figure.
3920        """
3921
3922        if self.generations_completed < 1:
3923            raise RuntimeError(
3924                "The plot_genes() method can only be called after completing at least 1 generation but ({generations_completed}) is completed.".format(
3925                    generations_completed=self.generations_completed))
3926
3927        if type(solutions) is str:
3928            if solutions == 'all':
3929                if self.save_solutions:
3930                    solutions_to_plot = numpy.array(self.solutions)
3931                else:
3932                    raise RuntimeError(
3933                        "The plot_genes() method with solutions='all' can only be called if 'save_solutions=True' in the pygad.GA class constructor.")
3934            elif solutions == 'best':
3935                if self.save_best_solutions:
3936                    solutions_to_plot = self.best_solutions
3937                else:
3938                    raise RuntimeError(
3939                        "The plot_genes() method with solutions='best' can only be called if 'save_best_solutions=True' in the pygad.GA class constructor.")
3940            else:
3941                raise RuntimeError(
3942                    "The solutions parameter can be either 'all' or 'best' but {solutions} found.".format(
3943                        solutions=solutions))
3944        else:
3945            raise RuntimeError("The solutions parameter must be a string but {solutions_type} found.".format(
3946                solutions_type=type(solutions)))
3947
3948        if graph_type == "plot":
3949            # num_rows will be always be >= 1
3950            # num_cols can only be 0 if num_genes=1
3951            num_rows = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / 5.0))
3952            num_cols = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / num_rows))
3953
3954            if num_cols == 0:
3955                figsize = (10, 8)
3956                # There is only a single gene
3957                fig, ax = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, figsize=figsize)
3958                if plot_type == "plot":
3959                    ax.plot(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3960                elif plot_type == "scatter":
3961                    ax.scatter(range(self.generations_completed + 1), solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth,
3962                               color=fill_color)
3963                elif plot_type == "bar":
3964                    ax.bar(range(self.generations_completed + 1), solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth,
3965                           color=fill_color)
3966                ax.set_xlabel(0, fontsize=font_size)
3967            else:
3968                fig, axs = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, num_cols)
3969
3970                if num_cols == 1 and num_rows == 1:
3971                    fig.set_figwidth(5 * num_cols)
3972                    fig.set_figheight(4)
3973                    axs.plot(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3974                    axs.set_xlabel("Gene " + str(0), fontsize=font_size)
3975                elif num_cols == 1 or num_rows == 1:
3976                    fig.set_figwidth(5 * num_cols)
3977                    fig.set_figheight(4)
3978                    for gene_idx in range(len(axs)):
3979                        if plot_type == "plot":
3980                            axs[gene_idx].plot(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3981                        elif plot_type == "scatter":
3982                            axs[gene_idx].scatter(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]), solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
3983                                                  linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3984                        elif plot_type == "bar":
3985                            axs[gene_idx].bar(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]), solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
3986                                              linewidth=linewidth, color=fill_color)
3987                        axs[gene_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
3988                else:
3989                    gene_idx = 0
3990                    fig.set_figwidth(25)
3991                    fig.set_figheight(4 * num_rows)
3992                    for row_idx in range(num_rows):
3993                        for col_idx in range(num_cols):
3994                            if gene_idx >= self.num_genes:
3995                                # axs[row_idx, col_idx].remove()
3996                                break
3997                            if plot_type == "plot":
3998                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].plot(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
3999                                                           color=fill_color)
4000                            elif plot_type == "scatter":
4001                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].scatter(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]),
4002                                                              solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
4003                                                              color=fill_color)
4004                            elif plot_type == "bar":
4005                                axs[row_idx, col_idx].bar(range(solutions_to_plot.shape[0]),
4006                                                          solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx], linewidth=linewidth,
4007                                                          color=fill_color)
4008                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4009                            gene_idx += 1
4010
4011            fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=font_size, y=1.001)
4012            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4013
4014        elif graph_type == "boxplot":
4015            fig = matplotlib.pyplot.figure(1, figsize=(0.7 * self.num_genes, 6))
4016
4017            # Create an axes instance
4018            ax = fig.add_subplot(111)
4019            boxeplots = ax.boxplot(solutions_to_plot,
4020                                   labels=range(self.num_genes),
4021                                   patch_artist=True)
4022            # adding horizontal grid lines
4023            ax.yaxis.grid(True)
4024
4025            for box in boxeplots['boxes']:
4026                # change outline color
4027                box.set(color='black', linewidth=linewidth)
4028                # change fill color https://color.adobe.com/create/color-wheel
4029                box.set_facecolor(fill_color)
4030
4031            for whisker in boxeplots['whiskers']:
4032                whisker.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4033            for median in boxeplots['medians']:
4034                median.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4035            for cap in boxeplots['caps']:
4036                cap.set(color=color, linewidth=linewidth)
4037
4038            matplotlib.pyplot.title(title, fontsize=font_size)
4039            matplotlib.pyplot.xlabel(xlabel, fontsize=font_size)
4040            matplotlib.pyplot.ylabel(ylabel, fontsize=font_size)
4041            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4042
4043        elif graph_type == "histogram":
4044            # num_rows will be always be >= 1
4045            # num_cols can only be 0 if num_genes=1
4046            num_rows = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / 5.0))
4047            num_cols = int(numpy.ceil(self.num_genes / num_rows))
4048
4049            if num_cols == 0:
4050                figsize = (10, 8)
4051                # There is only a single gene
4052                fig, ax = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows,
4053                                                     figsize=figsize)
4054                ax.hist(solutions_to_plot[:, 0], color=fill_color)
4055                ax.set_xlabel(0, fontsize=font_size)
4056            else:
4057                fig, axs = matplotlib.pyplot.subplots(num_rows, num_cols)
4058
4059                if num_cols == 1 and num_rows == 1:
4060                    fig.set_figwidth(4 * num_cols)
4061                    fig.set_figheight(3)
4062                    axs.hist(solutions_to_plot[:, 0],
4063                             color=fill_color,
4064                             rwidth=0.95)
4065                    axs.set_xlabel("Gene " + str(0), fontsize=font_size)
4066                elif num_cols == 1 or num_rows == 1:
4067                    fig.set_figwidth(4 * num_cols)
4068                    fig.set_figheight(3)
4069                    for gene_idx in range(len(axs)):
4070                        axs[gene_idx].hist(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
4071                                           color=fill_color,
4072                                           rwidth=0.95)
4073                        axs[gene_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4074                else:
4075                    gene_idx = 0
4076                    fig.set_figwidth(20)
4077                    fig.set_figheight(3 * num_rows)
4078                    for row_idx in range(num_rows):
4079                        for col_idx in range(num_cols):
4080                            if gene_idx >= self.num_genes:
4081                                # axs[row_idx, col_idx].remove()
4082                                break
4083                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].hist(solutions_to_plot[:, gene_idx],
4084                                                       color=fill_color,
4085                                                       rwidth=0.95)
4086                            axs[row_idx, col_idx].set_xlabel("Gene " + str(gene_idx), fontsize=font_size)
4087                            gene_idx += 1
4088
4089            fig.suptitle(title, fontsize=font_size, y=1.001)
4090            matplotlib.pyplot.tight_layout()
4091
4092        if not save_dir is None:
4093            matplotlib.pyplot.savefig(fname=save_dir,
4094                                      bbox_inches='tight')
4095
4096        matplotlib.pyplot.show()
4097
4098        return fig

Creates, shows, and returns a figure with number of subplots equal to the number of genes. Each subplot shows the gene value for each generation. This method works only when save_solutions=True in the constructor of the pygad.GA class. It also works only after completing at least 1 generation. If no generation is completed, an exception is raised.

Accepts the following: title: Figure title. xlabel: Label on the X-axis. ylabel: Label on the Y-axis. linewidth: Line width of the plot. Defaults to 3. font_size: Font size for the labels and title. Defaults to 14. plot_type: Type of the plot which can be either "plot" (default), "scatter", or "bar". graph_type: Type of the graph which can be either "plot" (default), "boxplot", or "histogram". fill_color: Fill color of the graph which defaults to "#3870FF". This has no effect if graph_type="plot". color: Color of the plot which defaults to "black". solutions: Defaults to "all" which means use all solutions. If "best" then only the best solutions are used. save_dir: Directory to save the figure.

Returns the figure.

def close_parallel(self): 
4101    def close_parallel(self):
4102        if self.parallel_processing is not None:
4103            # print('before close')
4104            self._pool.close()
4105            # print('after close')
4106            self._pool.join()
4107            # print('after join')
4108            self._pool.terminate()
4109            # print('after terminate')
def save(self, filename): 
4111    def save(self, filename):
4112
4113        """
4114        Saves the genetic algorithm instance:
4115            -filename: Name of the file to save the instance. No extension is needed.
4116        """
4117
4118        with open(filename + ".pkl", 'wb') as file:
4119            pickle.dump(self, file)

Saves the genetic algorithm instance: -filename: Name of the file to save the instance. No extension is needed.

def load(filename): 
4122def load(filename):
4123    """
4124    Reads a saved instance of the genetic algorithm:
4125        -filename: Name of the file to read the instance. No extension is needed.
4126    Returns the genetic algorithm instance.
4127    """
4128
4129    try:
4130        with open(filename + ".pkl", 'rb') as file:
4131            ga_in = pickle.load(file)
4132    except FileNotFoundError:
4133        raise FileNotFoundError(
4134            "Error reading the file {filename}. Please check your inputs.".format(filename=filename))
4135    except:
4136        raise BaseException(
4137            "Error loading the file. If the file already exists, please reload all the functions previously used (e.g. fitness function).")
4138    return ga_in

Reads a saved instance of the genetic algorithm: -filename: Name of the file to read the instance. No extension is needed. Returns the genetic algorithm instance.
